Text

﻿MILLY AND [OLLY BY

MRS . HUMPHRY WARD]53-olly by mrs . humphry ward DEDICATION

TO [F.A.]1-f.a. , IN THE NAME OF [THE CHILDREN OF FOX]54-the children of fox HOW , [THIS REVIVAL OF]148-this revival of [A CHILD]149-a child 'S STORY WRITTEN TWENTY - SEVEN YEARS AGO , UNDER THE SPELL OF [ROTHA]2-rotha AND [FAIRFIELD]3-fairfield , IS INSCRIBED BY [THE WRITER]150-the writer .

PREFACE

After many years this little book is once more to see the light . [The children for whom it was written]151-the children for whom it was written are long since grown up . But perhaps the pleasure [they]151-the children for whom it was written once took in it may still be felt by some of [the Millys]55-the millys and Ollys of to - day . Up in [the dear mountain country which it describes]152-the dear mountain country which it describes , [the becks]153-the becks are still sparkling ; " Brownholme "[56-wordsworth] still spreads [its]154-its green steeps and [ferny hollows]155-ferny hollows under rain and sun ; the tiny trout still leap in [its]154-its tiny streams ; and [Fairfield]3-fairfield , in [its]3-fairfield noble curve , still girdles [the deep valley]156-the deep valley where [these children]157-these children played : [the valley of [Wordsworth]56-wordsworth and [Arnold]57-arnold]158-the valley of wordsworth and arnold -- [the valley where [[Arnold]57-arnold 's poet - son]160-arnold 's poet - son rambled as [a boy]161-a boy -- where , for [me]0-i , [the shy and passionate ghost of [Charlotte Brontë]58-charlotte brontë]162-the shy and passionate ghost of charlotte brontë still haunts the open door - way of [Fox]54-the children of fox How -- where poetry and generous life and ranging thought still dwell , and bring [their]157-these children benediction to [the passers - by]163-the passers - by]159-the valley where arnold 's poet - son rambled as a boy -- where , for me , the shy and passionate ghost of charlotte brontë still haunts the open door - way of fox how -- where poetry and generous life and ranging thought still dwell , and bring their benediction to the passers - by . " [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma "[164-her] in [[her]164-her beautiful home]165-her beautiful home , unchanged but for [its]165-her beautiful home vacant chairs , is now as [she]164-her ever was , [the friend of old and young]166-the friend of old and young ; and [the children of to - day]167-the children of to - day still press to [her]164-her side as [[their]167-the children of to - day elders]168-their elders did before [them]167-the children of to - day . The parrot alas ! is gone where parrots may ; but amid the voices that breathe around [Fox How]54-the children of fox -- the voices of seventy years -- [his]54-the children of fox mimic speech is still remembered by [the children who teased and loved [him]54-the children of fox]169-the children who teased and loved him . For love , while love lasts , gives life to all things small and great ; and in [those who have once felt it]170-those who have once felt it , the love of [the [Fairfield]3-fairfield valley]171-the fairfield valley , of [the gray stone house that fronts [the fells]173-the fells , and of [them]174-them that dwell therein]172-the gray stone house that fronts the fells , and of them that dwell therein , is " not Time 's fool-- "[83-milly]

" Or bends with the remover to remove . "[83-milly]

[MARY A. WARD]60-mary a. ward .

September 18 , 1907 . CHAPTER [I]0-i

MAKING PLANS

" [Milly]83-milly , come down ! come down directly ! [Mother]62-mother wants [you]83-milly . Do make haste ! "[83-milly]

" [I]83-milly 'm just coming , [Olly]63-olly . Do n't stamp so . [Nurse]1496-nurse is tying [my]83-milly sash . "[83-milly]

But [Master Olly]63-olly went on stamping , and jumping up and down [stairs]175-stairs , as [his]63-olly way was when [he]63-olly was very much excited , till [Milly]83-milly appeared . Presently down [she]83-milly came , [a sober fair - haired little maiden , with blue eyes and a turn - up nose , and a mouth that was generally rather solemn]176-a sober fair - haired little maiden , with blue eyes and a turn - up nose , and a mouth that was generally rather solemn - looking , though it could laugh merrily enough when it tried . [Milly]83-milly was six years old . [She]83-milly looked older than six . At any rate [she]83-milly looked a great deal older than [Olly]63-olly , who was nearly five ; and [you]177-you will soon find out that [she]83-milly was a good deal more than a year and a half wiser .

" What 's the matter , [Olly]63-olly ? What made [you]63-olly shout so ? "[83-milly]

" Oh , come along , come along ; "[178-the little boy] said [the little boy]178-the little boy , pulling at [[his]178-the little boy sister]179-his sister 's hand to make [her]179-his sister run . " [Mother]62-mother wants to tell [us]180-the two children something , and [she]62-mother says it 's a nice something , and [I]178-the little boy kissed [her]62-mother like anyfing ! but [she]62-mother would n't tell [me]178-the little boy without [you]63-olly . "[178-the little boy]

Then [the two children]180-the two children set off running , and [they]180-the two children flew down [a long passage]181-a long passage to [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room , and were soon scrambling about [a lady who was sitting working by the window]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window .

" Well , [monkeys]1497-monkeys , do n't choke [me]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window before [I]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window tell [you]1497-monkeys [my]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window nice something . Sit on [my]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window knee [Olly]63-olly . Now , [Milly]83-milly , guess -- what have [father]1498-father and [I]183-a lady who was sitting working by the window just been talking about ? "[183-a lady who was sitting working by the window]

" Sending [Olly]63-olly to [school]1499-school , perhaps , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " [I]83-milly heard [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard talking about it yesterday . "[83-milly]

" That would n't be such a nice something , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , making a long face . " [I]63-olly would n't like it -- not a bit . [Boys]1500-boys do n't never like going to [school]1499-school . [I]63-olly want to learn [my]63-olly lessons with [mother]1502-mother . "[63-olly]

" [I]184-the lady know [a little boy that does n't like learning lessons with [mother]1502-mother]1503-a little boy that does n't like learning lessons with mother very much , "[184-the lady] said [the lady]184-the lady , laughing . " But [my]184-the lady nice something is n't sending [Olly]63-olly to [school]1499-school , [Milly]83-milly . [You]83-milly 're quite wrong -- so try again . "[184-the lady]

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother ! is it a strawberry tea ? "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly . " The strawberries are just ripe , [I]83-milly know . [Gardener]65-gardener told [nurse]1496-nurse so this morning . And [we]1508-we can have tea on the lawn , and ask [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis ! "[83-milly]

" Oh , jolly ! "[68-oliver] said [Oliver]68-oliver , jumping off [[his]68-oliver mother]185-his mother 's knee and beginning to dance about . " And [we]1508-we 'll gather them [ourselves]1508-we -- won't [you]1502-mother let [us]1508-we , [mother]1502-mother ? "[68-oliver]

" But it is n't a strawberry tea even , "[185-his mother] said [[his]68-oliver mother]185-his mother . " Now , look here , [children]1510-children , what have [I]185-his mother got here ? "[185-his mother]

" It 's a map -- a map of [England]4-england , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , looking very wise . [Milly]83-milly had just begun to learn geography , and thought [she]83-milly knew all about maps .

" Well , and what happens when [father]1498-father and [I]185-his mother look at maps in the summertime ? "[185-his mother]

" Why , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , slowly , " [you]63-olly and [father]1498-father pack up [your]63-olly things , and go away over [the sea]1513-the sea , and [we]1514-we stay behind with [nurse]1496-nurse . "[83-milly]

" [I]63-olly do n't call _ that _ a nice something , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , standing still again .

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother , _ are _ [you]1502-mother going away ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , hanging round [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother 's neck .

" Yes , [Milly]83-milly , and so 's [father]1498-father , and so 's nurse"--and[189-their mother] [[their]188-we mother]189-their mother began to laugh .

" [So 's nurse]1518-so 's nurse ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly together , and then [they]188-we stopped and opened two pairs of round eyes very wide , and stared at [[their]188-we mother]189-their mother . " Oh , [mother]1502-mother , [mother]1502-mother , take [us]188-we too ! "[188-we]

" Why , how should [father]1498-father and [I]189-their mother get on , travelling about with a pair of monkeys ? "[189-their mother] said [[their]188-we mother]189-their mother , catching hold of [the two children]180-the two children and lifting [them]180-the two children on to [her]189-their mother knee ; " [we]188-we should want a cage to keep [them]180-the two children in . "[189-their mother]

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother , [we]188-we 'll be _ ever _ so good ! But where are [we]188-we going ? Oh , do take [us]188-we to [the sea]1513-the sea ! "[188-we]

" Yes , [the sea]1513-the sea ! [the sea]1513-the sea ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , careering round [the room]193-the room again ; " [we]188-we 'll have buckets and spades , and [we]188-we 'll paddle and catch crabbies , and wet [our]188-we clothes , and have funny shoes , just like [Cromer]69-cromer . And father'll teach [me]63-olly to swim -- [he]1526-he said [he]1526-he would next time . "[63-olly]

" No , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , for that was the name of [Milly]83-milly 's and [[Oliver]68-oliver 's mother]194-oliver 's mother . " No , [we]188-we are not going to [the sea]1513-the sea this summer . [We]188-we are going to [a place [mother]1502-mother loves better than [the sea]1513-the sea]1528-a place mother loves better than the sea , though perhaps [[you]1531-you [children]1510-children]1532-you children may n't like it quite so well . [We]188-we 're going to [the mountains]1534-the mountains . [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard has lent [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother [[his]64-uncle richard own nice house]1537-his own nice house among [the mountains]1534-the mountains and [we]188-we 're all going [there]1539-there next week -- such a long way in [the train]1540-the train , [Milly]83-milly . "[70-mrs. norton]

" What are mountains ? "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who had scarcely ever seen [a hill higher than [the church steeple]196-the church steeple]195-a hill higher than the church steeple . " They ca n't be so nice as [the sea]1513-the sea , [mother]1502-mother . Nothing can . "[63-olly]

" [They]1534-the mountains 're humps , [Olly]63-olly , "[83-milly] answered [Milly]83-milly eagerly . " Great , big humps of earth , [you]63-olly know ; earth mixed with stone . And they reach up ever so high , up into the sky . And it takes [you]63-olly a whole day to get up to the top of them , and a whole day to get down again . Does n't it , [mother]1502-mother ? [Fräulein]71-fräulein told [me]83-milly all about mountains in [my]83-milly geography . And [some mountains]1544-some mountains have got snow on their tops all year , even in summer , when it 's so hot , and [we]188-we 're having strawberries . Will [the mountains [we]188-we 're going to]1545-the mountains we 're going to , have snow on them ? "[83-milly]

" Oh , no . The snow mountains are far away over [the sea]1513-the sea . But these are [English mountains]1547-english mountains , kind , easy mountains , not too high for [you]63-olly and [me]63-olly to climb up , and covered all over with soft green grass and wild flowers , and tiny sheep with black faces . "[63-olly]

" And , [mother]1502-mother , is there [a garden to [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's house]1549-a garden to uncle richard 's house , and are there any [children there to play with]1550-children there to play with ? "[83-milly]

" There 's [a delightful garden , full of roses , and strawberries and grapes]1551-a delightful garden , full of roses , and strawberries and grapes , and everything else that 's nice . And [it]1551-a delightful garden , full of roses , and strawberries and grapes has [a baby river all to itself , that runs and jumps and chatters all through the middle of [it]1551-a delightful garden , full of roses , and strawberries and grapes]1552-a baby river all to itself , that runs and jumps and chatters all through the middle of it , so perhaps [Olly]63-olly may have a paddle sometimes , though [we]188-we are n't going to [the sea]1513-the sea . And [the gardener]1554-the gardener has got [two little children]1555-two little children , just about [your]63-olly age , [Aunt Mary]72-polly says : and there are two more at [the farm]1556-the farm , [two dear little girls]1557-two dear little girls , who are n't a bit shy , and will like playing with [you]63-olly very much . But who else shall [we]188-we see there , [Milly]83-milly ? Who lives in [the mountains]1534-the mountains too , near [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard ? "[63-olly]

[Olly]63-olly looked puzzled , but [Milly]83-milly thought a minute , and then said quickly , " [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , is n't it , [mother]1502-mother ? Did n't [she]59-aunt emma come [here]1560-here once ? [I]83-milly think [I]83-milly remember . "[83-milly]

" Yes , [she]59-aunt emma came once , but long ago , when [you]63-olly were quite small . But now [we]188-we shall see a great deal of [her]59-aunt emma [I]63-olly hope , for [she]59-aunt emma lives just on the other side of [the mountain]1561-the mountain from [[Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's house]1562-uncle richard 's house , in [a dear old house]1563-a dear old house , where [I]63-olly spent many , many happy days when [I]63-olly was small . [Great - grandpapa]1564-great - grandpapa and [grandmamma]1565-grandmamma were alive then . But now [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma lives [there]1539-there quite alone . Except for one creature , at least , an old gray poll - parrot , that chatters away , and behaves as if it were quite sensible , and knew all about everything . "[63-olly]

" Has n't [she]59-aunt emma got any pussies , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" Yes , two [I]63-olly believe ; but [they]1568-they do n't get on with [Polly]72-polly very well , so [they]1568-they live in [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen out of the way-- "[63-olly]

" [I]63-olly like pussies better than pollies , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly gravely .

" Why , what do [you]63-olly know about [pollies]1570-pollies , [old man]1571-old man ? "[63-olly]

" [Pollies]73-pollies bite , [I]63-olly know [they]73-pollies do . There was [a polly]1572-a polly bited [Francis]67-francis once . "[63-olly]

" Well , and pussies scratch , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly .

" No , [they]73-pollies do n't , not if [you]63-olly 're nicey to [them]73-pollies , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly ; who was just then very much in love with a white kitten , and thought there were [no creatures so delightful as pussies]197-no creatures so delightful as pussies .

" Well , suppose [you]63-olly do n't make up [your]63-olly mind about [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's [Polly]72-polly till [you]63-olly 've seen [her]72-polly , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " Now sit down on the rug there and let [us]1573-us have a talk . "[70-mrs. norton]

[Down]74-down squatted [the children]198-the children on the floor opposite [[their]198-the children mother]189-their mother , with [their]198-the children little heads full of plans and [their]198-the children eyes as bright as sparks .

" [I]63-olly 'll take [my]63-olly cart and horse , "[63-olly] began [Olly]63-olly ; " and [my]63-olly big ball , and [my]63-olly whistle , and [my]63-olly wheelbarrow , and [my]63-olly spade , and all [my]63-olly books , and the big scrap - book , and-- "[63-olly]

" [You]63-olly ca n't , [Olly]63-olly , "[83-milly] exclaimed [Milly]83-milly . " [Nurse]75-nurse could never pack all those up . There 'd be no room for [our]1574-our clothes . [You]63-olly can take [your]63-olly whistle , and the top , and the picture books , and [I]83-milly can take [my]83-milly dolls . That 'll be quite enough , wo n't it , [mother]1502-mother ? "[83-milly]

" Quite enough , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " If it 's fine weather [you]63-olly 'll see -- [you]63-olly wo n't want any toys . But now , look here , [children]1510-children , "[70-mrs. norton] and [she]70-mrs. norton held up the map . " Shall [I]70-mrs. norton show [you]1510-children how [we]1574-our are going to get to [the mountains]1534-the mountains ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh yes , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " that 'll be like [my]83-milly geography lesson -- come , [Olly]63-olly . Now [mother'll]1578-mother'll teach _ [you]63-olly _ geography , like [Fräulein]71-fräulein does [me]83-milly . "[83-milly]

" That 's lessons , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , with half a pout , " not fun a bit . It 's only [girls like lessons]1579-girls like lessons -- [Boys]1500-boys never do -- [Jacky]66-john backhouse does n't , and [Francis]67-francis does n't , and [I]63-olly do n't . "[63-olly]

" Never mind about it 's being lessons , [Olly]63-olly . Come and see if it is n't interesting , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " Now , [Milly]83-milly , find [Willingham]5-willingham . "[70-mrs. norton]

[Willingham]5-willingham was the name of [the town where [Milly]83-milly and [Oliver]68-oliver lived]200-the town where milly and oliver lived . [It]5-willingham is [a little town]201-a little town in [Oxfordshire]6-oxfordshire , and if [you]202-you look long enough on the map [you]202-you _ may _ find it , though [I]0-i wo n't promise [you]202-you .

" There it is , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly triumphantly , showing it to [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother and [Olly]63-olly .

" Quite right . Now look here , "[70-mrs. norton] and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton took a pencil out of [her]70-mrs. norton pocket and drew a little line along the map . " First of all [we]1581-we shall get into [the train]1540-the train and go to a place called -- look , [Milly]83-milly . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Bletchley , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , following where the pencil pointed . " What an ugly name . "[83-milly]

" [It]1583-it 's [an ugly place]1584-an ugly place , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " so perhaps it does n't deserve a better name . And after [Bletchley]7-bletchley -- look again , [Milly]83-milly . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [Rugby]8-rugby , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , reading the names as [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother pointed , " and then [Stafford]9-stafford , and then [Crewe]10-crewe -- what a funny name , mother!--and then [Wigan]11-wigan , and then [Warrington]12-warrington , and then [Lancaster]13-lancaster . [Ox - en - holme]14-ox - en - holme , [Kendal]15-kendal , [Wind - er - mere]16-wind - er - mere . Oh , [mother]1502-mother , what a long way ! Why , [we]1586-we 've got right to [the top of [England]4-england]1587-the top of england . "[83-milly]

" Stop a bit , [Milly]83-milly , and let [me]198-the children tell [you]83-milly something about [these places]1588-these places . First of all [we]1586-we shall get out of [the train]1540-the train at [Bletchley]7-bletchley , and get into [another train that will go faster than the first]1590-another train that will go faster than the first . And it will take [us]1586-we past all kinds of places , some pretty and some ugly , and some big and some small . At [Stafford]9-stafford there is [an old castle]1591-an old castle , [Milly]83-milly , where [fierce people]1592-fierce people lived in old days and fought [[their]1592-fierce people neighbours]1593-their neighbours . And at [Crewe]10-crewe [we]1586-we shall get out and have [our]1586-we dinner . And at [Wigan]11-wigan all the trees grow on one side as if [some one]1594-some one had come and given [them]1588-these places a push in the night ; and at [Lancaster]13-lancaster there 's [another old castle]1595-another old castle , [a very famous one]1596-a very famous one , only now [they]1592-fierce people have turned [it]1595-another old castle into [a prison]1597-a prison , and [people]1598-people are shut up inside [it]1595-another old castle . Then a little way after [Lancaster]13-lancaster [you]1599-you 'll begin to see [some mountains]1544-some mountains , far , far away , but first [you]1599-you 'll see something else -- just a little bit of blue sea , with mountains on the other side of it . And then will come [Windermere]18-windermere , where [we]1586-we shall get out and drive in [a carriage]1601-a carriage . And [we]1586-we shall drive right into [the mountains]1534-the mountains , [Olly]63-olly , till [they]1534-the mountains stand up all round [us]1586-we with [their]1534-the mountains dear kind old faces that [mother]1502-mother has loved ever since [she]189-their mother was [a baby]1604-a baby . "[198-the children]

[The children]198-the children looked up wonderingly at [[their]198-the children mother]189-their mother , and [they]198-the children saw [her]189-their mother face shining and [her]189-their mother eyes as bright as [theirs]198-the children , as if [she]189-their mother too was [a child going out for a holiday]207-a child going out for a holiday .

" Oh ! And , [mother]1502-mother , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " [you]1502-mother 'll let [us]1586-we take [Spot]77-spot . [She]77-spot can go in [my]63-olly box . "[63-olly]

Now [Spot]77-spot was the white kitten , so [Milly]83-milly and [mother]1502-mother began to laugh .

" Suppose [you]63-olly go and ask [Spot]77-spot first , whether [she]77-spot 'd like it , [Olly]63-olly , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , patting [his]63-olly sunburnt little face .

CHAPTER II

A JOURNEY NORTH

[Milly]83-milly and [Oliver]68-oliver lived at [Willingham]5-willingham , [a little town]201-a little town in [Oxfordshire]6-oxfordshire , as [I]0-i have already told [you]210-you . [[Their]211-them father]212-their father was [a doctor]213-a doctor , and [they]211-them lived in [an old - fashioned house]214-an old - fashioned house , in [a street]215-a street , with a long shady garden stretching away behind [it]214-an old - fashioned house . [Milly]83-milly and [Oliver]68-oliver loved [[their]211-them father]212-their father , and whenever [he]212-their father put [his]212-their father brown face inside the nursery door , two pairs of little feet went running to meet [him]212-their father , and two pairs of little hands pulled [him]212-their father eagerly into [the room]193-the room . But [they]211-them saw [him]212-their father very seldom ; whereas [[their]211-them mother]189-their mother was always with [them]211-them , teaching [them]211-them [their]211-them lessons , playing with [them]211-them in [the garden]219-the garden , telling [them]211-them stories , mending [their]211-them frocks , tucking [them]211-them up in [their]211-them snug little beds at night , sometimes praising [them]211-them , sometimes scolding [them]211-them ; always loving and looking after [them]211-them . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly honestly believed that [theirs]211-them was [the best mother in [the whole world]221-the whole world]220-the best mother in the whole world . [Nobody else]222-nobody else could find out such nice plays , or tell [them]211-them such wonderful stories , or dress dolls half so well . [Two little neighbours of [theirs]211-them]223-two little neighbours of theirs , [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis , had [a poor sick mother who always lay on the sofa , and could hardly bear to have [[her]224-a poor sick mother who always lay on the sofa , and could hardly bear to have her little boys in the room with her little boys]225-her little boys in [the room]193-the room with [her]224-a poor sick mother who always lay on the sofa , and could hardly bear to have her little boys in the room with her]224-a poor sick mother who always lay on the sofa , and could hardly bear to have her little boys in the room with her . [Milly]83-milly and [Oliver]68-oliver were never tired of wondering how [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis got on with [a mother like that]227-a mother like that . " How funny , and how dreadful it must be . [Poor Jacky]78-johnny and [Francis]67-francis ! "[67-francis] It never came into [their]211-them , heads to say , " [Poor [Jacky]66-john backhouse 's mother]1606-poor jacky 's mother "[67-francis] too , but then [you]228-you see [they]211-them were [such little people]229-such little people , and [little people]230-little people have only room in [their]230-little people heads for a very few thoughts at a time .

However , [Milly]83-milly had been away from [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother a good deal lately . About six months before [my]0-i story begins [she]83-milly had been sent to [school]1499-school , to [a kindergarten]233-a kindergarten , as [she]83-milly was taught to call it . And there [Milly]83-milly had learnt all kinds of wonderful things -- [she]83-milly had learnt how to make mats out of paper , blue mats , and pink mats , and yellow mats , and red mats ; [she]83-milly had learned how to make a bit of soft clay look like a box , or a stool , or a bird 's nest with three clay eggs inside it ; [she]83-milly had begun to add up and take away ; and , above all , [she]83-milly had begun to learn geography , and Fräulein -- for [[Milly]83-milly 's mistress]234-milly 's mistress was [a German]235-a german , and had a German name -- was just now teaching [her]83-milly about [islands]236-islands , and [lakes]237-lakes , and capes , and [peninsulas]238-peninsulas , and many other things that [all little girls]239-all little girls have to learn about some time or other , unless [they]239-all little girls wish to grow up dunces .

As for [Milly]83-milly 's looks , [I]0-i have told [you]240-you already that [she]83-milly had blue eyes and a turn - up nose , and a dear sensible little face . And [she]83-milly had very thick fair hair , that was always tumbling about [her]83-milly eyes , and making [her]83-milly look , as [nurse]1496-nurse told [her]83-milly , like " a yellow owl in an ivy bush . "[83-milly] [Milly]83-milly loved [most people]242-most people , except perhaps [[John]66-john backhouse the gardener , who was rather cross to [the children]198-the children]243-john the gardener , who was rather cross to the children , and was always calling to [them]198-the children not to walk " on [them]198-the children beds , "[243-john the gardener , who was rather cross to the children] and to be sure not to touch any of [his]66-john backhouse fruit or flowers . [She]83-milly loved [[her]83-milly father]245-her father and [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother ; [she]83-milly loved [Olly]63-olly with all [her]83-milly whole heart , though [he]63-olly was [a tease]247-a tease , [she]83-milly loved [[her]83-milly nurse , whom [she]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly called [Nana]79-nana , and who had been with [them]249-them ever since [Milly]83-milly was born]248-her nurse , whom she and olly called nana , and who had been with them ever since milly was born ; and [she]83-milly loved [Fräulein]71-fräulein , and was always begging flowers from [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother that [she]187-her mother might take them to [school]1499-school for [[Fräulein]71-fräulein 's table]252-fräulein 's table . So [you]253-you see [Milly]83-milly was made up of loving . And [she]83-milly was [a thoughtful little girl]254-a thoughtful little girl too , tidy with [her]83-milly dress , quick and quiet at [her]83-milly lessons , and always ready to sit still with [her]83-milly fairy - book or [her]83-milly doll , when [mother]1502-mother was busy or tired . But there were two things in which [Milly]83-milly was not at all sensible in spite of [her]83-milly sensible face . [She]83-milly was much too ready to cry when any little thing went wrong , and [she]83-milly was dreadfully afraid of creatures of all sorts . [She]83-milly was afraid of [[her]83-milly father]245-her father 's big dog , [she]83-milly was afraid of the dear brown cow that lived in [the field beyond [the garden]219-the garden]257-the field beyond the garden , [she]83-milly was afraid of earwigs . [I]0-i am even ashamed to say [she]83-milly was afraid of spiders . Once [she]83-milly ran away as if a lion were behind [her]83-milly from a white kitten that pulled [her]83-milly dress with its frolicsome paws to make [her]83-milly play with it ; but that , [Milly]83-milly would tell [you]259-you , was " when [I]83-milly was little , "[83-milly] and [she]83-milly was quite sure [she]83-milly was a good deal braver now .

Now what am [I]0-i to tell [you]259-you about [Olly]63-olly ?

[Olly]63-olly was just a round ball of fun and mischief . [He]63-olly had brown hair , brown eyes , a brown face , and brown hands . [He]63-olly was always touching and meddling with everything , indoors and out , to see what was inside it , or what it was made of . [He]63-olly liked teasing [Milly]83-milly , [he]63-olly liked [his]63-olly walks , [he]63-olly liked [his]63-olly sleep in the morning , [he]63-olly liked [his]63-olly dinner , [he]63-olly liked [his]63-olly tea , [he]63-olly liked everything in [the world]260-the world , except learning to read , and that [he]63-olly hated . [He]63-olly could only do one thing besides mischief . [He]63-olly could sing all kinds of tunes -- quick tunes , slow tunes , and merry tunes . [He]63-olly had been able to sing tunes ever since [he]63-olly was quite [a tiny baby]261-a tiny baby , and [[his]63-olly father]262-his father and [mother]1502-mother often talked together of how , in about a year , [he]63-olly should be taught to play on the piano , or perhaps on the violin , if [he]63-olly liked it better . [You]264-you might hear [his]63-olly sharp , shrill little voice , singing about [the house]265-the house and [the garden]219-the garden all day long . [John]66-john backhouse [the gardener]1554-the gardener called it " squealin ' , "[66-john backhouse] and told [Olly]63-olly [his]63-olly songs were " capital good "[1554-the gardener] for frightening away the birds .

Now , perhaps , [you]264-you know a little more about [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly than [you]264-you did when [I]0-i began to tell [you]264-you about [them]268-them , and it is time [you]264-you should hear of what happened to [them]268-them on that wonderful journey of [theirs]268-them up to [the mountains]1534-the mountains .

First of all came the packing up . [Milly]83-milly could not make up [her]83-milly mind about [her]83-milly dolls ; [she]83-milly had three -- [Rose]80-rose , [Mattie]81-mattie , and [Katie]82-katie -- but [Rose]80-rose 's frocks were very dirty , [Mattie]81-mattie had a leg broken , and [Katie]82-katie 's paint had been all washed off one wet night , when [Olly]63-olly left [her]82-katie out on [the lawn]270-the lawn . Now which of these was the tidiest and most respectable doll to take out on a visit ? [Milly]83-milly did not know how to settle it .

[ Illustration : " ' [I]1496-nurse ca n't do without [my]1496-nurse toys , [Nana]79-nana ' "[1496-nurse] ]

" [I]83-milly think , [Nana]79-nana , "[83-milly] [she]83-milly said at last to [[her]83-milly nurse]271-her nurse , who was packing [the children]198-the children 's trunk , " [I]83-milly will take [Katie]82-katie . [Mother]62-mother always sends [us]1607-us away when [we]1607-us get white faces to make [us]1607-us look nice and red again ; so , perhaps , if [I]83-milly take [Katie]82-katie [her]82-katie colour will come back too , [you]79-nana know . "[83-milly]

" Perhaps it will , [Miss Milly]83-milly , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , laughing ; " anyhow , [you]83-milly had better give [me]1496-nurse the doll [you]83-milly want directly , for it is time [I]1496-nurse packed all the toys now . Now , [Master Olly]63-olly , [you]83-milly know [I]1496-nurse ca n't let [you]83-milly take all those things . "[1496-nurse]

For there was [Olly]63-olly dragging along [his]63-olly wheelbarrow heaped up with toys with one hand , and [[his]63-olly cart]274-his cart and horse with a box of bricks standing up in it with the other . [He]63-olly would not listen to what [Milly]83-milly said about it , and [he]63-olly would scarcely listen to [nurse]1496-nurse now .

" [I]1496-nurse ca n't do without [my]1496-nurse toys , [Nana]79-nana . [I]1496-nurse _ must _ do mischief if [you]79-nana wo n't let [me]1496-nurse take all [my]1496-nurse toys ; [I]1496-nurse ca n't help it . "[1496-nurse]

" [I]1496-nurse have n't got room for half those , [Master Olly]63-olly , and [you]63-olly 'll have ever so many new things to play with when [we]1608-we get to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest . "[1496-nurse]

" There 'll be [the new children]1609-the new children , [Olly]63-olly , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " and the little rivers and all the funny new flowers . "[83-milly]

" Those are n't toys , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , looking ready to cry . " [I]63-olly do n't know nothing about them . "[63-olly]

" Now , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , making a place in the box , " bring [me]1496-nurse [your]63-olly bricks and [your]63-olly big ball , and [your]63-olly picture - books . There , that 's all [I]1496-nurse can spare [you]63-olly . "[1496-nurse]

" Wait one minute , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , rushing off ; and just then [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton called [nurse]1496-nurse away to speak to [her]1496-nurse in [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room . When [nurse]1496-nurse came back [she]1496-nurse saw [nobody]280-nobody in [the nursery]281-the nursery . [Milly]83-milly had gone out in [the garden]219-the garden , [Olly]63-olly was nowhere to be seen . And who had shut down the trunk , which was open when [she]83-milly left it ? [Me]0-i - ow , sounded very softly from somewhere close by .

" Why -- Spot ! [Spot]77-spot ! "[1496-nurse] called [nurse]1496-nurse .

[Me]0-i - ow , [Me]0-i - ow , came again ; [a sad choky little mew]284-a sad choky little mew , right from the middle of [the children]198-the children 's trunk . " [Master Olly]63-olly and [his]63-olly tricks again , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , running to the box and opening it . There , on the top , lay a quantity of frocks that [nurse]1496-nurse had left folded up on the floor , thrown in anyhow , with some toys scattered among them , and the frocks and toys were all dancing up and down as if they were bewitched . [Nurse]75-nurse took out the frocks , and there was [the children]198-the children 's collar - box , a large round cardboard - box with a lid , jumping from side to side like a box in a fairy tale ; and such dreadful pitiful little mews coming from the inside ! [Nurse]75-nurse undid the lid , and out sprang [Spot]77-spot like a flash of lightning , and ran as if [she]1496-nurse were running for [her]1496-nurse life out of the door and down the stairs , and safe into [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen , where [she]1496-nurse cuddled [herself]1496-nurse up in a corner of the fender , wishing with all [her]1496-nurse poor trembling little heart that there were no such things in [the world]260-the world as [small boys]291-small boys . And then [nurse]1496-nurse heard a kind of kicking and scuffling in the china cupboard , and when [she]1496-nurse opened it there sat [Olly]63-olly doubled up , [his]63-olly brown eyes dancing like will - o'-the - wisps , and [his]63-olly little white teeth grinning .

" Oh ! [Nana]79-nana , [she]77-spot _ did _ make a funny [me]63-olly - ow ! [I]63-olly just said to [her]77-spot , Now , [Spottie]84-spottie , _ would n't _ [you]84-spottie like to go in [[my]63-olly box]1610-my box ? and [she]77-spot said , Yes ; and [I]63-olly made [her]77-spot such a comfy bed , and then [I]63-olly stuck all those frocks on the top of [her]77-spot to keep [her]77-spot warm . Why did [you]79-nana let [her]77-spot out , [Nana]79-nana ? "[63-olly]

" [You]84-spottie little mischief , "[79-nana] said [Nana]79-nana , " do [you]84-spottie know [you]84-spottie might have smothered poor little [Spot]77-spot ? And look at all these frocks ; do [you]84-spottie think [I]79-nana have got nothing better to do than to tidy up after [your]84-spottie tricks ? "[79-nana]

But nurse never knew how to be very hard upon [Olly]63-olly ; so all [she]293-she did was to set [him]63-olly up on a high chair with a picture - book , where [she]293-she could see all [he]63-olly was doing . There was no saying what [he]63-olly might take a fancy to pack up next if [she]293-she did n't keep an eye on [him]63-olly .

Well , presently all the packing was done , and [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly had gone to say good - bye to [Fräulein]71-fräulein , and to [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis . Wednesday evening came , and [they]294-they were to start early on Thursday morning . [Olly]63-olly begged [nurse]1496-nurse to put [him]63-olly to bed very early , that [he]63-olly might " wake up krick"--quick[1496-nurse] was a word [Olly]63-olly never could say . So to bed [he]63-olly went at half - past six , and [his]63-olly head had scarcely touched the pillow two minutes before [he]63-olly had gone cantering away into dreamland , and was seeing all the sights and hearing all the delicious stories that [children]1510-children do see and hear in dreamland , though [they]1510-children do n't always remember [them]1510-children when [they]1510-children wake up . [Both Milly]83-milly and [he]63-olly woke up very early on Thursday morning ; and directly [his]63-olly eyes were open [Olly]63-olly jumped out of bed like an india - rubber ball , and began to put on [his]63-olly stockings in a terrible hurry . The noise of [his]63-olly jump woke [nurse]1496-nurse , and [she]1496-nurse called out in a sleepy voice :

" Get into bed again , [Master Olly]63-olly , directly . It is only just six o'clock , and [I]1496-nurse ca n't have [you]63-olly out of bed till seven . [You]63-olly 'll only be under [my]1496-nurse feet , and in [everybody]1611-everybody 's way . "[1496-nurse]

" [Nana]79-nana , [I]63-olly wo n't be in _ [anybody]1612-anybody 's _ way , "[63-olly] exclaimed [Olly]63-olly , running up to [her]1496-nurse and scrambling on to [her]1496-nurse bed with [his]63-olly little bare toes half way into [his]63-olly stockings . " [I]63-olly ca n't keep still in [my]63-olly bed all such a long time . There 's something inside of [me]63-olly , [Nana]79-nana , keeps jumping up and down , and wo n't let [me]63-olly keep still . Now , if [I]63-olly get up , [you]79-nana know , [Nana]79-nana , [I]63-olly can help [you]79-nana . "[63-olly]

" Help [me]1496-nurse , indeed ! "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , kissing [his]63-olly little brown face , or as much of it as could be seen through [his]63-olly curls . " A nice helping that would be . Come back to bed , [sir]1613-sir , and [I]1496-nurse 'll give [you]63-olly some picture - books till [I]1496-nurse 'm ready to dress [you]63-olly . "[1496-nurse]

So back to [bed]299-bed [Master Olly]63-olly went , sorely against [his]63-olly will , and there [he]63-olly had to stay till [nurse]1496-nurse and [Milly]83-milly were dressed , and the breakfast things laid . Then [nurse]1496-nurse gave [him]63-olly [his]63-olly bath and dressed [him]63-olly , and put [him]63-olly up to eat [his]63-olly bread and milk while [she]1496-nurse finished the packing . [Olly]63-olly was always very quiet over [his]63-olly meals , and it was the only time in the day when [he]63-olly was quiet .

Presently up rattled [the cab]302-the cab , and down ran [the children]198-the children with [their]198-the children walking things on to see [father]85-father and [John]66-john backhouse lift the boxes on to the top ; and soon [they]198-the children were saying good - bye to [Susan]86-susan [the cook]304-the cook , and [[Jenny]87-jenny the housemaid , who were going to stay and take care of [the house]265-the house while [they]198-the children were away]305-jenny the housemaid , who were going to stay and take care of the house while they were away ; and then crack went the whip , and off [they]198-the children went to [the station]307-the station . On the way [they]198-the children passed [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis standing at [their]198-the children gate , and all [the children]198-the children waved [their]198-the children hats and shouted " Hurrah ! hurrah ! "[198-the children] At [the station]307-the station [nurse]1496-nurse kept tight hold of [Olly]63-olly till [father]1498-father had got the tickets and put all the boxes into [the train]1540-the train , and then [he]1498-father and [Milly]83-milly were safely lifted up into [the railway carriage]313-the railway carriage , and [nurse]1496-nurse and [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother came next , with all the bags and shawls and umbrellas .

Such a settling of legs and arms and packages there was ; and in the middle of it " whew "[1502-mother] went the whistle , and off [they]198-the children went away to [the mountains]1534-the mountains .

But [they]198-the children had a long way to go before [they]198-the children saw [any mountains]318-any mountains . First of all [they]198-the children had to get to [Bletchley]7-bletchley , and it took about an hour doing that . And oh ! what a lovely morning it was , and how fresh and green [the fields]319-the fields looked as [the train]1540-the train hurried along past [them]198-the children . [Olly]63-olly and [Milly]83-milly could see hundreds and thousands of moon - daisies and buttercups growing among the wet grass , and every now and then came great bushes of wild - roses , some pink and some white , and long pools with yellow irises growing along the side ; and sometimes [the train]1540-the train went rushing through [a little village]322-a little village , and [they]198-the children could see [the little children]323-the little children trotting along to [school]1499-school , with [their]323-the little children books and slates tucked under [their]323-the little children arms ; and sometimes [they]198-the children went along for miles together without seeing anything but the white - and - brown cows in [the fields]319-the fields , and the great mother - sheep with [their]326-their fat white lambs beside [them]326-their . The sun shone so brightly , the buttercups were so yellow , the roses so pink , and the sky so blue , it was like a fairy world . [Olly]63-olly and [Milly]83-milly were always shouting and clapping [their]198-the children hands at something or other , for [Milly]83-milly had grown almost as wild as [Olly]63-olly .

Sh - sh - sh - sh went [the train]1540-the train , getting slower and slower till at last it stopped altogether .

" [Bletchley]7-bletchley , [Bletchley]7-bletchley ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , jumping down off the seat .

" No , [[my]262-his father boy]1614-my boy , "[262-his father] said [[his]63-olly father]262-his father , catching hold of [him]63-olly , " [we]1615-we shall stop five more times before [we]1615-we get to [Bletchley]7-bletchley ; so do n't be impatient . "[262-his father]

But at last came [Bletchley]7-bletchley , and [the children]198-the children were lifted out into the middle of such a bustle , as it seemed to [Milly]83-milly . There were [crowds of people]330-crowds of people at [the station]307-the station , and [they]330-crowds of people were all pushing backward and forward , and shouting and talking .

" Keep hold of [me]83-milly , [Olly]63-olly , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , with an anxious little face . " Oh , [Nana]79-nana , do n't let [him]63-olly go ! "[83-milly]

But [nurse]1496-nurse held [him]63-olly fast ; and very soon [they]198-the children were through [the crowd]333-the crowd , and [father]1498-father had put [them]198-the children safe into [[their]198-the children new train]335-their new train , into [a carriage]1601-a carriage marked " [Windermere]18-windermere , "[1498-father] which would take [them]198-the children all the way to [their]198-the children journey 's end .

" That was like lions and bears , was n't it , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , pointing to [the crowd in [the station]307-the station]337-the crowd in the station , as [they]198-the children went puffing away . Now , " lions and bears "[63-olly] was a favourite game of [the children]198-the children 's , a romping game , where [everybody]1611-everybody ran about and pretended to be [somebody else]341-somebody else , and where the more [people]1598-people played , and the more [they]1598-people ran and pushed and tumbled about , the funnier , it was . And the running , [scrambling people at [the station]307-the station]343-scrambling people at the station did look rather as if [they]1598-people were playing at lions and bears .

And now [the children]198-the children had a long day before [them]198-the children . On rushed [the train]1540-the train , past [towns and villages]347-towns and villages , and [houses]348-houses and [trains]349-trains . The sun got hotter and hotter , and [the children]198-the children began to get a little tired of looking out of window . [Milly]83-milly asked for a story - book , and was soon very happy reading " Snow White and Rose Red . "[1498-father] [She]83-milly had read it a hundred times before , but that never mattered a bit . [Olly]63-olly came to sit on [nurse]1496-nurse 's knee while [she]1496-nurse showed [him]63-olly pictures , and so the time passed away . And now [the train]1540-the train stopped again , and [father]1498-father lifted [Olly]63-olly on [his]1498-father knee to see [a great church]354-a great church far away over [the houses]355-the houses , and taught [him]63-olly to say " [Lichfield]20-lichfield Cathedral . "[1498-father] And then came [Stafford]9-stafford ; and [Milly]83-milly looked out for [the castle]356-the castle , and wondered whether [the castles in [her]83-milly story - books]357-the castles in her story - books looked like that , and whether [princesses]358-princesses and [fairy godmothers]359-fairy godmothers and [giants]360-giants ever lived [there]1539-there in old times .

After [they]362-they had left [Stafford]9-stafford , [Olly]63-olly began to get tired and fidgety . First [he]63-olly went to sit on [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's knee , then on [mother]1502-mother 's , then on [nurse's]365-nurse's -- [none of [them]362-they]366-none of them could keep [him]63-olly still , and nothing seemed to amuse [him]63-olly for long together .

" Come and have a sleep , [Master Olly]63-olly , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse . " [You]63-olly are just tired and hot . This is a long way for [little boys]1617-little boys , and [we]362-they 've got ever so far to go yet . "[1496-nurse]

" [I]63-olly 'm not sleepy , [Nana]79-nana , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , sitting straight up , with a little flushed face and wide - open eyes . " [I]63-olly 'm going to keep awake like [father]1498-father . "[63-olly]

" [Father]85-father 's going to sleep , then , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , tucking [himself]89-mr. norton up in a shady corner ; " so [you]63-olly go too , [Olly]63-olly , and see which of [us]1619-us can go quickest . "[89-mr. norton]

When [Olly]63-olly had seen [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's eyes tight shut , and heard [him]262-his father give just one little snore -- it was rather a make - believe snore -- [he]63-olly did let [nurse]1496-nurse draw [him]262-his father on to [her]1496-nurse knee ; and very soon [the little gipsy creature]370-the little gipsy creature was fast asleep , with all [his]262-his father brown curls lying like a soft mat over [nurse]1496-nurse 's arm . [Milly]83-milly , too , shut [her]83-milly eyes and sat very still ; [she]83-milly did not mean to go to sleep , but presently [she]83-milly began to think a great many sleepy thoughts : Why did the hedges run so fast ? and why did the telegraph wires go up and down as if [they]372-they were always making curtsies ? and was that really [mother opposite]373-mother opposite , or was it [[Cinderella]90-cinderella 's fairy godmother]374-cinderella 's fairy godmother ? And all of a sudden [Milly]83-milly came bump up against [a tall blue mountain]375-a tall blue mountain that had a face like [a man]376-a man , and cried out when [she]83-milly bumped upon it !

" [Crewe]10-crewe , [I]1498-father declare , "[1498-father] exclaimed [father]1498-father , jumping up with a start . " Why , [Olly]63-olly and [I]1498-father have been asleep nearly an hour ! Wake up , [children]1510-children , it 's dinner - time . "[1498-father]

[Nurse]75-nurse had to shake [Olly]63-olly a great many times before [he]63-olly would open [his]63-olly sleepy eyes , and then [he]63-olly stood up rubbing them as if [he]63-olly would rub them quite away . [Father]85-father lifted [him]63-olly out , and carried [him]63-olly into [a big room]378-a big room , with a big table in it , all ready for dinner , and [hungry people]379-hungry people sitting round [it]378-a big room . What fun it was having dinner at [a station]380-a station , with [all the grown - up people]381-all the grown - up people . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly thought there never was such nice bread and such nice apple - tart . Nothing at [home]382-home ever tasted half so good . And after dinner [father]1498-father took [them]384-them a little walk up and down [the platform]385-the platform , and at last , just as it was time to get into [the train]1540-the train again , [he]1498-father bought [them]384-them a paper full of pictures , called the _ Graphic _ , that amused [Olly]63-olly for a long way .

But it was a long long way to [Windermere]18-windermere , and poor [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly began to get very tired . The trees at [Wigan]11-wigan did make [them]384-them laugh a little bit , but [they]384-them were too tired to think them as funny as [they]384-them would have thought [them]384-them in the morning . [They]384-them are such comical trees ! First of all , the smoke from [the smoky chimneys at [Wigan]11-wigan]387-the smoky chimneys at wigan has made them black , and stopped the leaves from growing , and then the wind has blown them all over on one side , so that they look like [ugly little twisted dwarfs , as if some cruel fairy]388-ugly little twisted dwarfs , as if some cruel fairy had touched [them]384-them with [her]389-her wand . But [Olly]63-olly soon forgot all about [them]384-them ; and [he]63-olly began to wander from one end to the other of [the carriage]390-the carriage again , scrambling and jumping about , till [he]63-olly gave [himself]63-olly a hard knock against the seat ; and that made [him]63-olly begin to cry -- [poor tired little [Olly]63-olly]391-poor tired little olly . Then [mother]1502-mother lifted [him]63-olly on to [her]1502-mother knee , and said to [him]63-olly , very softly , " Are [you]63-olly very tired , [Olly]63-olly ? Never mind , [poor little man]1621-poor little man , [we]1622-we sha n't be very long now , and [we]1622-we 're all tired , [darling]1623-darling -- [father]1498-father 's tired , and [I]1502-mother 'm tired ; and look at [Milly]83-milly there , [she]83-milly looks like a little white ghost . Suppose [you]63-olly be brave , and try a little extra hard to be good . Then mother'll love [you]63-olly an extra bit . And what do [you]63-olly think [we]1622-we shall see soon ? such [a lovely bit of [blue sea]1626-blue sea with white ships on it]1625-a lovely bit of blue sea with white ships on it . Just [you]63-olly shut [your]63-olly eyes a little bit till it comes , [I]1502-mother 'll be sure to tell [you]63-olly . "[1502-mother]

And sure enough , after [Lancaster]13-lancaster , [mother]1502-mother gave a little cry , and [Olly]63-olly jumped up , and [Milly]83-milly came running over , and there before [them]394-we lay [the dancing windy blue sea]395-the dancing windy blue sea , covered over with little white waves , running and tumbling over each other . And on the other side of [it]395-the dancing windy blue sea , what did [the children]198-the children see ?

" [Mother]62-mother , [mother]1502-mother ! what is it ? "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , pointing with [his]63-olly little brown hand far away ; " is it [a fairy palace]1628-a fairy palace , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly]

" Perhaps [it]1628-a fairy palace is , [Olly]63-olly ; anyway , the hill - fairies live [there]1539-there . For those are [the mountains]1534-the mountains , [the beautiful mountains [we]394-we are going to see]1632-the beautiful mountains we are going to see . "[63-olly]

" But how shall [we]394-we get across [the sea]1513-the sea to [them]1534-the mountains ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , with a puzzled face .

" This is only [a corner of [the sea]1513-the sea]1634-a corner of the sea , [Milly]83-milly -- a bay . Do n't [you]83-milly remember bays in [your]83-milly geography ? [We]394-we ca n't go across [it]1634-a corner of the sea , but [we]394-we can go round [it]1634-a corner of the sea , and [we]394-we shall find the mountains on the other side . "[63-olly]

Oh ! how fast [the train]1540-the train seemed to go now that there was something to look at . [Everywhere mountains]398-everywhere mountains were beginning to spring up . And when [they]399-they had said good - bye to [the sea]1513-the sea , [the mountains]1534-the mountains began to grow taller and taller . What had happened to [the houses]355-the houses too ? [They]355-the houses had all turned white or gray ; there was no red one left . And [the fields]319-the fields had stone walls instead of hedges ; and inside the walls there were small sheep , about as big as the lambs [they]399-they had seen near [Oxford]21-oxford in the morning .

[Oxenholme]22-oxenholme , [Kendal]15-kendal , [Windermere]18-windermere . How glad [the tired children]404-the tired children were when [the train]1540-the train ran slowly down into [[Windermere]18-windermere station]406-windermere station , and [they]404-the tired children could jump out and say good - bye to it for a long , long time ! [They]404-the tired children had to wait a little , till [father]1498-father had found all the boxes and put them in [the carriage]390-the carriage that was waiting for [them]404-the tired children , and then in [they]404-the tired children tumbled , [nurse]1496-nurse having first wrapped them up in big shawls , for it was evening now , and the wind had grown cold . That was a nice drive home among [the mountains]1534-the mountains . How tall and dark and quiet [they]404-the tired children were . And what was this shining on [their]404-the tired children left hand , like a white face running beside [them]404-the tired children , and peeping from behind the trees ? Why , it was [a lake]411-a lake ; [a great wide lake]412-a great wide lake , with [tiny boats]413-tiny boats upon [it]411-a lake , [some with white sails and some without]414-some with white sails and some without .

" [Mother]1502-mother ! [mother]1502-mother ! may [we]404-the tired children go in [those boats]1638-those boats some day ? "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , in a little sharp tired voice , and [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother smiled at [him]63-olly , and said--"Yes , very likely . "[63-olly]

How happy [mother]1502-mother looked . [She]1502-mother knew all [the mountains]1534-the mountains like [old friends]418-old friends , [she]1502-mother could tell all [their]404-the tired children names ; and every now and then , when [they]404-the tired children came to [a house]419-a house , [she]1502-mother and [father]1498-father would begin to talk about [the people who lived in [it]419-a house]421-the people who lived in it , just as if [they]404-the tired children were talking about [people]1598-people [they]404-the tired children knew quite well . And now came [a little town]201-a little town , [the town of [Wanwick]23-wanwick [mother]1502-mother]424-the town of wanwick mother called [it]201-a little town , right among [the mountains]1534-the mountains , with [a river]427-a river running round [it]201-a little town , and a tall church spire . It began to get darker and darker , and the trees hung down over [the road]428-the road , so that [the children]198-the children could hardly see . On [they]404-the tired children went , and [Olly]63-olly was very nearly asleep again , when [the carriage]390-the carriage began to crunch over gravel , and then it stopped , and [father]1498-father called out--"Here [we]404-the tired children are , [children]1510-children , here [we]404-the tired children are at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest . "[1498-father]

And out [they]198-the children all jumped . What were those bright lights shining ? [Olly]63-olly and [Milly]83-milly hardly knew where [they]404-the tired children were going as [nurse]1496-nurse took [them]404-the tired children in , and [one of [[Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's servants]434-uncle richard 's servants]433-one of uncle richard 's servants showed [them]404-the tired children the way [upstairs]435-upstairs to [the nursery]281-the nursery . [Such [a nice nursery]438-a nice nursery , with candles lit , and a little fire burning , two bowls of hot bread and milk on the table]437-such a nice nursery , with candles lit , and a little fire burning , two bowls of hot bread and milk on the table , and in the corner two little white beds , as soft and fresh as nests ! In twenty minutes [Olly]63-olly was in one of these little white beds , and [Milly]83-milly in the other . And [you]439-you may guess whether [they]404-the tired children were long about going to sleep .

CHAPTER III

RAVENSNEST

" [Poor little souls]1640-poor little souls ! How late [they]1640-poor little souls are sleeping . [They]1640-poor little souls must have been tired last night . "[1496-nurse]

So said [nurse]1496-nurse at eight o'clock , when [she]1496-nurse came back into [the nursery]281-the nursery from a journey to [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen after the breakfast things , and found [the children]198-the children still fast asleep ; so fast that it looked as if [they]198-the children meant to go on sleeping till dinner - time .

" [Milly]83-milly ! "[1496-nurse] [she]1496-nurse called softly , shaking [her]83-milly very gently , " [Milly]83-milly , it 's breakfast - time , wake up ! "[1496-nurse]

[Milly]83-milly began to move about , and muttered something about " whistles "[83-milly] and " hedges "[83-milly] in [her]83-milly sleep .

Then [nurse]1496-nurse gave [her]83-milly another little shake , and at last [Milly]83-milly 's eyes did try very hard to open--"What is it ? What do [you]83-milly want , [Nana]79-nana ? Where are we?--Oh , [I]1496-nurse know ! "[1496-nurse]

And up sprang [Milly]83-milly in a second and ran to the window , [her]83-milly sleepy eyes wide open at last . " Yes , there they are ! Come and look , [Nana]79-nana ! There , past those trees -- don't [you]83-milly see [the mountains]1534-the mountains ? And there is [father]1498-father walking about ; and oh ! do look at those roses over there . Dress [me]83-milly quick , dress [me]83-milly quick , please , dear [Nana]79-nana . "[83-milly]

Thump ! bump ! and there was [Olly]63-olly out of bed , sitting on the floor rubbing [his]63-olly eyes . [Olly]63-olly used always to jump out of bed half asleep , and then sit a long time on the floor waking up . [Nurse]75-nurse and [Milly]83-milly always left [him]63-olly alone till [he]63-olly was quite woke up . It made [him]63-olly cross if [you]445-you began to talk to [him]63-olly too soon .

" [Milly]83-milly , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly presently , in a sleepy voice , " [I]63-olly 'm going right up [the mountains]1534-the mountains after breakfast . Are n't [you]83-milly ? "[63-olly]

" Wait till [you]63-olly see them , [Master Olly]63-olly , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , taking [him]63-olly up and kissing [him]63-olly , " perhaps [your]63-olly little legs wo n't find it quite so easy to climb up [the mountains]1534-the mountains as [you]63-olly think . "[1496-nurse]

" [I]63-olly can climb up three , four , six , [seven mountains]1645-seven mountains , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly stoutly ; " [mountains]1646-mountains are n't a bit hard . [Mother]62-mother says [they]1646-mountains 're meant to climb up . "[63-olly]

" Well , [I]83-milly suppose it 's like going up stairs a long way , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , thoughtfully , pulling on [her]83-milly stockings . " [You]63-olly did n't like going up the stairs in [[Auntie Margaret]93-auntie margaret 's house]1647-auntie margaret 's house , [Olly]63-olly . "[83-milly]

[[Auntie Margaret]93-auntie margaret 's house]1647-auntie margaret 's house was [a tall London house , with ever so many stairs]448-a tall london house , with ever so many stairs . [The children]198-the children when [they]198-the children were staying [there]1539-there were put to sleep at the top , and [Olly]63-olly used to sit down on the stairs and pout and grumble every time [they]198-the children had to go up .

But [Olly]63-olly shook [his]63-olly obstinate little head .

" [I]63-olly do n't believe it 's a bit like going up stairs . "[63-olly]

However , as [they]198-the children could n't know what it was like before [they]198-the children tried , [nurse]1496-nurse told [them]198-the children it was no good talking about it . So [they]198-the children hurried on with [their]198-the children dressing , and presently there stood as fresh [a pair of [morning children]453-morning children]452-a pair of morning children as [anyone]454-anyone could wish to see , with rosy cheeks , and smooth hair , and clean print frocks -- for [Olly]63-olly was still in frocks -- though when the winter came [mother]1502-mother said [she]1502-mother was going to put [him]63-olly into knickerbockers .

And then [nurse]1496-nurse took [them]198-the children each by the hand and led [them]198-the children through [some long passages]457-some long passages , down a pretty staircase , and through a swing door , into what looked like [a great nagged kitchen]458-a great nagged kitchen , only there was no fireplace in [it]458-a great nagged kitchen . [The real kitchen]459-the real kitchen opened out of [it]458-a great nagged kitchen at one side , and through the door came a smell of coffee and toast that made [the children]198-the children feel as hungry as [little hunters]461-little hunters . But [[their]198-the children own room]462-their own room was straight in front , across [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen without a fireplace , [a tiny room with one large window hung round with roses , and looking out on to a green lawn]464-a tiny room with one large window hung round with roses , and looking out on to a green lawn .

" [Nana]79-nana , is n't [it]465-it pretty ? [Nana]79-nana , [I]83-milly think it 's lovely ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , looking out and clapping [her]83-milly hands . And [it]465-it _ was _ [a pretty garden]466-a pretty garden [they]198-the children could see from the window . [An up - and - down garden , with beds full of bright flowers]467-an up - and - down garden , with beds full of bright flowers , and grass which was nearly all moss , and so soft that no cushion could be softer . In the distance [they]198-the children could hear a little splish - splash among the trees , which came , [Milly]83-milly supposed , from the river [mother]1502-mother had told [them]198-the children about ; while , reaching up all round [the house]265-the house , so that [they]198-the children could not see the top of [it]265-the house from the window , was [the green wild mountain]470-the green wild mountain itself , the mountain of [Brownholme]24-brownholme , under which [[Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's house]1562-uncle richard 's house was built .

[The children]198-the children hurried through [their]198-the children breakfast , and then [nurse]1496-nurse covered [them]198-the children up with garden pinafores , and took [them]198-the children to [the dining - room]474-the dining - room to find [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother . [Mr.]477-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton were reading letters when [the children]198-the children 's curly heads appeared at the open door , and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton was just saying to [[her]70-mrs. norton husband]479-her husband :

" [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma sends a few lines just to welcome [us]198-the children , and to say that [she]59-aunt emma ca n't come over to [us]198-the children to - day , but will [we]198-the children all come over to [her]59-aunt emma to - morrow and have early dinner , and perhaps a row afterward-- "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh , a row , [mother]1502-mother , a row ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , clambering on to [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother 's knee and half - strangling [her]185-his mother with [his]63-olly strong little arms ; " [I]63-olly can row , [father]1498-father said [I]63-olly might . Are [we]198-the children going to - day ? "[63-olly]

" No , to - morrow , [Olly]63-olly , when [we]198-the children 've seen a little bit of [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest first . Which of [you]63-olly remembers [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , [I]70-mrs. norton wonder ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" [I]83-milly remember [her]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , nodding [her]83-milly head wisely , " [she]59-aunt emma had a big white cap , and [she]59-aunt emma told [me]83-milly stories . But [I]83-milly do n't quite remember [her]59-aunt emma face , [mother]1502-mother -- not _ quite _ . "[83-milly]

" [I]63-olly do n't remember [her]59-aunt emma , not one bit , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly . " [Mother]62-mother , does [she]59-aunt emma keep saying , ' Do n't do that ; ' ' Go up [stairs]175-stairs , [naughty boys]1652-naughty boys , ' like [[Jacky]66-john backhouse 's aunt]1653-jacky 's aunt does ? "[63-olly]

For [the children]198-the children 's playfellows , [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis , had [an aunt]482-an aunt living with [them]198-the children whom [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly could n't bear . [They]198-the children believed that [she]482-an aunt could n't say anything else except " Do n't ! "[482-an aunt] and " Go up [stairs]175-stairs ! "[198-the children] and [they]198-the children were always in dread lest [they]198-the children should come across [an aunt like [her]482-an aunt]483-an aunt like her .

" [She]482-an aunt 's [the dearest aunt in [the whole world]221-the whole world]1655-the dearest aunt in the whole world , "[1502-mother] said [mother]1502-mother , " and [she]482-an aunt never says , ' Do n't , ' except when [she]482-an aunt 's obliged , but when [she]482-an aunt does say it [little boys]1617-little boys have to mind . When [I]1502-mother was [a little girl]1658-a little girl [I]1502-mother thought there was nobody like [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , [nobody who could make such plans or tell such splendid stories]1659-nobody who could make such plans or tell such splendid stories . "[1502-mother]

" And , [mother]1502-mother , ca n't [she]482-an aunt cut out card dolls ? asked [Milly]83-milly . Do n't [you]1502-mother know those beautiful card dolls [you]1502-mother have in [your]1502-mother drawer at [home]382-home -- didn't [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma make them ? "[1502-mother]

" Yes , of course [she]482-an aunt did . [She]482-an aunt made [me]1502-mother [a whole family]1662-a whole family once for [my]1502-mother birthday , [a father]1663-a father and [a mother]1664-a mother , and [two little girls]1665-two little girls and [two little boys]1666-two little boys . And [each of [the children]198-the children]1667-each of the children had two paper dresses and two hats , one for best and one for every day -- and [the mother]1669-the mother had a white evening dress trimmed with red , and a hat and a bonnet . "[1502-mother]

" [I]1502-mother know , [mother]1502-mother ! [they]1662-a whole family 're all in [your]1502-mother drawer at [home]382-home , only one of [the little boys]1672-the little boys has [his]1666-two little boys head broken off . Do [you]1502-mother think [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma would make [me]1502-mother a set if [I]1502-mother asked [her]59-aunt emma ? "[1502-mother]

" [I]1502-mother ca n't say , [Milly]83-milly . But [I]1502-mother believe [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's fingers are just as quick as ever they were . Now , [children]1510-children , [father]1498-father says [he]1498-father will take [you]1510-children out while [I]1502-mother go and speak to cook . [Olly]63-olly , how do [you]63-olly think [we]1675-we 're going to get any meat for [you]63-olly and [Milly]83-milly here ? There are [no shops on [the mountains]1534-the mountains]1676-no shops on the mountains . "[1502-mother]

" Then [we]1675-we 'll eat fisses , little fisses like those ! "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , pointing to a plate of tiny red - spotted fish that [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother had been having for breakfast .

" Thank [you]63-olly , [Olly]63-olly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , laughing ; " it would cost a good deal to keep [you]63-olly in trout , [sir]1613-sir . [I]89-mr. norton think [we]1675-we 'll try for some plain mutton for [you]63-olly , even if [we]1675-we have to catch the sheep on [the mountains]1534-the mountains [ourselves]1675-we . But now come along till [mother]1502-mother is ready , and [I]89-mr. norton 'll show [you]63-olly [the river]1681-the river where those little fishes lived . "[89-mr. norton]

Out ran [the children]198-the children , ready to go anywhere and see anything in [this beautiful new place]488-this beautiful new place , which seemed to [them]198-the children [a palace of wonders]489-a palace of wonders . And presently [they]198-the children were skipping over the soft green grass , each holding one of [father]1498-father 's hands , and chattering away to [him]1498-father as if [their]198-the children little tongues would never stop . What a hot day it was going to be ! The sky overhead was deep blue , with scarcely a cloud , [they]198-the children could hear nothing in the still air but the sleepy cooing of the doves in the trees by the gate , and the trees and flowers all looked as if [they]198-the children were going to sleep in the heat .

" [Father]85-father , why did [that old gentleman at [Willingham]5-willingham]1682-that old gentleman at willingham last week tell [mother]1502-mother that it always rained in [the mountains]1534-the mountains ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , looking up at the blue sky .

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [I]83-milly 'm afraid [you]83-milly 'll find out before [you]83-milly go [home]382-home that it does know how to rain here . Sometimes it rains and rains as if the sky were coming down and all [the world]260-the world were going to turn into water . But never mind about that now -- it is n't going to rain to - day . "[83-milly]

Down [they]198-the children went through [the garden]219-the garden , across [the road]428-the road , and into a field on the other side of [it]219-the garden , [a beautiful hay - field full of flowers , with just a narrow little path through [it]219-the garden where [the children]198-the children and [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton could walk one behind another]493-a beautiful hay - field full of flowers , with just a narrow little path through it where the children and mr. norton could walk one behind another . And at the end of [the path]495-the path what do [you]496-you think [they]198-the children found ? Why , [a chattering sparkling river , running along over hundreds and thousands of brown and green pebbles]497-a chattering sparkling river , running along over hundreds and thousands of brown and green pebbles , so fast that it seemed to be trying to catch the birds as [they]198-the children skimmed across [it]497-a chattering sparkling river , running along over hundreds and thousands of brown and green pebbles . [The children]198-the children had never seen [a river like this]499-a river like this before , where [you]496-you could see right to the very bottom , and count the stones there if [you]496-you liked , and which behaved like a river at play , scrambling and dancing and rushing along as if it were out for a holiday , like [the children themselves]500-the children themselves .

" What do [you]198-the children think of that for [a river]427-a river , [children]1510-children ? "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Very early this morning , when [you]198-the children little sleepyheads were in bed , [I]89-mr. norton got up and came down here , and had [my]89-mr. norton bath over there , look -- in that nice brown pool under the tree . "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh , [father]1498-father ! "[501-both children] cried [both children]501-both children , dancing round [him]89-mr. norton . " Let [us]501-both children have [our]501-both children baths in [the river]1681-the river too . Do ask [Nana]79-nana -- do , [father]1498-father ! [We]501-both children can have [our]501-both children bathing things on that [we]501-both children had at [the sea]1513-the sea , and [you]1498-father can come too and teach [us]501-both children to swim . "[501-both children]

" Well , just once perhaps , if [mother]1502-mother says yes , and it 's very warm weather , and [you]1498-father get up very _ very _ early . But [you]1498-father wo n't like it quite as much as [you]1498-father think . " Oh , but , [father]1498-father , "[83-milly] interrupted [Milly]83-milly , " [we]501-both children could put on [our]501-both children sand shoes . "[83-milly]

" What do [you]1498-father know about it , [shrimp]1698-shrimp ? "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " [you]1498-father do n't have to tidy up . There are [three children]1701-three children [there]1539-there , [Milly]83-milly , besides cows and pigs , and ducks and chickens . "[89-mr. norton]

Back ran [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly , and there was [mother]1502-mother watching for [them]503-them with a basket on [her]1502-mother arm which had already got some roses lying in it .

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother ! where did [you]1498-father get those roses ? "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly .

"[63-olly]

Up clambered [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly along [a steep path]504-a steep path that seemed to take [them]505-they up into [the mountain]1561-the mountain , when suddenly [they]505-they turned , and there was [another river]507-another river , but such [a tiny river , [Milly]83-milly could almost jump across [it]507-another river]508-a tiny river , milly could almost jump across it , and it was tumbling and leaping down the rocks on its way to [the big river which [they]505-they had just seen]509-the big river which they had just seen , as if it were [a little child hurrying to [[its]510-a little child hurrying to its mother mother]511-its mother]510-a little child hurrying to its mother .

" Just to begin with , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " [You]63-olly 'll see plenty more before [you]63-olly 've done . On the other side of [the little bridge]514-the little bridge was [[the gardener]1554-the gardener 's cottage]516-the gardener 's cottage , and in front of the door stood [two funny fair - haired little children with [their]517-two funny fair - haired little children with their fingers in their mouths , staring at milly and olly fingers in [their]517-two funny fair - haired little children with their fingers in their mouths , staring at milly and olly mouths , staring at [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly]517-two funny fair - haired little children with their fingers in their mouths , staring at milly and olly . [One]518-one was [a little girl who was really about [Milly]83-milly 's age]519-a little girl who was really about milly 's age , though [she]519-a little girl who was really about milly 's age looked much younger , and [the other]520-the other was [a very shy small boy , with blue eyes and straggling yellow hair , and a face that might have been pretty]521-a very shy small boy , with blue eyes and straggling yellow hair , and a face that might have been pretty if [you]522-you could have seen it properly . But [Charlie]96-charlie seemed to have made up [his]96-charlie mind that [nobody]280-nobody ever should see it properly . However often [[his]96-charlie mother]185-his mother might wash [him]96-charlie , and [she]185-his mother was [a tidy woman]525-a tidy woman , who liked to see [[her]185-his mother children]526-her children look clean and nice , [Charlie]96-charlie was always black . [His]96-charlie face was black , [his]96-charlie hands were black , [his]96-charlie pinafore was sure to be covered with black marks ten minutes after [he]96-charlie had put it on . Do what [you]522-you would to [him]96-charlie , it was no use , [Charlie]96-charlie always looked as if [he]96-charlie had just come out of [the coal - hole]527-the coal - hole .

" Well , [Bessie]97-bessie , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton to [the little girl]528-the little girl , " is [[your]97-bessie mother]1713-your mother in ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" Naw , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie again , beginning to eat [her]97-bessie pinafore as well as [her]97-bessie fingers . [Meanwhile Charlie]96-charlie had been creeping behind [Bessie]97-bessie to get out of [Olly]63-olly 's way ; for [Olly]63-olly , who always wanted to make [friends]529-friends , was trying to shake hands with [him]63-olly , and [Charlie]96-charlie was dreadfully afraid that [he]96-charlie wanted to kiss [him]63-olly too .

" What a pity , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " [I]70-mrs. norton wanted to ask [her]1713-your mother a question . " Yis , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie , getting shyer and shyer , and eating up [her]97-bessie pinafore faster than ever .
