" Good - bye , [Bessie]97-bessie , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , softly , taking [her]97-bessie hand .

[Bessie]97-bessie stared at [her]83-milly , but did n't say anything .

[Olly]63-olly , having quite failed in shaking hands , was now trying to kiss [Charlie]96-charlie ; but [Charlie]96-charlie would n't have it at all , and every time [Olly]63-olly came near , [Charlie]96-charlie pushed [him]63-olly away with [his]96-charlie little fists . This made [Olly]63-olly rather cross , and [he]63-olly began to try with all [his]63-olly strength to make [Charlie]96-charlie kiss [him]63-olly , when suddenly [Charlie]96-charlie got away from [him]63-olly , and running to a pile of logs of wood which was lying in [the yard]530-the yard [he]96-charlie climbed up the logs like a little squirrel , and was soon at the top of the heap , looking down on [Olly]63-olly , who was very much astonished .

" [Mother]62-mother , _ do _ let [me]63-olly climb up too ! "[63-olly] entreated [Olly]63-olly , as [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton took [his]63-olly hand to lead [him]63-olly away . " [I]70-mrs. norton want to climb up [krick]26-krick like that ! Oh , do let [me]70-mrs. norton try ! "[70-mrs. norton]

" No , no , [Olly]63-olly ! come along . [We]531-we shall never get to [the farm]1556-the farm if [you]63-olly stay climbing here . And [you]63-olly would n't find it as easy as [Charlie]96-charlie does , [I]70-mrs. norton can tell [you]63-olly . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Why , [I]63-olly 'm bigger than [Charlie]96-charlie , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , pouting , as [they]531-we walked away .

" But [you]63-olly have n't got such stout legs ; and , besides , [Charlie]96-charlie is always out of doors all day long , climbing and poking about . [I]70-mrs. norton daresay [he]96-charlie can do outdoor things better than [you]63-olly can . [You]63-olly 're [a little town boy]1716-a little town boy , [you]63-olly know . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [Charlie]96-charlie 's got a black face , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who was not at all pleased that [Charlie]96-charlie , who was smaller than [he]96-charlie was , and dirty besides , could do anything better than [he]96-charlie could .

" Well , [you]63-olly see , [he]96-charlie has n't got a [Nana]79-nana always looking after [him]96-charlie as [you]63-olly have . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [He]96-charlie has n't got [any nurse]1717-any nurse but [[his]96-charlie mother]185-his mother , and [Mrs. Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler has a great deal else to do than looking after [him]96-charlie . "[63-olly]

" [I]63-olly should get just like shock - headed [Peter]100-peter , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , shaking [his]63-olly head gravely at the idea . " What [a funny little girl]1721-a funny little girl [Bessie]97-bessie is , [mother]1502-mother ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " Do [they]1723-they always say _ Naw _ and _ Yis _ in [this country]1724-this country , instead of saying No and Yes , like [we]537-we do ? "[83-milly]

"[70-mrs. norton]

All this time [they]537-we had been climbing up [a steep path]504-a steep path behind [[the gardener]1554-the gardener 's house]540-the gardener 's house , and now [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton opened a door in a high wall , and let [the children]198-the children into [a beautiful kitchen - garden made on [the mountain side]543-the mountain side]542-a beautiful kitchen - garden made on the mountain side , so that when [they]198-the children looked down from the gate [they]198-the children could see [the chimneys of [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest just below [them]198-the children]544-the chimneys of ravensnest just below them . Inside there were all kinds of fruit and vegetables , but gooseberry bushes and the strawberries had nothing but green gooseberries and white strawberries to show , to [Olly]63-olly 's great disappointment .

" Why are n't the strawberries red , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly] [he]63-olly asked in a discontented voice , as if it must be [somebody]545-somebody 's fault that [they]546-we were n't red . " [Ours]546-we at [home]382-home were ripe . "[63-olly]

" Well , [Olly]63-olly , [I]545-somebody suppose the strawberries know best . All [I]545-somebody can tell [you]63-olly is , that things always get ripe here later than at [Willingham]5-willingham . [Their]546-we summer begins a little later than [ours]546-we does , and so everything gets pushed on a little . But there will be plenty by - and - by . And suppose just now , instead of looking at the strawberries , [you]63-olly give just one look at [the mountains]1534-the mountains . Count how many [you]63-olly can see all round . "[545-somebody]

" One , two , three , five , "[63-olly] counted [Olly]63-olly . " What [great big humps]1731-great big humps ! Should [we]546-we be able to touch the sky if [we]546-we got up to the top of that one , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly] and [he]63-olly pointed to [a great blue mountain where the clouds seemed to be resting on the top]547-a great blue mountain where the clouds seemed to be resting on the top .

" Well , if [you]63-olly were up there just now , [you]63-olly would be all among the clouds , and it would seem like a white fog all round [you]63-olly . So [you]63-olly would be touching the clouds at any rate . "[545-somebody]

[Olly]63-olly opened [his]63-olly eyes very wide at the idea of touching the clouds .

" Why , [mother]1502-mother , [we]546-we ca n't touch the clouds at [home]382-home ! "[545-somebody]

" That comes of living in [a country as flat as a pancake]1735-a country as flat as a pancake , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Just [you]63-olly wait till [we]546-we can buy [a tame mountain]1736-a tame mountain , and carry it to [Willingham]5-willingham with [us]546-we . Then [we]546-we 'll put it down in the middle of [the garden]219-the garden , and the clouds will come down to sit on the top of it just as they do here . But now , who can scramble over that gate ? "[89-mr. norton]

For the gate at the other end of [the garden]219-the garden was locked , and as [the gardener]1554-the gardener could n't be found , [everybody]1611-everybody had to scramble over , [mother]1502-mother included . However , [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton helped [them]1611-everybody all over , and then [they]1611-everybody found [themselves]1611-everybody on a path running along [the green mountain side]552-the green mountain side . On [they]1611-everybody went , through pretty bits of [steep hay - fields]553-steep hay - fields , where the grass seemed all clover and moon - daisies , till presently [they]1611-everybody came upon [a small hunched - up house]554-a small hunched - up house , with a number of sheds on one side of [it]554-a small hunched - up house and [a kitchen - garden]555-a kitchen - garden in front . This was [[Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's farm]1700-uncle richard 's farm ; [a very tiny farm]557-a very tiny farm , where [a man called [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse]558-a man called john backhouse lived , with [[his]66-john backhouse wife]559-his wife and [two little girls]1665-two little girls and [a baby - boy]561-a baby - boy . Except just in the hay - time , [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse had [no men]562-no men to help [him]66-john backhouse , and [he]66-john backhouse and [[his]66-john backhouse wife]559-his wife had to do all the work , to look after the sheep , and the cows , the pigs , the horse , and the chickens , to manage [the garden]219-the garden and [the hayfield]565-the hayfield , and to take the butter and milk to [the people who wanted to buy it]566-the people who wanted to buy it . When [[their]567-their children]568-their children grew up and were able to help , [Backhouse]66-john backhouse and [[his]66-john backhouse wife]559-his wife would be able to do it all very well ; but just now , when [they]568-their children were still quite small , it was very hard work ; it was all [the farmer]570-the farmer and [[his]570-the farmer wife]559-his wife could do to make enough to keep [themselves]567-their and [[their]567-their children]568-their children fed and clothed .

[Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly were very anxious to see [[the farmer]570-the farmer 's children]574-the farmer 's children and looked out for [them]574-the farmer 's children in [the garden]219-the garden as [they]574-the farmer 's children walked up to [the house]265-the house , but there were no signs of [them]574-the farmer 's children . The door was opened by [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , [[the farmer]570-the farmer 's wife]578-the farmer 's wife , who held [a fair - haired baby]579-a fair - haired baby in [her]101-mrs. backhouse arms sucking a great crust of brown bread , and when [Mr.]580-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton had shaken hands with her--"I'm sure , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm very pleased to see [you]1738-ma'am here , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse . " [John]66-john backhouse told [me]101-mrs. backhouse [you]1738-ma'am were come ( only [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse said ' coom ' ) , and [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza went down with [[their]574-the farmer 's children father]212-their father when [he]212-their father took the milk this morning , hoping [they]574-the farmer 's children would catch a sight of [[your]1738-ma'am children]1740-your children . [They]574-the farmer 's children have been just wild to see [them]574-the farmer 's children , but [I]101-mrs. backhouse told [them]574-the farmer 's children [they]574-the farmer 's children were n't likely to be up at that time in the morning . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

" Where are [they]574-the farmer 's children now ? "[70-mrs. norton] asked [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " [Mine]70-mrs. norton have been looking out for [them]574-the farmer 's children as [we]1741-we came along . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Well , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , [I]101-mrs. backhouse ca n't say , unless [they]574-the farmer 's children 're in the cherry - tree . [Becky]102-becky ! [Tiza]103-tiza ! "[101-mrs. backhouse]

A faint " Yis "[70-mrs. norton] came from the other end of [the garden]219-the garden , but still [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly could see nothing but a big cherry - tree growing where the voice seemed to come from .

" [You]1738-ma'am go along that path , [missy]1743-missy , and call again . [You]1738-ma'am 'll be sure to find [them]574-the farmer 's children , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , pointing to the tree . " And wo n't [you]1738-ma'am come in , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , and rest a bit ? [You]1738-ma'am 'll be maybe tired with walking this hot day . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

So [Mr.]582-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton went into [the farmhouse]583-the farmhouse , and [the children]198-the children went hand - in - hand down [the garden]219-the garden , looking for [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza .

Suddenly , as [they]198-the children came close to the cherry - tree , [they]198-the children heard a laugh and a little scuffling , and looking up , what should [they]198-the children see but [two little girls]1665-two little girls perched up on one of the cherry - tree branches , one of [them]1665-two little girls sewing , [the other nursing a baby kitten]587-the other nursing a baby kitten . Both of [them]1665-two little girls had coloured print bonnets , but the smaller had taken [hers]588-hers off and was rolling the kitten up in it . [The little girl]528-the little girl sewing had a sensible , sober face ; as for the other , [she]528-the little girl could not have looked sober if [she]528-the little girl had tried for a week of Sundays . It made [you]590-you laugh only to look at [Tiza]103-tiza . From the top of [her]103-tiza curly head to the soles of [her]103-tiza skipping little feet , [she]103-tiza was [the sauciest , merriest , noisiest creature]591-the sauciest , merriest , noisiest creature . It was [she]103-tiza who was always playing tricks on the cows and the horse , and the big sheep - dogs ; who liked nothing so well as teasing [Becky]102-becky and dressing up the kittens , and who was always tumbling into the milkpail , or rolling [downstairs]592-downstairs , or losing [herself]103-tiza in [the woods]593-the woods , without somehow ever coming to any harm . If [she]102-becky and [Olly]63-olly had been left alone in [the world]260-the world together [they]1665-two little girls _ must _ have come to a bad end , but luckily each of [them]1665-two little girls had [wiser people]595-wiser people to take care of [them]1665-two little girls .

" [Becky]102-becky , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , shyly , looking up into the tree , " will [you]102-becky come down and say how do [you]102-becky do to [us]1665-two little girls ? "[83-milly]

[Becky]102-becky stuck [her]102-becky needle in [her]102-becky work and scrambled down with a red shy face to shake hands ; but [Tiza]103-tiza , instead of coming down , only climbed a little higher , and peeped at [the others between the branches]596-the others between the branches .

" [We]1665-two little girls came down to [the house]265-the house when [fayther]104-fayther took the milk this morning , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky . " [We]1665-two little girls thought maybe [we]1665-two little girls 'd see [you]63-olly in [the garden]219-the garden . Only [Tiza]103-tiza said [she]103-tiza 'd run away if [she]103-tiza did see [you]63-olly . "[102-becky]

" Why does n't [Tiza]103-tiza come down ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly , looking hard up into the tree . " [I]63-olly want to see [her]103-tiza . "[63-olly]

Thump ! What was that rattling down on [Olly]63-olly 's head ? [He]63-olly looked down at [his]63-olly feet very much astonished , and saw a bunch of green cherries which [Tiza]103-tiza had just thrown at [him]63-olly .

" Throw some more ! Throw some more ! "[63-olly] [he]63-olly cried out , and [Tiza]103-tiza began to pelt [him]63-olly fast , while [Olly]63-olly ran here and there picking them up , and every now and then trying to throw them back at [Tiza]103-tiza ; but [she]103-tiza was too high up for [him]63-olly to reach , and [they]597-they only came rattling about [his]63-olly head again .

" [She]103-tiza wo n't come down , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , looking up at [[her]102-becky sister]598-her sister . " Maybe [she]103-tiza wo n't speak to [you]83-milly for two or three days . And if [you]83-milly run after [her]103-tiza [she]103-tiza hides in such queer places [you]83-milly can never find [her]103-tiza . "[102-becky]

" But [mother]1502-mother wants [you]102-becky and [her]103-tiza to come to tea with [us]1748-we this afternoon , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly ; " wo n't [Tiza]103-tiza come ? "[83-milly]

" [I]102-becky suppose mother'll make [her]103-tiza , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , " but [she]1502-mother does n't like it . Have [you]83-milly been on [the fell]1749-the fell ? "[102-becky]

[Milly]83-milly looked puzzled . " Do [you]102-becky mean on [the mountain]1561-the mountain ? No , not yet . [We]1748-we 're going to - morrow when [we]1748-we go to [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's]1751-aunt emma 's . But [we]1748-we 've been to [the river]1681-the river with [father]1498-father . "[83-milly]

" Did [you]83-milly go over the stepping - stones ? "[83-milly]

" No , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " [I]83-milly do n't know what they are . Can [we]1748-we go this evening after tea ? "[83-milly]

" Oh yes , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , " [they]1754-they 're just close by [[your]102-becky house]1755-your house . Does [[your]102-becky mother]1713-your mother let [you]102-becky go in [the water]1757-the water ? "[102-becky]

Now [Becky]102-becky said a great many of these words very funnily , so that [Milly]83-milly could hardly understand [her]102-becky . [She]102-becky said " doos "[102-becky] and " oop , "[102-becky] and " knaw , "[102-becky] and " jist , "[102-becky] and " la - ike , "[102-becky] but it sounded quite pretty from [her]102-becky soft little mouth , and [Milly]83-milly thought [she]102-becky had a very nice way of talking .

" No , [mother]1502-mother does n't let [us]1748-we go in the water here , at least , not unless it 's very warm . [We]1748-we paddle when [we]1748-we go to [the sea]1513-the sea , and some day [father]1498-father says [we]1748-we may have [our]1748-we bath in [the river]1681-the river if it 's very fine . "[102-becky]

" [We]1748-we never have a bath in [the river]1681-the river , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , looking very much astonished at the idea .

" Do [you]1748-we have [your]1748-we bath in [the nursery]281-the nursery like [we]1748-we do ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly .

" [We]1748-we have n't got [a nursery]1764-a nursery , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , staring at [her]83-milly , " [mother]1502-mother puts [us]1748-we in [the toob]1766-the toob on Saturday nights . [I]102-becky do n't mind it but [Tiza]103-tiza does n't like it a bit . Sometimes [she]103-tiza hides when it 's Saturday night , so that [mother]1502-mother ca n't find [her]103-tiza till it 's too late . "[102-becky]

" Do n't [you]1748-we have a bath except on Saturday ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " [Olly]63-olly and [I]83-milly have one every morning . [Mother]62-mother says [we]1748-we should get like shock - headed [Peter]100-peter if [we]1748-we did n't . "[83-milly]

" [I]102-becky do n't know about [him]100-peter , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , shaking [her]102-becky head .

" [He]100-peter 's [a little boy]1768-a little boy in a picture - book . [I]83-milly 'll show [him]100-peter [you]63-olly when [you]63-olly come to tea . But there 's [mother]1502-mother calling . Come along , [Olly]63-olly . [Tiza]103-tiza wo n't come down [Becky]102-becky says . "[83-milly]

" [She]103-tiza 's [a very rude girl]1770-a very rude girl , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who was rather hot and tired with [his]63-olly game , and did n't think it was all fun that [Tiza]103-tiza should always hit [him]63-olly and [he]63-olly should never be able to hit [Tiza]103-tiza . " [I]63-olly wo n't sit next [her]103-tiza when [she]103-tiza comes to tea with [us]1771-us . "[63-olly]

" [Tiza]103-tiza 's only in fun , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , " [she]103-tiza 's always like that . [Tiza]103-tiza , are [you]103-tiza coming down ? [I]102-becky am going to get [baby]1772-baby out , [I]102-becky heard [him]1772-baby crying just now . "[102-becky]

" May [you]83-milly take [baby]1772-baby out all by [yourself]83-milly ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly .

" Why , [I]102-becky always take [him]1772-baby out , and [I]102-becky put [him]1772-baby to sleep at nights ; and [mother]1502-mother says [he]1772-baby wo n't go to sleep for [anybody]1612-anybody as quick as for [me]102-becky , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky proudly .

[Milly]83-milly felt a good deal puzzled . It _ must _ be funny to have no [Nana]79-nana .

" Will [you]63-olly and [he]1772-baby , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , pointing to [Olly]63-olly , " come up this afternoon and help [us]1776-us call the cows ? "[102-becky]

" If [we]1776-us may , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly ; " who calls [them]1777-them ? "[83-milly]

" [Tiza]103-tiza and [I]102-becky , "[102-becky] answered [Becky]102-becky ; " when [I]102-becky 'm [a big girl]1778-a big girl [I]102-becky shall learn how to milk , but [fayther]104-fayther says [I]102-becky 'm too little yet . "[102-becky]

" [I]83-milly wish [I]83-milly lived at [a farm]1779-a farm , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly disconsolately .

[Becky]102-becky did n't quite know what to say to this , so [she]102-becky began to call [Tiza]103-tiza again .

" Swish ! "[102-becky] went something past [them]599-them as quick as lightning . It was [Tiza]103-tiza running to [the house]265-the house . [Olly]63-olly set out to run after [her]103-tiza as fast as [he]63-olly could run , but [he]63-olly came bang up against [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother standing at the farmhouse door , just as [Tiza]103-tiza got safely in and was seen no more .

" Ah , [you]63-olly wo n't catch [Tiza]103-tiza , [master]1780-master , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , patting [his]63-olly head ; " [she]103-tiza 's [a rough girl]1781-a rough girl , always at some tricks or other -- [we]602-we think [she]103-tiza ought to have been [a boy]161-a boy , really . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

" [Mother]62-mother , is n't [Becky]102-becky very nice ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , as [they]602-we walked away . " [[Her]102-becky mother]187-her mother lets [her]102-becky do such a lot of things -- nurse [the baby]1719-the baby , and call the cows , and make pinafores . Oh , [I]83-milly wish [father]1498-father was [a farmer]1786-a farmer . "[83-milly]

" Well , it 's not a bad kind of life when the sun shines , and everything is going right , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton ; " but [I]70-mrs. norton think [you]83-milly had better wait a little bit till the rain comes before [you]83-milly quite make up [your]83-milly mind about it , [Milly]83-milly . "[70-mrs. norton]

But [Milly]83-milly was quite sure [she]83-milly knew enough about it already to make up [her]83-milly mind , and all the way [home]382-home [she]83-milly kept saying to [herself]83-milly , " If [I]83-milly could only turn into [[a little farmer]1787-a little farmer 's girl]1788-a little farmer 's girl ! Why do [n't people]1789-n't people have [fairy godmothers]359-fairy godmothers now like [Cinderella]90-cinderella ? "[83-milly]

CHAPTER IV

OUT ON [THE HILLS]604-the hills

[Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly , and [the four little Westmoreland children]605-the four little westmoreland children , had a very pleasant tea together in the afternoon of [the Nortons]105-the nortons 's first day at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest . [Bessie]97-bessie and [Charlie]96-charlie certainly did n't talk much ; but [Tiza]103-tiza , when once [[her]103-tiza mother]187-her mother had made [her]103-tiza come , thought proper to get rid of a great deal of [her]103-tiza shyness , and to chatter and romp so much that [they]605-the four little westmoreland children quite fell in love with [her]103-tiza , and could not be persuaded to go anywhere or do anything without [her]103-tiza . [Nurse]75-nurse would not let [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly go to call the cows , though [she]187-her mother promised [they]605-the four little westmoreland children should some other day ; but [she]187-her mother took [the whole party]607-the whole party down to the stepping - stones after tea , and great fun it was to see [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza running over the stepping - stones , and jumping from one stone to another like little fawns . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly wanted sorely to go too , but there was no persuading [Nana]79-nana to let [them]605-the four little westmoreland children go without [[their]605-the four little westmoreland children father]212-their father to fish [them]605-the four little westmoreland children out if [they]605-the four little westmoreland children tumbled in , so [they]605-the four little westmoreland children had to content [themselves]605-the four little westmoreland children with dangling [their]605-the four little westmoreland children legs over the first stepping - stone and watching the others . But perhaps [you]609-you do n't quite known what stepping - stones are ? They are large high stones , with flat tops , which [people]1598-people put in , a little way apart from each other , right across [a river]427-a river , so that by stepping from one to the other [you]609-you can cross to the opposite side . Of course [they]612-they only do for little rivers , where the water is n't very deep . And [they]612-they do n't always do even there . Sometimes in [the river [Thora]27-thora]613-the river thora , where [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly 's stepping - stones were , when it rained very much , the water rose so high that it dashed right over the stepping - stones and [nobody]280-nobody could go across . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly saw the stepping - stones covered with water once or twice while [they]605-the four little westmoreland children were at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest ; but the first evening [they]605-the four little westmoreland children saw [them]605-the four little westmoreland children [the river]1681-the river was very low , and the stones stood up high and dry out of the water . [Milly]83-milly thought that stepping - stones were much nicer than [bridges]616-bridges , and that it was the most amusing and interesting way of getting across [a river]427-a river that [she]83-milly knew . But then [Milly]83-milly was inclined to think everything wonderful and interesting at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest -- from the tall mountains that seemed to shut them in all around like a wall , down to the tiny gleaming wild strawberries , that were just beginning to show [their]612-they little scarlet balls on [the banks in [the Ravensnest woods]619-the ravensnest woods]618-the banks in the ravensnest woods . Both [she]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly went to bed after [their]605-the four little westmoreland children first day at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest with [their]605-the four little westmoreland children little hearts full of happiness , and [their]605-the four little westmoreland children little heads full of plans . To - morrow [they]605-the four little westmoreland children were to go to [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's]1751-aunt emma 's , and perhaps the day after that [father]1498-father would take [them]605-the four little westmoreland children to bathe in [the river]1681-the river , and [nurse]1496-nurse would let [them]605-the four little westmoreland children go and help [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza call the cows . Holidays _ were _ nice ; still geography lessons were nice too sometimes , thought [Milly]83-milly sleepily , just as [she]83-milly was slipping , slipping away into dreamland , and in [her]83-milly dreams [her]83-milly faithful little thoughts went back lovingly to [Fräulein]71-fräulein 's kind old face , and to [the capes and islands]624-the capes and islands and seas [she]83-milly had been learning about a week ago .

[ Illustration : " The flowers [Milly]83-milly gathered for [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother "[1496-nurse] ]

The next morning [Mr.]625-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton were busy indoors till about twelve o'clock ; and [the children]198-the children wandered about [the garden]219-the garden with [nurse]1496-nurse , finding out many new nooks and corners , especially a delightful steep path which led up and up into [the woods]593-the woods , till at last it took [the children]198-the children to [a little brown summer - house at]631-a little brown summer - house at [the top , where [they]198-the children could sit and look over the trees below , away to [the river]1681-the river and [the hay - fields]634-the hay - fields and [the mountains]1534-the mountains]632-the top , where they could sit and look over the trees below , away to the river and the hay - fields and the mountains . And between the stones and [this path]636-this path grew the prettiest wild strawberries , only , as [Milly]83-milly said , it was not much good looking for them yet , for there were so few red ones [you]637-you could scarcely get enough to taste what they were like . But in a week or two , [she]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly planned that [they]198-the children would take up a basket with some green leaves in it , and gather a lot for [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother -- enough for regular dessert -- and some wild raspberries too , for these also grew in the wood , to the great delight of [the children]198-the children , who had never seen any before . [They]198-the children began to feel presently as if it would be nothing very extraordinary to find trees covered with barley sugar or jam tarts in [this wonderful wood]641-this wonderful wood . And as for the flowers [Milly]83-milly gathered for [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother , [they]198-the children were a sight to see -- moon - daisies and meadow - sweet , wild roses and ragged - robins , and bright bits of rhododendrons . For both [the woods]593-the woods and [the garden at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]644-the garden at ravensnest were full of rhododendrons of all colours , pink and red , and white and flame colour ; and [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly amused [themselves]198-the children with making up bunches of different coloured flowers with as many different colours in them as [they]198-the children could find . There were no rhododendrons at [Willingham]5-willingham ; and [the children]198-the children thought [them]198-the children the loveliest , gayest things [they]198-the children had ever seen .

But at last twelve o'clock came . [Nurse]75-nurse tidied [the children]198-the children , gave [them]198-the children some biscuits and milk , and then sent [them]198-the children to [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room to find [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother . Only [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton was [there]1539-there , but [she]70-mrs. norton said there was no need to wait for [father]1498-father , as [he]1498-father was out already and would meet [them]198-the children on the way . [They]198-the children were to go straight over [the mountain]1561-the mountain instead of walking round by [the road]428-the road , which would have taken much longer . So off [they]198-the children set -- [Olly]63-olly skipping , and chattering as [he]63-olly always did ; while [Milly]83-milly stuck close to [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother , telling [her]187-her mother every now and then , when [Olly]63-olly left off talking , about [their]198-the children morning in [the wood]655-the wood , the flowers [they]198-the children had gathered and the strawberries [they]198-the children had found . At the top of [the garden]219-the garden was a little gate , and beside the gate stood [Bessie]97-bessie and [Charlie]96-charlie , who had really been watching for [the children]198-the children all the morning , though [they]198-the children did n't dare to come into [the garden]219-the garden without leave .

" [Bessie]97-bessie , [we]198-the children are going to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , running up to [them]198-the children . " Where are [you]97-bessie and [Charlie]96-charlie going to ? "[83-milly]

" Nawhere , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie , who , as usual , had [her]97-bessie pinafore in [her]97-bessie mouth , and never said more than one word at a time if [she]97-bessie could help it .

" Nowhere ! what do [you]97-bessie do all the morning , [Bessie]97-bessie ? "[83-milly]

" [I]97-bessie doan't know , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie , gravely looking up at [her]97-bessie ; " sometimes [I]97-bessie mind [the baby]1719-the baby . "[97-bessie]

" Do [you]97-bessie mind [the baby]1719-the baby , too ? [Dear]1794-dear , [dear]1794-dear ! And what does [Charlie]96-charlie do ? "[83-milly]

" Nawthing , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie again . " [He]96-charlie only makes [himself]96-charlie dirty . "[97-bessie]

" Do n't [you]97-bessie go to [school]1499-school ever ? "[83-milly]

" No , but [mother]1502-mother 's going to send [us]1798-us , "[97-bessie] said [Bessie]97-bessie , whose big eyes grew round and frightened at the idea , as if it was a dreadful prospect . " Are [you]97-bessie going to be away for all day ? "[97-bessie]

" Yes ; [we]1798-us sha n't be back till quite evening , [mother]1502-mother says . Here [she]1502-mother is . Good - bye , [Bessie]97-bessie ; good - bye , [Charlie]96-charlie . Will [you]97-bessie come and play with [us]1798-us to - morrow morning ? "[97-bessie]

[Bessie]97-bessie nodded , but [Charlie]96-charlie ran off without answering ; for [he]96-charlie saw [Olly]63-olly coming , and was afraid [he]96-charlie might want to kiss [him]63-olly . On the other side of the gate [they]659-them had to begin to climb up a steep bit of soft green grass ; and very hard work it was . After quite a little way [the children]198-the children began to puff and pant like two little steam engines .

" It _ is _ a little bit like going [upstairs]435-upstairs , do n't [you]63-olly think , [Olly]63-olly ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , sitting down by [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother on a flat bit of gray stone .

" No , it is n't a bit like going [upstairs]435-upstairs , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , shaking [his]63-olly head ; for [Olly]63-olly always liked contradicting [Milly]83-milly if [he]63-olly could . " It 's like -- it 's like -- walking up [a house]419-a house ! "[63-olly]

Suddenly [they]659-them heard far above [them]659-them a shout of " [Hullo]106-hullo ! "[1498-father] Both [the children]198-the children started up and looked about [them]659-them . It was like [father]1498-father 's voice , but [they]198-the children could n't see [him]1498-father anywhere .

" Where are [you]1498-father , [father]1498-father ? "[1498-father]

" Hullo ! "[1498-father] again . And this time it sounded much nearer to [them]198-the children . Where could it be ? [The children]198-the children began to run about and look behind the bushes and the rocks , till all of a sudden , just as [Milly]83-milly got near a big rock , out jumped [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton from behind [it]665-it with a great shout , and began to run after [her]83-milly . Away ran [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly as fast as [their]659-them small feet could carry [them]659-them , up and down , up and down , till at last there came a steep place -- one of [Milly]83-milly 's feet tripped up , down [she]83-milly went , rolling over and over -- down came [Olly]63-olly on the top of [her]83-milly , and [the two of [them]666-the two of them]666-the two of them rolled away together till [they]666-the two of them stopped at [the bottom of [the steep place]668-the steep place]667-the bottom of the steep place , all mixed up in a heap of legs and arms and hats and pinafores .

" Here 's [a boy]161-a boy and [girl]1805-girl tied up in a knot , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , scrambling down after [them]666-the two of them and lifting [them]666-the two of them up . " There 's no harm done , is there ? "[89-mr. norton]

" [I]83-milly 've got a bump on [my]83-milly arm , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , turning up [her]83-milly sleeve .

" And [I]63-olly 've got a scratch on [my]63-olly nose , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , rubbing it .

" That 's not much for a nice tumble like that , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " [you]83-milly would n't mind another , would [you]83-milly , [Milly]83-milly ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Not a bit , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , merrily skipping along beside [him]89-mr. norton . " Hide again , [father]1498-father . "[83-milly]

" Another day , not now , for [we]1807-we want to get to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's . But tomorrow , if [you]1498-father like , [we]1807-we 'll come up here and have a capital game . Only [we]1807-we must choose [a nice dry place where there are no bogs]1808-a nice dry place where there are no bogs . "[89-mr. norton]

" What are bogs ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" [Wet places]1809-wet places , where [your]1498-father feet go sinking deeper and deeper into the mud , and [you]1498-father ca n't find any stiff firm bit to stand on . Sometimes [people]1598-people sink down and down into a bog till the mud comes right over [their]1598-people head and face and chokes [them]1598-people ; but [we]1807-we have n't got any bogs as bad as that here . Now , [children]1510-children , step along in front . Very soon [we]1807-we shall get to [the top of [the mountain]1561-the mountain]1812-the top of the mountain , and then [we]1807-we shall see wonderful things on [the other side]1814-the other side . "[89-mr. norton]

So [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly ran on , pushing [their]669-we way through the great tall fern , or scampering over the short green grass where the little mountain sheep were nibbling , and where a beautiful creeping moss grew all over the ground , which , [mother]1502-mother told [Milly]83-milly , was called " Stags ' horn moss , "[1502-mother] because its little green branches were so like stags ' horns .

" Now look , [children]1510-children , "[212-their father] shouted [[their]669-we father]212-their father to [them]669-we from behind . " Here [we]669-we are at the top . "[212-their father]

And then , all of a sudden , instead of only [the green mountain]672-the green mountain and the sheep , [they]669-we could see far away on [the other side of [the mountain]1561-the mountain]673-the other side of the mountain . There , all round [them]669-we , were numbers of other mountains ; and below , at [their]669-we feet , were [houses]348-houses and trees and [fields]676-fields , while straight in front lay [a great big blue lake]677-a great big blue lake stretching away ever so far , till [it]677-a great big blue lake seemed to be lost in the sky .

" Look , look , [mother]1502-mother ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , clapping [her]83-milly hands , " there 's [Windermere lake]1817-windermere lake , [the lake [we]669-we saw when [we]669-we were coming from [the station]307-the station]1818-the lake we saw when we were coming from the station . Look at [that steamer]1820-that steamer , with [all the people on board]1821-all the people on board ! [What funny little black people]1822-what funny little black people . And oh , [mother]1502-mother , look at [that little boat]1824-that little boat over there ! How can [people]1598-people go out in [such a weeny boat as that]1826-such a weeny boat as that ? "[83-milly]

" It is n't such [a weeny boat]1827-a weeny boat , [Milly]83-milly . It only looks so small because it 's such a long way off . When [father]1498-father and [I]83-milly take [you]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly on [the lake]1829-the lake , [we]669-we shall go in [a boat just like that]1830-a boat just like that . And now , instead of looking so far away , look just down here below [you]83-milly , and tell [me]83-milly what [you]83-milly see . "[83-milly]

" Some chimneys , and some trees , and some smoke , ever so far down , "[198-the children] shouted [the children]198-the children . " Is it [a house]419-a house , [mother]1502-mother ? "[198-the children]

" That 's [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house , [the old house where [I]83-milly used to come and stay when [I]83-milly was [a little girl]1658-a little girl]1834-the old house where i used to come and stay when i was a little girl , and when [[your]83-milly dear great - grandfather]1836-your dear great - grandfather and [great - grandmother]1837-great - grandmother were alive . [I]83-milly used to think it [the nicest place in [the world]260-the world]1838-the nicest place in the world . "[83-milly]

" Were [you]83-milly [a very little girl]1840-a very little girl , [mother]1502-mother , and were [you]83-milly ever naughty ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , slipping [her]83-milly little hand into [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother 's and beginning to feel rather tired with [her]83-milly long walk .

" [I]83-milly 'm afraid [I]83-milly was very often naughty , [Milly]83-milly . [I]83-milly used to get into great rages and scream , till [everybody]1611-everybody was quite tired out . But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was very good to [me]83-milly , and took a great deal of pains to cure [me]83-milly of going into rages . Besides , it always did [naughty children]1843-naughty children good to live in [the same house]1844-the same house with [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma , and so after a while [I]83-milly got better . Take care how [you]63-olly go , [children]1510-children , it 's very steep just here , and [you]63-olly might soon tumble over on [your]63-olly noses . [Olly]63-olly , take care ! take care ! where _ are _ [you]63-olly going ? "[83-milly]

Where , indeed , was [Olly]63-olly going ? Just the moment before [the little man]680-the little man had spied a lovely flower growing a little way off the path , in the middle of some bright yellow - green moss . And without thinking of anything but getting it , off [he]680-the little man rushed . But oh ! splish , splash , splish , down went [Olly]63-olly 's feet , up splashed the muddy water , and there was [Olly]63-olly stuck in [a bog]681-a bog .

" [Father]1498-father , pull [me]178-the little boy out , pull [me]178-the little boy out ! "[178-the little boy] cried [the little boy]178-the little boy in terror , as [he]178-the little boy felt [his]178-the little boy feet stuck fast . But almost before [he]178-the little boy could speak there was [father]1498-father close beside [him]178-the little boy , standing on a round little hump of dry grass which was sticking up out of [the bog]684-the bog , and with one grip [he]1498-father got hold of [Olly]63-olly under [his]1498-father arm , and then jump ! on to another little hump of grass , jump ! on to another , and there [they]685-we were safe on [the path]495-the path again .

" Oh , [[you]178-the little boy black boy]1848-you black boy ! "[1502-mother] cried [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother and [Milly]83-milly all together . Was there ever such a little object ! All [his]63-olly nice clean holland frock was splashed with black mud ; and what had happened to [his]63-olly stockings ?

" [I]63-olly 've got mud - stockings on , "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , capering about , and pointing to [his]63-olly legs which were caked with mud up to [his]63-olly knees .

" [You]178-the little boy 're [a nice respectable boy to take out to dinner]1849-a nice respectable boy to take out to dinner , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " [I]70-mrs. norton think [we]685-we 'll leave [you]178-the little boy on [the mountain]1561-the mountain to have dinner with [the sheep]1851-the sheep . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh no , [father]1498-father , "[83-milly] pleaded [Milly]83-milly , taking [Olly]63-olly fast by the hand . " [We]685-we can wash [him]63-olly at [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's , [you]1498-father know . "[83-milly]

" Do n't go too close to [him]63-olly , [Milly]83-milly ! "[70-mrs. norton] exclaimed [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " or [you]83-milly 'll get as black as [he]63-olly is . [We]685-we shall have to put [him]63-olly under the pump at [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's , that 's quite certain . But there 's nothing to wash [him]63-olly with [here]1560-here , so [he]63-olly must just go as [he]63-olly is for a bit . Now , [Olly]63-olly , run along and [your]63-olly feet will soon dry . [Father]85-father 's going first , [you]63-olly go next , just where [he]63-olly goes , [I]70-mrs. norton 'm coming after [you]63-olly , and [Milly]83-milly shall go last . Perhaps in that way [we]685-we shall get [you]63-olly down safe . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh , but , [mother]1502-mother , look at [my]63-olly flower , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , holding it up triumphantly . " Is n't it a beauty ? "[63-olly]

" Shall [I]70-mrs. norton tell [you]63-olly what it 's called , [Olly]63-olly ? It 's called a butterwort , and it always grows in boggy places ; [I]70-mrs. norton would n't advise [you]63-olly to go after one again without asking [father]1498-father first . "[70-mrs. norton]

It was a very different thing going down [the mountain]1561-the mountain from climbing up it . It seemed only a few minutes before [they]690-them had got almost to the bottom , and there was a gate leading into [a road]691-a road , and [a little village of white houses in front of [them]690-them]692-a little village of white houses in front of them . [They]690-them walked up [the road]428-the road a little way , and then [father]1498-father opened a big gate and let [them]690-them into [a beautiful garden full of rhododendrons like [the Ravensnest garden]696-the ravensnest garden]695-a beautiful garden full of rhododendrons like the ravensnest garden . And who was this walking down [the drive]697-the drive to meet [them]690-them ? Such [a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap .

" [Dear Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , running up to [her]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap and taking both [her]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap hands and kissing [her]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap .

" Well , [Lucy]107-lucy , "[699-the little lady] said [the little lady]699-the little lady , holding [her]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap hands and looking at [her]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap ( [Lucy]107-lucy was [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton 's Christian name ) , " it _ is _ nice to see [you]698-a pretty little elderly lady , with gray hair and a white cap all here . " Except when [they]1617-little boys tumble into bogs , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , laughing and pulling [Olly]63-olly forward , who was trying to hide [his]63-olly mud - stockings behind [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother . " There 's [a clean tidy boy to bring to dinner]1857-a clean tidy boy to bring to dinner , is n't [he]1857-a clean tidy boy to bring to dinner , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[89-mr. norton]

[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma put up [her]59-aunt emma spectacles to look at [Olly]63-olly .
