"[59-aunt emma]

And then [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma took one of [Milly]83-milly 's hands and one of [Olly]63-olly 's , and up [they]701-we went to [the house]265-the house . But [I]0-i must start another chapter before [I]0-i begin to tell [you]703-you what [the children]198-the children saw in [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house , and of the happy time [they]198-the children spent there .

CHAPTER V

[AUNT EMMA]59-aunt emma 'S PICNIC

Instead of taking [them]198-the children straight into [the house]265-the house , however , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma took [the children]198-the children up [a little shady path]708-a little shady path which very soon brought [them]198-the children to [a white cottage covered with honeysuckle and climbing roses]709-a white cottage covered with honeysuckle and climbing roses .

" This is where [[[my]59-aunt emma coachman]1862-my coachman 's wife lives]1863-my coachman 's wife lives , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " and [she]1863-my coachman 's wife lives owns [a small boy who might perhaps find [you]63-olly a pair of stockings , [Olly]63-olly , to put on while [your]63-olly own are washed]1864-a small boy who might perhaps find you a pair of stockings , olly , to put on while your own are washed . "[59-aunt emma]

[Olly]63-olly opened [his]63-olly brown eyes very wide at the idea of wearing [some other little boy]710-some other little boy 's stockings , but [he]63-olly said nothing .

[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma tapped at the door , and out came [a stout kind - looking woman]711-a stout kind - looking woman .

" [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson , do [you]108-mrs. tyson think [[your]108-mrs. tyson [Johnny]78-johnny]1865-your johnny could lend [[my]711-a stout kind - looking woman little nephew]1866-my little nephew a pair of [his]78-johnny stockings while [we]1867-we get [his]78-johnny own washed ? [Master Olly]63-olly has been tumbling into [a bog]681-a bog by way of making friends with [the mountains]1534-the mountains , and [I]711-a stout kind - looking woman do n't quite know how [I]711-a stout kind - looking woman am to let those legs into [[my]711-a stout kind - looking woman dining - room]1870-my dining - room . "[711-a stout kind - looking woman]

" Dear [me]59-aunt emma , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , but [Johnny'll]109-johnny'll be proud if [he]78-johnny 's got any clean , but [I]59-aunt emma 'll not answer for it . Wo n't [ye]712-they come in ? "[59-aunt emma]

In [they]712-they walked , and there was [a nice tidy kitchen]713-a nice tidy kitchen , with a wooden cradle in the corner , and [a little fair - haired boy]714-a little fair - haired boy sitting by it and rocking [the baby]1719-the baby . This was [Johnny]78-johnny , and [Olly]63-olly looked at [him]78-johnny with great curiosity . " [I]714-a little fair - haired boy 've got bigger legs than [Johnny]78-johnny , "[714-a little fair - haired boy] [he]714-a little fair - haired boy whispered solemnly at last to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , while [they]712-they were waiting for [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson , who had gone [upstairs]435-upstairs to fetch the stockings .

" Perhaps [you]714-a little fair - haired boy eat more bread and milk than [Johnny]78-johnny does , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , very solemnly too , " However , most likely [Johnny]78-johnny 's stockings will stretch . How 's [the baby]1719-the baby , [Johnny]78-johnny ? "[59-aunt emma]

" [She]1719-the baby 's a great deal better , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , "[178-the little boy] said [the little boy]178-the little boy , smiling at [her]108-mrs. tyson . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly made [him]178-the little boy feel shy , but [he]178-the little boy loved [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma .

" Have [you]108-mrs. tyson been taking care of [her]1719-the baby all the morning for [mother]1502-mother ? "[59-aunt emma]

" Yes , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , and [she]1719-the baby 's never cried but once , "[78-johnny] said [Johnny]78-johnny proudly .

" Well done ! Ah ! there comes [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson . Now , [Olly]63-olly , sit up on that chair , and [we]1876-we 'll see to [you]63-olly . "[59-aunt emma]

Off came the dirty stockings , and [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson slipped on a pair of woolen socks that tickled [Olly]63-olly very much . They were very thick , and not a bit like [his]178-the little boy own stockings ; and when [he]178-the little boy got up again [he]178-the little boy kept turning round and round to look at [his]178-the little boy legs , as if [he]178-the little boy could n't make them out .

" Do they feel funny to [you]178-the little boy ? "[108-mrs. tyson] said [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson , patting [his]178-the little boy shoulder . " Never [you]178-the little boy mind , [little master]1877-little master ; [I]108-mrs. tyson know they 're nice and warm , for [I]108-mrs. tyson knitted them [myself]108-mrs. tyson . "[108-mrs. tyson]

" [Mother]62-mother buys [our]1876-we stockings in [the shop]1878-the shop , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , when [they]718-they got outside again ; " why does n't [Mrs. Tyson]108-mrs. tyson ? "[63-olly]

" Perhaps [we]1876-we have n't [so many shops]1879-so many shops , or such nice ones here , [Olly]63-olly , as [you]63-olly have at [Willingham]5-willingham ; and [the people here]1880-the people here have always been used to do a great many things for [themselves]1880-the people here . Some of [them]1880-the people here live in [such lonely places among [the mountains]1534-the mountains]1881-such lonely places among the mountains that it is very difficult for [them]1880-the people here to get to [any shops]1883-any shops . Not very long ago [the mothers]1884-the mothers used to make all the stuffs for [their]1884-the mothers own dresses and [[their]1884-the mothers children]568-their children 's . What would [you]63-olly say , [Milly]83-milly , if [mother]1502-mother had to weave the stuff for it every time [you]63-olly had a new dress ? "[108-mrs. tyson]

" [Mother]62-mother would n't give [me]83-milly a great many new dresses , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , gravely , shaking [her]83-milly head . " [I]83-milly like shops best , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . "[83-milly]

" Well , [I]59-aunt emma suppose it 's best to like what [we]720-we 've got , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , laughing .

Indoors , [Olly]63-olly 's muddy stockings were given to [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's maid , who promised to have them washed and dried by the time [they]720-we had to go [home]382-home]719-aunt emma 's maid , who promised to have them washed and dried by the time they had to go home , and then , when [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton had covered up the black spots on [his]63-olly frock with a clean pinafore [she]70-mrs. norton had brought with [her]70-mrs. norton , [Olly]63-olly looked quite respectable again .

[The children]198-the children thought [they]198-the children had never seen quite such [a nice house as [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's]723-a nice house as aunt emma 's . First of all [it]723-a nice house as aunt emma 's had [a large hall]724-a large hall , with all kinds of corners in [it]724-a large hall , just made for playing hide - and - seek in ; and [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room was full of the most delightful things . There were stuffed birds in cases , and [little ivory chessmen]726-little ivory chessmen riding upon ivory elephants . There were picture - books , and there were mysterious drawers full of cards and puzzles , and glass marbles and old - fashioned toys , that [[the children]198-the children 's mother]728-the children 's mother and [aunts]729-aunts and [uncles]730-uncles , and [[their]198-the children great - aunts]731-their great - aunts and [uncles]730-uncles before that , had loved and played with years and years ago . On the wall hung a great many pictures , some of them of [funny little stiff boys in blue coats with brass buttons]733-funny little stiff boys in blue coats with brass buttons , and some of [them]734-them of [little girls with mob - caps and mittens]735-little girls with mob - caps and mittens , and [these little boys]736-these little boys and [girls]737-girls were all either dead now , or [elderly men]738-elderly men and [women]739-women , for [they]736-these little boys were [the great - aunts]740-the great - aunts and [uncles]730-uncles ; and over the mantelpiece hung a picture of [a lovely old lady , with bright , soft brown hair and smiling eyes and lips]742-a lovely old lady , with bright , soft brown hair and smiling eyes and lips , that looked as if [they]743-their were just going to speak to the two strange little children who had come for [their]743-their first visit to [[[their]743-their mother]189-their mother 's old home]745-their mother 's old home . [Milly]83-milly knew quite well that it was a picture of [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma . [She]83-milly had seen others like it before , only not so large as this one , and [she]83-milly looked at it quietly , with [her]83-milly grave blue eyes , while [Olly]63-olly was eagerly wandering round [the room]193-the room , spying into everything , and longing to touch this , that , and the other , if only [mother]1502-mother would let go [his]63-olly hand .

" [You]83-milly know who that is , do n't [you]83-milly , [little woman]1887-little woman ? "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , taking [her]83-milly up on [her]59-aunt emma knee .

" Yes , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , nodding , " it 's [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma . [I]83-milly wish [we]1889-we could have seen [her]1845-great - grandmamma . "[83-milly]

" [I]59-aunt emma wish [you]83-milly could , [Milly]83-milly . [She]1845-great - grandmamma would have smiled at [you]83-milly as [she]1845-great - grandmamma is smiling in the picture and [you]83-milly would have been sure to have loved [her]1845-great - grandmamma ; [all little children]1890-all little children did . [I]59-aunt emma can remember seeing [[your]83-milly mother]1713-your mother , [Milly]83-milly , when [she]1713-your mother was about as old as [you]83-milly , cuddled up in a corner of that sofa over there , in ' [grandmamma]1565-grandmamma 's pocket , ' as [she]1713-your mother used to call it , listening with all [her]1713-your mother ears to [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma 's stories . There was one story called ' [Leonora]110-leonora ' that went on for years and years , till [all the little children in it]1894-all the little children in it -- and [the little children who listened to it -- were almost grown up]1895-the little children who listened to it -- were almost grown up ; and then [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma always carried about with [her]1845-great - grandmamma a wonderful blue - silk bag full of treasures , which [we]1897-we used to be allowed to turn out whenever any of [us]1897-we had been quite good at [our]1897-we lessons for a whole week . "[59-aunt emma]

" [Mother]62-mother has a bag like that , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly ; " it has lots of little toys in it that [father]1498-father had when [he]1498-father was [a little boy]1768-a little boy . [She]62-mother lets [us]1897-we look at it on [our]1897-we birthdays . Can [you]63-olly tell stories , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[83-milly]

" Tell [us]1897-we about [old Mother Quiverquake]62-mother , "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , running up and climbing on [[his]63-olly aunt]749-his aunt 's knee .

" Oh dear , no ! "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ; " it 's much too fine to - day for stories -- indoors , at any rate . Wait till [we]1897-we get a real wet day , and then [we]1897-we 'll see . After dinner to - day , what do [you]63-olly think [we]1897-we 're going to do ? Suppose [we]1897-we have a row on [the lake]1829-the lake to get water - lilies , and suppose [we]1897-we take a kettle and make [ourselves]1897-we some tea on [the other side of [the lake]1829-the lake]1901-the other side of the lake . What would [you]63-olly say to that , [Master Olly]63-olly ? "[59-aunt emma]

[The children]198-the children began to dance about with delight at the idea of a row and a picnic both together , when suddenly there was a knock at the door , and when [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma said , " Come in ! "[59-aunt emma] what do [you]198-the children think appeared ? Why , a great green cage , carried by [a servant]751-a servant , and in [it]752-it a gray parrot , swinging about from side to side , and cocking [his]753-his head wickedly , first over one shoulder and then over the other .

" Now , [children]1510-children , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , while [the children]198-the children stood quite still with surprise , " let [me]59-aunt emma introduce [you]1510-children to [[my]59-aunt emma old friend]1904-my old friend , [Mr. Poll Parrot]111-mr. poll parrot . Perhaps [you]1510-children thought [I]59-aunt emma lived all alone in [this big house]1905-this big house . Not at all . Here is [somebody who talks to [me]59-aunt emma when [I]59-aunt emma talk to [him]1904-my old friend , who sings and chatters and whistles and cheers [me]59-aunt emma up wonderfully in the winter evenings , when the rains come and make [me]59-aunt emma feel dull]1906-somebody who talks to me when i talk to him , who sings and chatters and whistles and cheers me up wonderfully in the winter evenings , when the rains come and make me feel dull . Put [him]1904-my old friend down here , [Margaret]93-auntie margaret , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma to [the maid]755-the maid , clearing a small table for the cage . " Now , [Olly]63-olly , what do [you]63-olly think of [my]59-aunt emma parrot ? "[59-aunt emma]

" Can it talk ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly , looking at it with very wide open eyes .

" It _ can _ talk ; whether it _ will _ talk is quite another thing . Parrots are contradictious birds . [I]59-aunt emma feel very often as if [I]59-aunt emma should like to beat [Polly]72-polly , [he]1904-my old friend 's so provoking . Now , [Polly]72-polly , how are [you]72-polly to - day ? "[59-aunt emma]

" [Polly]72-polly 's got a bad cold ; fetch [the doc--]1907-the doc-- "[59-aunt emma] said the bird at once , in such a funny cracked voice , that it made [Olly]63-olly jump as if [he]63-olly had heard [one of the witches in [Grimm]112-grimm]756-one of the witches in grimm 's " Fairy Tales "[756-one of the witches in grimm] talking .

" Come , [Polly]72-polly , that 's very well behaved of [you]72-polly ; but [you]72-polly must n't leave off in the middle , begin again . [Olly]63-olly , if [you]72-polly do n't keep [your]72-polly fingers out of the way [Polly]72-polly will snap them up for [his]63-olly dinner . [Parrots]113-parrots like fingers very much . "[63-olly] [Olly]63-olly put [his]63-olly hands behind [his]63-olly back in a great hurry , and [mother]1502-mother came to stand behind [him]63-olly to keep [him]63-olly quiet . By this time , however , [Polly]72-polly had begun to find out that there were [some new people in [the room]193-the room [he]63-olly did n't know]758-some new people in the room he did n't know , and for a long time [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma could not make [him]63-olly talk at all . [He]63-olly would do nothing but put [his]63-olly head first on one side and then on the other and make angry clicks with [his]63-olly beak .

" Come , [Polly]72-polly , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " what [a cross parrot]1908-a cross parrot [you]72-polly are . One -- two -- three -- four . Now , [Polly]72-polly , count . "[59-aunt emma]

" [Polly]72-polly 's got a bad cold , fetch the doc-- "[72-polly] said [Polly]72-polly again while [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was speaking . " One -- two -- six -- seven -- eight -- nine -- two--_Quick _ march ! "[59-aunt emma]

And then [Polly]72-polly began to lift first one claw and then the other as if [he]63-olly were marching , while [the children]198-the children shouted with laughter at [his]63-olly ridiculous ways and [his]63-olly gruff cracked voice .

Then [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma went behind [him]63-olly and rapped gently on the table . [The parrot]761-the parrot stopped marching , stuck [his]761-the parrot head on one side and listened . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma rapped again .

" Come in ! "[761-the parrot] said the parrot suddenly , quite softly , as if [he]761-the parrot had turned into quite [another person]762-another person . " Hush -- sh -- sh , [cat]1909-cat 's got a mouse ! "[761-the parrot]

" Well , [Polly]72-polly , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " [I]59-aunt emma suppose [she]1909-cat may have a mouse if [she]1909-cat likes . Is that all [you]72-polly 've got to tell [us]1910-us ? [Polly]72-polly , where 's [gardener]1705-gardener ? "[59-aunt emma]

" Get away ! get away ! "[72-polly] screamed [Polly]72-polly , while all [his]63-olly feathers began to stand up straight , and [his]63-olly eyes looked fierce and red like two little live coals .

" That always makes [him]63-olly cross , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ; " [he]63-olly ca n't [bear gardener]1912-bear gardener . Come , [Polly]72-polly , do n't get in such a temper . "[59-aunt emma]

" Oh , is n't [he]63-olly like the witches on the broom - sticks in [our]1910-us fairy - book , [Olly]63-olly ? "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly . " Do n't [you]72-polly think , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , [he]63-olly must have been changed into something ? Perhaps [he]63-olly was [a wicked witch]1913-a wicked witch once , or [a magician]1914-a magician , [you]72-polly know , and [the fairies]1915-the fairies changed [him]63-olly into a parrot . "[83-milly]

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [I]59-aunt emma ca n't say . [He]63-olly was a parrot when [I]59-aunt emma had [him]63-olly first , twelve years ago . That 's all [I]59-aunt emma know about it . But [I]59-aunt emma believe [he]63-olly 's very old . [Some people]1916-some people say [he]63-olly 's older than [I]59-aunt emma am -- think of that ! So [you]72-polly see [he]63-olly 's had time to be a good many things . Well , [Polly]72-polly , good - night . [You]72-polly 're not a nice bird to - night at all . Take [him]63-olly away , [Margaret]93-auntie margaret . "[59-aunt emma]

" [Jane]114-jane ! [Jane]114-jane ! "[72-polly] screamed [Polly]72-polly , as [the maid]755-the maid lifted up the cage again . " Make haste , [Jane]114-jane ! cat 's in the larder ! "[755-the maid]

" Oh , [you]72-polly bad [Polly]72-polly , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " [you]72-polly 're always telling tales . [Jane]114-jane 's [[my]59-aunt emma cook]1917-my cook , [Milly]83-milly , and [Polly]72-polly does n't like cats , so [you]72-polly see [he]63-olly tries to make [Jane]114-jane believe that [our]1918-our old cat steals the meat out of the larder . Good - bye , [Polly]72-polly , good - bye . [You]72-polly 're [an ill - natured old bird]1919-an ill - natured old bird , but [I]59-aunt emma 'm very fond of [you]72-polly all the same . "[59-aunt emma]

" Do get [us]1918-our a parrot , [mother]1502-mother ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , jumping about round [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother , when [Polly]72-polly was gone .

" How many more things will [you]63-olly want before [you]63-olly get [home]382-home , [Olly]63-olly , do [you]63-olly think ? "[185-his mother] asked [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother , kissing [him]63-olly . " Perhaps [you]63-olly 'll want to take [home]382-home [a few mountains]1923-a few mountains , and [two or three little rivers]1924-two or three little rivers , and [a bog]681-a bog or two , and a few sheep -- eh , [young man]1926-young man ? "[185-his mother]

By this time dinner was ready , and there was the dinner - bell ringing . Up ran [the children]198-the children to [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's room]767-aunt emma 's room to get [their]198-the children hands washed and [their]198-the children hair brushed , and presently there were [two tidy little folks sitting on either side of [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's chair]768-two tidy little folks sitting on either side of aunt emma 's chair , and thinking to [themselves]768-two tidy little folks sitting on either side of aunt emma 's chair that [they]768-two tidy little folks sitting on either side of aunt emma 's chair had never felt quite so hungry before . But hungry as [Milly]83-milly was [she]83-milly did n't forget to look out of the window before [she]83-milly began [her]83-milly dinner , and it was worth while looking out of the window in [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's dining - room]769-aunt emma 's dining - room .

Before the windows was a green lawn , like [the lawn at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]770-the lawn at ravensnest , only [this lawn]771-this lawn went sloping away , away till there was just [a little rim of white beach]772-a little rim of white beach , and then beyond came [the wide , dancing blue lake]773-the wide , dancing blue lake , that [the children]198-the children had seen from [the top of [the mountain]1561-the mountain]1812-the top of the mountain . Here it was close to [them]198-the children , so close that [Milly]83-milly could hear the little waves plashing , through the open window .

" [Milly]83-milly , "[59-aunt emma] whispered [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma when [they]198-the children were all waiting for pudding , " do [you]83-milly see [that little house down there by [the water]1757-the water 's edge]1927-that little house down there by the water 's edge ? That 's where [the boat]1929-the boat lives -- [we]198-the children call it [a boathouse]1930-a boathouse . Do [you]83-milly think [you]83-milly 'll be frightened of the water , [little woman]1887-little woman ? "[59-aunt emma]

" No , [I]83-milly do n't think so , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , shaking [her]83-milly little wise head gravely . " [I]83-milly am frightened sometimes , very . [Mother]62-mother calls [me]83-milly a little goose because [I]83-milly run away from [Jenny]87-jenny sometimes -- that 's [our]198-the children cow at [home]382-home , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , but then [she]87-jenny 's got such long horns , and [I]83-milly ca n't help feeling afraid . "[83-milly]

" Well , [the lake]1829-the lake has n't got horns , [Milly]83-milly , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , laughing , " so perhaps [you]83-milly will manage not to be afraid of it . "[59-aunt emma]

How kind and nice [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma looked as [she]59-aunt emma sat between [the children]198-the children , with [her]59-aunt emma pretty soft gray hair , and [her]59-aunt emma white cap and large white collar . [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton could not help thinking of the times when [she]70-mrs. norton was [a little girl]1658-a little girl , and used always to insist on sitting by [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma at dinner - time . That was before [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's hair had turned gray . And now here were [[her]59-aunt emma own little children]779-her own little children sitting where [she]59-aunt emma used to sit at [their]779-her own little children age , and stealing [their]779-her own little children small hands into [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's lap as [she]59-aunt emma used to do so long ago .

After dinner [the children]198-the children had to sit quiet in [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room for a time , while [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother talked ; but [they]198-the children had picture - books to look at , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma gave [them]198-the children leave to turn out everything in one of the toy - drawers , and that kept [them]198-the children busy and happy for a long time . But at last , just when [Olly]63-olly was beginning to get tired of the drawer , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma called to [them]198-the children from the other end of [the room]193-the room to come with [her]59-aunt emma into [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen for a minute . Up jumped [the children]198-the children and ran after [[their]198-the children aunt]787-their aunt across [the hall]788-the hall into [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen .

" Now , [children]1510-children , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , pointing to a big basket on the kitchen table , " suppose [you]1510-children help [me]59-aunt emma to pack up [our]1935-our tea - things . [Olly]63-olly , [you]1510-children go and fetch the spoons , and , [Milly]83-milly , bring the plates one by one . "[59-aunt emma]

The tea things were all piled up on the kitchen table , and [the children]198-the children brought [them]198-the children one after another to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma to pack them carefully into the big basket .

" Ai n't [I]63-olly [a useful boy]1936-a useful boy , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly proudly , coming up laden with a big table - cloth which [he]63-olly could scarcely carry .

" Very useful , [Olly]63-olly , though [our]1935-our table - cloth wo n't look over tidy at tea if [you]1510-children crumple it up like that . Now , [Milly]83-milly , bring [me]63-olly that tray of bread and the little bundle of salt ; and , [Olly]63-olly , bring [me]63-olly that bit of butter over there , done up in the green leaves , but mind [you]1510-children carry it carefully . Now for some knives too ; and there are the cups and saucers , [Milly]83-milly , look , in that corner ; and there is the cake all ready cut up , and there is the bread and butter . Now have [we]1935-our got everything ? Everything , [I]63-olly think , but the kettle , and some wood and some matches , and these must go in another basket . "[63-olly]

" [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , creeping up close to [her]59-aunt emma , " were [you]59-aunt emma ever [a fairy godmother]1937-a fairy godmother ? "[83-milly]

" Not that [I]63-olly know of , [Milly]83-milly . Would [you]59-aunt emma like [me]63-olly better if [I]63-olly had a wand and a pair of pet dragons , like [old Fairy Blackstick]115-old fairy blackstick ? "[63-olly]

" No , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , stroking [[her]83-milly aunt]791-her aunt 's hand , " but [you]59-aunt emma do such nice things , just like [fairy godmothers]359-fairy godmothers do . "[83-milly]

" Do [I]63-olly , [little woman]1887-little woman ? [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma likes doing nice things for [good children]1940-good children . But now come along , it 's quite time [we]792-we were off . Let [us]792-we go and fetch [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother . [Gardener]65-gardener will bring the baskets . "[63-olly]

Such a merry party [they]792-we were , trooping down to [the boathouse]793-the boathouse . There lay [the boat]1929-the boat ; [a pretty new boat]795-a pretty new boat , painted dark blue , with a little red flag floating at [her]795-a pretty new boat bows , and [her]795-a pretty new boat name , " [Ariel]116-ariel , "[83-milly] written in large white letters on the stern . And all around [the boathouse]793-the boathouse stretched the beautiful blue water , so clear and sunny and sparkling that it dazzled [Milly]83-milly 's eyes to look at it . [She]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly were lifted into [the boat]1929-the boat beside [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [mother]1502-mother , [father]1498-father sat in the middle and took the oars , while [gardener]1705-gardener put the baskets into the stern , and then , untying the rope which kept [the boat]1929-the boat tied into [the boathouse]793-the boathouse , [he]1705-gardener gave [it]1929-the boat a good push with one hand and off [she]83-milly went out into [the blue lake]803-the blue lake , rising up and down on [the water]1757-the water like a swan .

" Oh ! [mother]1502-mother , [mother]1502-mother , look up there , "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , " there 's [the mountain]1561-the mountain . Is n't that where [we]807-they climbed up this morning ? "[63-olly]

Yes , there it was , [the beautiful green rocky mountain]805-the beautiful green rocky mountain , rising up above [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house . [They]807-they could see it all so clearly as [they]807-they got farther out into [the lake]1829-the lake ; first the blue sky , then [the mountain with the little white dots on it , which [Milly]83-milly knew were sheep]809-the mountain with the little white dots on it , which milly knew were sheep ; then some trees , and in front , [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house with [the lawn]270-the lawn and [the boathouse]793-the boathouse . And as [they]807-they looked all round [them]807-they [they]807-they could see [far bigger and grander mountains than [Brownholme]24-brownholme]813-far bigger and grander mountains than brownholme , [some near and green like Brownholme]814-some near and green like brownholme , and some far away and blue like the sky , while down by the edge of [the lake]1829-the lake were hayfields full of flowers , or bits of rock with trees growing on the top of them . [The children]198-the children hardly knew what it was made [them]198-the children so quiet ; but [I]0-i think it was because everything was so beautiful . [They]198-the children were really in [[the hill - fairies]817-the hill - fairies ' palace]818-the hill - fairies ' palace now .

" Are n't there any water - fairies in [this lake]1946-this lake , [mother]1502-mother ? "[83-milly] whispered [Milly]83-milly , presently , looking down into [the clear blue water]819-the clear blue water , and trying to see the bottom .

" [I]83-milly ca n't tell , [Milly]83-milly , [I]83-milly never saw any . But there used to be water - fairies in old days . After tea suppose [we]807-they ask [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma to tell [us]807-they a story about [a king in olden times whom [the water - fairies]1949-the water - fairies loved]1948-a king in olden times whom the water - fairies loved ; [she]59-aunt emma used to tell it to [me]83-milly when [I]83-milly was small , and [I]83-milly liked it best of all stories . But , [Olly]63-olly , [you]63-olly must sit still , or [the boat]1929-the boat will go tipping over to one side , and [father]1498-father wo n't be able to row . "[83-milly]

" Do let [me]63-olly row , [father]1498-father , "[63-olly] begged [Olly]63-olly .

" Not yet , [old man]1571-old man -- [I]83-milly must get used to [the boat]1929-the boat first , and find out how to manage [her]59-aunt emma , but presently [you]63-olly shall come and try , and so shall [Milly]83-milly if [she]59-aunt emma likes . "[83-milly]

On [they]820-we rowed , farther and farther from [the shore]821-the shore , till [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house began to look quite small , and [they]820-we could hardly see [the gardener working on the lawn]823-the gardener working on the lawn .

" [Father]85-father , what a long way [we]820-we 've come , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , looking all round . " Where are [we]820-we going to ? "[83-milly]

" Well , presently , [Milly]83-milly , [I]83-milly am going to turn [the boat]1929-the boat a little bit , so as to make [her]59-aunt emma go over to [that side of [the lake]1829-the lake]1956-that side of the lake over there . Do [you]63-olly see a big rock with some trees on it , far away , sticking out into [the lake]1829-the lake ? "[83-milly]

" Yes , "[198-the children] said [the children]198-the children , looking very hard .

" Well , that 's where [we]820-we 're going to have tea . It 's called [Birdsnest Point]28-birdsnest point , because the rocks come out in a point into [the lake]1829-the lake . But first [I]83-milly thought [I]83-milly would bring [you]63-olly right out into [the middle of [the lake]1829-the lake]1960-the middle of the lake , that [you]63-olly might see how big it is , and look at [the mountains]1534-the mountains all round . "[83-milly] " [Father]85-father , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " if a big stone fell down out of the sky and made ever such a big hole in [the boat]1929-the boat , and the water came into [the hole]1964-the hole , should [we]820-we all be dead ? "[63-olly]

" [I]83-milly daresay [we]820-we should , [Olly]63-olly , for [I]83-milly do n't think [I]83-milly could carry [mother]1502-mother , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , and [Milly]83-milly , and [you]63-olly on [my]83-milly back , safe [home]382-home again , and [you]63-olly see none of [you]63-olly can swim but [me]83-milly . "[83-milly]

" Then [I]83-milly hope a big stone wo n't come , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , feeling just a little bit frightened at [Olly]63-olly 's suggestion .

" Well , big stones do n't grow in the sky generally , [Milly]83-milly , if that 's any comfort to [you]83-milly . But do [you]83-milly know , one day long ago , when [I]83-milly was out rowing on [this lake]1946-this lake , [I]83-milly thought all of a sudden [I]83-milly heard [some one shouting and screaming]1968-some one shouting and screaming , and for a long time [I]83-milly looked and waited , but could see nothing ; till at last [I]83-milly fancied [I]83-milly could see , a long distance off , what looked like a pole , with something white tied to it . And [I]83-milly rowed , and rowed , and rowed , as fast as [I]83-milly could , and all the time the shouting and screaming went on , and at last what do [you]83-milly think [I]83-milly saw ? [I]83-milly saw [a boat]1969-a boat , which looked as if something was dragging [it]1969-a boat down into [the water]1757-the water . Part of it had already sunk down into [the lake]1829-the lake , and in the part which was still above [the water]1757-the water there were [three people]1973-three people sitting , [a gentleman]1974-a gentleman , and [two little girls who looked about ten years old]1975-two little girls who looked about ten years old . And [they]1973-three people were shouting ' Help ! help ! ' at the top of [their]1973-three people voices , and waving an oar with a handkerchief tied to it . And [the boat in which [they]1973-three people sat]1976-the boat in which they sat was sinking farther and farther into [the water]1757-the water , and if [I]83-milly had'n't come up just when [I]83-milly did , [the gentleman]1978-the gentleman and [the two little girls]1979-the two little girls would have been drowned . "[83-milly]

" Oh , [father]1498-father ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , " what made [[their]1973-three people boat]1981-their boat do like that ? And did [they]1973-three people get into [yours]1498-father ? "[83-milly]

" There was a great hole in the bottom of [[their]1973-three people boat]1981-their boat , [Milly]83-milly , and the water was coming through it , and making [the boat]1929-the boat so heavy that it was sinking down and down into [the lake]1829-the lake , just as a stone would sink if [you]1498-father threw it in . How the hole came there [we]1985-we never quite knew : [I]83-milly thought [they]1973-three people must have knocked [[their]1973-three people boat]1981-their boat against a sharp rock -- in [some parts of [the lake]1829-the lake]1987-some parts of the lake there are rocks under the water which [you]1498-father ca n't see -- and the rock had made the hole ; but [other people]1989-other people thought it had happened in some other way . However , there [they]1973-three people were , and when [I]83-milly took [them]1973-three people all into [[my]83-milly boat]1990-my boat [you]1498-father never saw such miserable little creatures as [the two little girls]1979-the two little girls were . [They]1973-three people were wet through , [they]1973-three people were as white as little ghosts , and when [they]1973-three people were safe in [[my]83-milly boat]1990-my boat [they]1973-three people began to cry and shake so , [poor little souls]1640-poor little souls , though [[their]1973-three people father]212-their father and [I]83-milly wrapped [them]1973-three people up in [our]1995-our coats , that [I]83-milly did want [[their]1973-three people mother]189-their mother to come and comfort [them]1973-three people . "[83-milly]

" Oh , but , [father]1498-father , [you]1498-father took [them]1973-three people safe [home]382-home to [[their]1973-three people mother]189-their mother , did n't [you]1498-father ? And do tell [me]83-milly what [she]189-their mother said . "[83-milly]

" [They]1973-three people had [no mother]2000-no mother , [Milly]83-milly , [they]1973-three people had only [[their]1973-three people father]212-their father , who was with [them]1973-three people . But [he]212-their father was very good to [them]1973-three people , and [I]83-milly think on the whole [they]1973-three people were [happy little girls]2002-happy little girls . The Christmas after that [I]83-milly got a little parcel one morning , and what do [you]83-milly think was in it ? Why , two photographs of [the same little girls]2003-the same little girls , looking so neat and tidy and happy , [I]83-milly could hardly believe [they]1973-three people were really the same as the little drowned rats [I]83-milly had pulled out of the water . Ask [mother]1502-mother to show [you]83-milly the pictures when [we]2005-we get [home]382-home ; [she]1502-mother has them somewhere . Now , [Olly]63-olly , would [you]63-olly like to row ? "[83-milly]

" Oh , [father]1498-father , do n't bump against any rocks , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , whose thoughts were very full of [the little girls]825-the little girls .

" Do n't [you]83-milly trouble [your]83-milly head about rocks , [old woman]2008-old woman . [I]1502-mother know a good deal more about [this lake]1946-this lake than [[those little girls]2010-those little girls ' father]2011-those little girls ' father did , and [I]1502-mother wo n't take [you]63-olly into any harm . Come along , [Olly]63-olly . "[1502-mother]

[Olly]63-olly was helped along [the boat]1929-the boat by [mother]1502-mother and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma till [[his]63-olly father]262-his father caught hold of [him]63-olly and pulled [him]63-olly on to [his]63-olly seat , where [he]262-his father let [him]63-olly put [his]63-olly two small paws on one of the oars , and try what [he]63-olly could do with it . [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton pulled too ; but [Olly]63-olly thought it was all [his]89-mr. norton doing , and that it was really [he]89-mr. norton who was making [the boat]1929-the boat go .

" Do n't [we]2012-we go fast , [father]1498-father ? "[63-olly] [he]63-olly cried out presently , [his]63-olly little face flushed with pleasure and excitement . " [You]1498-father could n't row so fast without [me]63-olly , could [you]1498-father , [father]1498-father ? "[63-olly]

" [You]63-olly little fly - on - the - wheel , "[262-his father] said [[his]63-olly father]262-his father , smiling at [him]63-olly .

" What does that mean , [father]1498-father ? "[262-his father]

" Never mind , [you]63-olly 'll know when [you]63-olly 're bigger . But now look , [children]1510-children , how close [we]2017-we are coming to [the shore]821-the shore . And quick , [Milly]83-milly , quick ! What do [you]83-milly see over there ? "[89-mr. norton]

[Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton pointed over [the water]1757-the water to a place where some green rushes were standing up out of [the water]1757-the water , not very far from the edge . What were those great white and gold things shining among the rushes ; and what were those large round green leaves lying on the water all about them ?

" Water - lilies ! water - lilies ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , stamping [her]83-milly little feet with delight . " Oh , [mother]1502-mother , look ! it was on one of those leaves that [the old toad]2020-the old toad put [little Tiny]117-little tiny in [my]83-milly fairy - book , do n't [you]83-milly remember ? Only the little fishes came and bit off the stalk and set [her]83-milly free . Oh , [I]83-milly wish [we]2017-we could see [little Tiny]117-little tiny sitting on one of those leaves ! "[83-milly]

" Well , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " there 's no saying what [you]83-milly may find in these parts if [you]83-milly look long enough . This is [a very strange country]2021-a very strange country . But now , [Milly]83-milly , look out for the lilies . [Father]85-father 's going to take [us]2017-we in among them , and [I]59-aunt emma 'll hold [you]83-milly , while [you]83-milly gather them . "[59-aunt emma]

And presently , swish went [the boat]1929-the boat up against the rushes , and there were the lovely white lilies lying spread out on the water all round them , some quite open and showing [their]834-their golden middles , and some still buds , with their wet green cases just falling off , and their white petals beginning to unclose . But what slippery stalks [they]835-they had . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma held [Milly]83-milly , and [father]1498-father held [Olly]63-olly , while [they]835-they dived [their]835-they hands under the water and pulled hard . And some of the lilies came out with such short bits of stalk [you]837-you could scarcely hold them , and sometimes , flop ! out came a long green stalk , like a long green snake curling and twisting about in [the boat]1929-the boat . [The children]198-the children dabbled , and splashed , and pulled , to [their]198-the children hearts ' content , till at last [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton told [them]198-the children [they]198-the children had got enough and now [they]198-the children must sit quite still while [he]89-mr. norton rowed [them]198-the children in to [the land]840-the land .

" Oh , [father]1498-father , just those two over there ! "[83-milly] pleaded [Milly]83-milly , who could not bear leaving so many beauties behind .

" No , [Milly]83-milly , no more . Look where the sun is now . If [we]198-the children do n't make haste and have [our]198-the children tea , [we]198-the children shall never get back to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest to - night . "[83-milly]

[Milly]83-milly 's face looked as if it would like to cry , as [the boat]1929-the boat began to move away from the rushes , and the beautiful lilies were left behind . [I]0-i told [you]842-you , to begin with , that [Milly]83-milly was ready to cry oftener than [a sensible little girl]843-a sensible little girl should . But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was not going to have any crying at [her]59-aunt emma picnic .

" Who 's going to gather [me]59-aunt emma sticks to make [my]59-aunt emma fire ? "[59-aunt emma] [she]59-aunt emma said suddenly , in a solemn voice .

" [I]198-the children am ! [I]198-the children am ! "[198-the children] shouted both [the children]198-the children at once , and out came [Milly]83-milly 's smiles again , like the sun from behind a cloud .

" And who 's going to lay the table - cloth ? "[83-milly]

" [We]198-the children are ! [we]198-the children are ! "[59-aunt emma]

" And who 's going to hand the bread and butter ? "[83-milly]

" [I]83-milly am ! "[83-milly] exclaimed [Milly]83-milly , " and [Olly]63-olly shall hand the cake . "[83-milly]

" And who 's going to _ eat _ the bread and butter ? "[83-milly]

" [All of [us]2023-all of us]2023-all of us ! "[198-the children] shouted [the children]198-the children , and [Milly]83-milly added , " [Father]85-father will want a _ big _ plate of bread and butter , [I]83-milly daresay . "[83-milly]

" [I]89-mr. norton should think [he]63-olly would , after all this rowing , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Now then , look out for a bump ! "[89-mr. norton]

[ Illustration : " So [they]198-the children put [Olly]63-olly up on [a tall piece of rock]2024-a tall piece of rock , and [he]63-olly sang . "[89-mr. norton] ]

Bump ! Splash ! there was [the boat]1929-the boat scraping along the pebbles near [the shore]821-the shore ; out sprang [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , first on to a big stone , then on to [the shore]821-the shore , and with one great pull [he]89-mr. norton brought [the boat]1929-the boat in till it was close enough for [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton to step on to the rocks , and for [the children]198-the children to be lifted out .

" Oh ! what [a nice place]2025-a nice place ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , looking about [her]83-milly , and clapping [her]83-milly hands , as [she]83-milly always did when [she]83-milly was pleased . It was a point of rock running out into [the lake]1829-the lake , [a " peninsula "[83-milly] [Milly]83-milly called [it]852-a " peninsula " milly called it , when she had been all round it , when [she]83-milly had been all round [it]852-a " peninsula " milly called it , when she had been all round it]852-a " peninsula " milly called it , when she had been all round it , and [it]852-a " peninsula " milly called it , when she had been all round it was covered with brown heather spread all over the ground , and was delightfully soft and springy to sit upon . In the middle of the bit of rock there were two or three trees standing up together , birch trees with silvery stems , and on every side but one there was shallow brown water , so clear that [they]198-the children could see every stone at the bottom . And when [they]198-the children looked away across [the lake]1829-the lake , there were the grand old mountains pushing [their]198-the children heads into the clouds on the other side , and far away near [the edge of [the lake]1829-the lake]854-the edge of the lake [they]198-the children saw a white dot which [they]198-the children knew was [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house . How the sun shone on everything ! How it made [the water of [the lake]1829-the lake]857-the water of the lake sparkle and glitter as if it were alive ! And yet the air was not hot , for a little wind was coming to [them]198-the children across [the water]1757-the water , and moving the trees gently up and down .

And what was this under the trees ? Why , a kind of fireplace made of stones , and in front of it a round green bit of grass , with tufts of heather all round it , just like a table with seats .

" Who put these stones here , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly , as [she]59-aunt emma and [mother]1502-mother and [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton brought up the baskets , and put them in the green place by the stones .

" Well , [Olly]63-olly , long ago , when all [[your]63-olly uncles]2026-your uncles and [aunts]729-aunts were little , and [they]2028-they used to come [here]1560-here for picnics , [they]2028-they thought it would be very nice to have a stone fireplace , built up properly , so that [they]2028-they need n't make one every time . It was [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard 's idea , and [we]2030-we had such fun building [it]1560-here up . [The little ones]2031-the little ones brought the stones ; and [the big ones]2032-the big ones piled them together till [you]63-olly see [we]2030-we made quite a nice fireplace . And it has lasted ever since . Whenever [I]89-mr. norton come [here]1560-here [I]89-mr. norton mend it up if any of the stones have tumbled down . [Numbers of [little children]532-little children]2034-numbers of little children come to picnic [here]1560-here every summer , and [they]2034-numbers of little children always use [[our]2030-we fireplace]2037-our fireplace . But now , come along into [the woods]593-the woods , [children]1510-children , and gather sticks . "[89-mr. norton]

Off [they]861-they ran after [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , and soon [they]861-they were scrambling about the wood which grew along [the shore]821-the shore , picking up the dry sticks and dry fern under the trees . [Milly]83-milly filled [her]83-milly cotton frock full , and gathered it up with both [her]83-milly hands ; while [Olly]63-olly of course went straight at the biggest branch [he]63-olly could see , and staggered along with it , puffing and panting .

" [You]63-olly grasshopper , [you]63-olly ! "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , catching hold of [him]63-olly , " do n't [you]63-olly think [you]63-olly 'd better try a whole tree next time ? There , let [me]89-mr. norton break it for [you]63-olly . "[89-mr. norton] [Father]85-father broke it up into short lengths , and then off ran [Olly]63-olly with [his]63-olly little skirts full to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , who was laden too with an armful of sticks . " That 'll do to begin with , [old man]1571-old man . Come along , and [you]63-olly and [I]59-aunt emma 'll light the fire . "[59-aunt emma]

What fun it was , heaping up the sticks on the stones , and how they did blaze and crackle away when [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma put a match to [them]863-them . Puff ! puff ! out came the smoke ; fizz -- crack -- sputter -- went the dry fir branches , as if they were Christmas fireworks .

" Have n't [we]2041-we made a blazey fire , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , out of breath with dragging up sticks , and standing still to look .

" Splendid , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who had just come out of the wood with [his]89-mr. norton bundle . " Now , [Olly]63-olly , let [me]89-mr. norton just put [you]63-olly on the top of it to finish it off . How [you]63-olly would fizz ! "[89-mr. norton]

[Off]118-off ran [Olly]63-olly , with [[his]63-olly father]262-his father after [him]63-olly , and [they]865-we had a romp among the heather till [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton caught [him]63-olly , and carried [him]63-olly kicking and laughing under [his]63-olly arm to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma .

" Now , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , shall [I]89-mr. norton put [him]63-olly on ? "[89-mr. norton]

" [Olly]63-olly , do come and help [mother]1502-mother and [me]83-milly with the tea - things , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , who was laying the cloth as busily and gravely as [a little housemaid]866-a little housemaid .

" Run along , [shrimp]1698-shrimp , "[262-his father] said [[his]63-olly father]262-his father , setting [him]63-olly down .

And off ran [Olly]63-olly , while [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma heaped the wood on the fire , and kept the kettle straight , so that it should n't tip over and spill .

Laying the cloth was delightful , [Milly]83-milly thought . First of all , [they]868-they put a heavy stone on each corner of the cloth to keep it down , and prevent the wind from blowing it up , and then [they]868-they put the little plates all round , and in the middle two piles of bread and butter and cake .

" But [we]865-we have n't got any flowers , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , looking at it presently , with a dissatisfied face , " [you]1502-mother always have flowers on the table at [home]382-home , [mother]1502-mother . "[83-milly]

" Why , [Milly]83-milly , have [you]83-milly forgotten [your]83-milly water - lilies ; where did [you]83-milly leave them ? "[62-mother]

" [Father]85-father told [me]83-milly just to put [their]198-the children stalks in the water , and [he]85-father put a stone to keep [them]198-the children safe . " [They]872-they look rather sad , [mother]1502-mother , do n't [they]872-they ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , gathering [them]872-they up . " Perhaps [they]872-they do n't like being taken away from [[their]872-they home]2050-their home . "[83-milly]

[Milly]83-milly shook [her]83-milly head . " It 'll rain , [mother]1502-mother . [That old gentleman]2055-that old gentleman said it would be sure to rain . "[83-milly]

" [That old gentleman]2055-that old gentleman is about right , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " [I]89-mr. norton think it rains dreadfully here , but [mother]1502-mother does n't seem to mind it a bit . "[89-mr. norton]

" Let [me]63-olly look , [mother]1502-mother , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , pulling [her]880-her down to [him]63-olly .

" [I]70-mrs. norton ca n't see any dust , [father]1498-father . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [I]83-milly do n't understand , [father]1498-father , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , opening [her]83-milly eyes very wide .

" Very likely , [Olly]63-olly . [People]1598-people always do at picnics . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , when are [you]63-olly going to tell [us]2074-us [your]63-olly story ? "[89-mr. norton]

" When [we]2074-us 've washed the things and put them away , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " then [Olly]63-olly shall sing [us]2074-us two songs , and [I]59-aunt emma 'll tell [you]63-olly [my]59-aunt emma story . "[59-aunt emma]

But [the children]198-the children were so hungry that it was a long time before [they]198-the children gave up eating bread and butter , and then , when at last tea was over , what fun it was washing the cups and plates in [the lake]1829-the lake ! " [I]83-milly did like that , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , sighing as the last basket was fastened down . " [I]83-milly wish [you]70-mrs. norton 'd let [me]83-milly help [Sarah]119-sally wash up the tea - things at [home]382-home , [mother]1502-mother . "[83-milly]

" If [Sarah]119-sally liked to let [you]63-olly , [I]70-mrs. norton should n't say no , [Milly]83-milly , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " How soon would [you]63-olly get tired of it , [old woman]2008-old woman , [I]70-mrs. norton wonder ? So [they]886-we put [Olly]63-olly up on a tall piece of rock , and [he]63-olly sang " [The Minstrel Boy]2078-the minstrel boy , "[63-olly] and " [Bonnie Dundee]120-bonnie dundee , "[63-olly] and " Hot Cross Buns , "[63-olly] just as if [he]63-olly were a little musical box , and [you]887-you had nothing to do but to wind [him]63-olly up . [He]63-olly had a sweet , clear , little voice , and [he]63-olly looked [a delightful brown gipsy]888-a delightful brown gipsy , as [he]63-olly sat perched up on the rock with [his]63-olly long legs dangling , and [his]63-olly curls blowing about [his]63-olly face .

" There ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , when [he]63-olly had shouted out the last note of " Hot Cross Buns . "[63-olly] " [I]63-olly have singed three whole songs ; and now , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , tell [us]890-their about [the king]2079-the king and the fairies . [Krick]121-krick , please . "[63-olly]

" It must be ' krick ' indeed , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " if [we]890-their want to get [home]382-home to - night . "[59-aunt emma]

For the sun had almost sunk behind [the mountains]1534-the mountains at [their]890-their back , and the wind blowing across [the lake]1829-the lake was beginning to get a little cold , while over [their]890-their heads [the rooks]892-the rooks went flying , singing " caw , caw , "[892-the rooks] on [their]890-their way to bed . And how the sun was turning [the water]1757-the water to gold ! It seemed to be making a great golden pathway across [the lake]1829-the lake , and [the mountains]1534-the mountains were turning a deep blue , and plash , plash , went the little waves on the rocks , so softly [they]890-their seemed to be saying " Good - night ! good - night ! "[890-their]

" Well , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , settling [herself]59-aunt emma on a soft piece of heather , and putting [her]59-aunt emma arms round [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly , " Once upon a time there was [a great king]2081-a great king . [He]2081-a great king was [a good king]2082-a good king and [a wise man]2083-a wise man , and [he]2081-a great king tried to make all [the people]2084-the people round about [him]2081-a great king wiser and better than [they]2084-the people were before [he]2081-a great king came to rule over [them]2084-the people ; and for a long time [he]2081-a great king was very powerful and happy , and [he]2081-a great king and [the brave men who helped [him]2081-a great king and were [[his]2081-a great king friends]2086-his friends]2085-the brave men who helped him and were his friends did a great deal of good , and kept [the savage people who lived all about [him]2081-a great king]2087-the savage people who lived all about him in order , and taught [them]2087-the savage people who lived all about him a great many things . But at last [some of [the savage people]2089-the savage people]2088-some of the savage people got tired of obeying [the king]2079-the king , and [they]2088-some of the savage people said [they]2088-some of the savage people would not have [him]2079-the king to reign over [them]2088-some of the savage people any more ; so [they]2088-some of the savage people made [an army]2091-an army , and [they]2088-some of the savage people came together against [the king]2079-the king to try and kill [him]2079-the king and [[his]2079-the king friends]2086-his friends . And [the king]2079-the king made [an army]2091-an army too , and there was a great battle ; and [the savage people]2089-the savage people were the strongest , and [they]2089-the savage people killed [nearly all [the king]2079-the king 's brave men]2097-nearly all the king 's brave men , and [the king]2079-the king [himself]2079-the king was terribly hurt in the fight . And at last , when night came on , there were left only [the king]2079-the king and [one of [[his]2079-the king friends]2086-his friends -- [[his]2079-the king knights]2103-his knights , as [they]2103-his knights were called]2101-one of his friends -- his knights , as they were called . [The king]2079-the king was hurt so much that [he]2079-the king could not move , and [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend thought [he]2079-the king was dying . [They]2106-they were left alone in [a rocky desert place]2107-a rocky desert place , and close by there was [a great lake with mountains round [it]2108-a great lake with mountains round it]2108-a great lake with mountains round it -- like this , [Olly]63-olly . It was very cold , and the moon was shining , and [the king]2079-the king lay so still that once or twice [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend almost thought that [he]2079-the king was dead . But at last , about the middle of the night , [he]2079-the king began to speak , and [he]2079-the king told [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend to take [his]2079-the king sword that was by [his]2079-the king side and to go down to the side of [the lake]1829-the lake and throw it as far as [he]2079-the king could into [the water]1757-the water . Now , this sword was a magic sword . Long before , [the king]2079-the king was once walking beside [this lake]1946-this lake , when [he]2079-the king suddenly saw an arm in a long white sleeve rising out of [the lake]1829-the lake , and in the hand at the end of it was a splendid sword with a glistening handle . And [the king]2079-the king got into [a boat]1969-a boat and rowed as fast as [he]2079-the king could till [he]2079-the king got near enough to take hold of the sword , and then the arm sank down under the water and was seen no more . And with the sword [the king]2079-the king won a great many battles , and [he]2079-the king loved it , and never would part with it ; but now that [he]2079-the king was dying , [he]2079-the king told [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend to take the sword and throw it back into [the lake]1829-the lake where [he]2079-the king had found it , and see what would happen . And [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend took it , and went away over the rocks till [he]2079-the king came to [the edge of [the lake]1829-the lake]854-the edge of the lake , and then [he]2079-the king took the sword out of its case and swung it above [his]2079-the king head that [he]2079-the king might throw it far into the water ; but as [he]2079-the king lifted it up the precious stones in the handle shone so splendidly in the moonlight that [he]2079-the king could not make up [his]2079-the king mind to throw it into the water , it seemed such a pity . So [he]2079-the king hid it away among the rushes by the water side , and went back to [the king]2079-the king . And [the king]2079-the king said , ' What did [you]2105-his friend see by [the lake]1829-the lake ? '[59-aunt emma]

" And [the knight]2128-the knight said , ' [I]59-aunt emma saw nothing except the water , and [the mountains]1534-the mountains , and the rushes . '[59-aunt emma]

" And [the king]2079-the king said , ' Oh , [unkind friend]2131-unkind friend ! Why will [you]2105-his friend not do as [I]59-aunt emma ask [you]2105-his friend , now that [I]59-aunt emma am dying and can do nothing for [myself]59-aunt emma ? Go back and throw the sword into [the lake]1829-the lake , as [I]59-aunt emma told [you]2105-his friend . '[59-aunt emma]

" And [the knight]2128-the knight went back , and once more [he]2128-the knight lifted the sword to throw it into [the water]1757-the water but it looked so beautiful that [he]2128-the knight _ could _ not throw it away . There would be nothing left , [he]2128-the knight thought , to remember [the king]2079-the king by when [he]2079-the king was dead if [he]2079-the king threw away the sword ; so again [he]2128-the knight hid it among the rushes , and then [he]2128-the knight went back to [the king]2079-the king . And again [the king]2079-the king asked , ' What did [you]2128-the knight see by [the lake]1829-the lake ? ' and again [the knight]2128-the knight answered , ' [I]59-aunt emma saw nothing except [the water]1757-the water and [the mountains]1534-the mountains . '[59-aunt emma]

" ' Oh , unkind , [false friend]2142-false friend ! ' cried [the king]2079-the king , ' [you]2128-the knight are crueller to [me]59-aunt emma than those who gave [me]59-aunt emma this wound . Go back and throw the sword into [the water]1757-the water , or , weak as [I]59-aunt emma am , [I]59-aunt emma will rise up and kill [you]2128-the knight . '[59-aunt emma]

" Back went [the knight]2128-the knight , and this time [he]2128-the knight seized the sword without looking at it , so that [he]2128-the knight should not see how beautiful it was , and then [he]2128-the knight swung it once , twice , thrice , round [his]2128-the knight head , and away it went into [the lake]1829-the lake . And as it fell , up rose a hand and arm in a long white sleeve out of the water , and the hand caught the sword and drew it down under the water . And then for a moment , all round [the lake]1829-the lake , [the knight]2128-the knight fancied [he]2128-the knight heard a sound of sobbing and weeping , and [he]2128-the knight thought in [his]2128-the knight heart that it must be the water - fairies weeping for [the king]2079-the king 's death .[59-aunt emma]

" ' What did [you]2128-the knight see by [the lake]1829-the lake ? ' asked [the king]2079-the king again , when [he]2079-the king came back , and [the knight]2128-the knight told [him]2079-the king . Then [the king]2079-the king told [him]2128-the knight to lift [him]2128-the knight up and carry [him]2128-the knight on [his]2128-the knight back down to [the edge of [the lake]1829-the lake]854-the edge of the lake , and when [they]198-the children got [there]1539-there , what do [you]2128-the knight think [they]198-the children saw ? "[59-aunt emma]

But [the children]198-the children could not guess , and [Milly]83-milly pressed [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's hand hard to make [her]59-aunt emma go on .

" [They]198-the children saw [a great black ship]2157-a great black ship coming slowly over [the water]1757-the water , and on [the ship]2159-the ship were numbers of [people in black , sobbing and crying , so that the air was full of a sound of weeping]2160-people in black , sobbing and crying , so that the air was full of a sound of weeping , and in front sat [three queens in long black dresses , and with gold crowns on [their]2161-three queens in long black dresses , and with gold crowns on their heads heads]2161-three queens in long black dresses , and with gold crowns on their heads , and [they]2161-three queens in long black dresses , and with gold crowns on their heads , too , were weeping and wringing [their]2161-three queens in long black dresses , and with gold crowns on their heads hands .[59-aunt emma]

" ' Lift [me]59-aunt emma up , ' said [the king]2079-the king , when [the ship]2159-the ship came close beside [them]198-the children , ' and put [me]59-aunt emma into [the ship]2159-the ship . ' And [the knight]2128-the knight lifted [him]2079-the king up , while [the three queens]2166-the three queens stretched out [their]2166-the three queens hands and drew [him]2079-the king into [the ship]2159-the ship .[59-aunt emma]

" ' Oh , [king]2168-king ! take [me]59-aunt emma with [you]2168-king , ' said [the knight]2128-the knight , ' take [me]59-aunt emma too . What shall [I]59-aunt emma do all alone without [you]2168-king ? ' But [the ship]2159-the ship began to move away , and [the knight]2128-the knight was left standing on [the shore]821-the shore . Only [he]2128-the knight fancied [he]2128-the knight heard [the king]2079-the king 's voice saying , ' Wait for [me]59-aunt emma , [I]59-aunt emma shall come again . Farewell ! '[59-aunt emma]

" And [the ship]2159-the ship went faster and faster away into the darkness , for it was [a fairy ship]2175-a fairy ship , till at last [the knight]2128-the knight could see it no more . So then [he]2128-the knight knew that [the king]2079-the king had been carried away by [the fairies of [the lake]1829-the lake]2178-the fairies of the lake -- [the same fairies who had given [him]2079-the king the sword in old days , and who had loved [him]2079-the king and watched over [him]2079-the king all [his]2079-the king life]2180-the same fairies who had given him the sword in old days , and who had loved him and watched over him all his life . But what did [the king]2079-the king mean by saying , ' [I]59-aunt emma shall come again ' ? "[59-aunt emma]

Then [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma stopped and looked at [the children]198-the children .

" What did [he]2079-the king mean , [auntie]2182-auntie ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , who had been listening with all [her]83-milly ears , and whose little eyes were wet , " and did [he]2079-the king ever come back again ? "[83-milly]

" Not while [the knight]2128-the knight lived , [Milly]83-milly . [He]2128-the knight grew to be quite [an old man]2184-an old man , and was always hoping that [the fairies]1915-the fairies would bring [the king]2079-the king again . But [the king]2079-the king never came , and [[his]2079-the king friend]2105-his friend died without seeing [him]2079-the king . "[83-milly]

" But did [he]2079-the king _ ever _ come again ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" [I]83-milly do n't know , [Olly]63-olly . [Some people]1916-some people think that [he]2079-the king is still hidden away somewhere by the kind water - fairies , and that some day , when [the world]260-the world wants [him]2079-the king very much , [he]2079-the king will come back again . "[83-milly]

" Do [you]59-aunt emma think [he]2079-the king is here in [this lake]1946-this lake ? "[83-milly] whispered [Milly]83-milly , looking at [the water]1757-the water .

" How can [we]2192-we tell what 's at [the bottom of [the lake]1829-the lake]2193-the bottom of the lake ? "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , smiling . " But no , [I]59-aunt emma do n't think [the king]2079-the king is hidden in [this lake]1946-this lake . [He]2079-the king did n't live near here . "[59-aunt emma]

" What was [his]2079-the king name ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly .

" [His]2079-the king name was [King Arthur]122-king arthur . But now , [children]1510-children , hurry ; there is [father]1498-father putting all the baskets into [the boat]1929-the boat . [We]899-they must get [home]382-home as quick as [we]899-they can . "[899-they]

[They]899-they rowed [home]382-home very quickly , except just for a little time when [Milly]83-milly rowed , and [they]899-they did not go quite so fast as if [father]1498-father were rowing alone . It was quite evening now on [the lake]1829-the lake , and there were great shadows from [the mountains]1534-the mountains lying across [the water]1757-the water . Somehow [the children]198-the children felt much quieter now than when [they]198-the children started in the afternoon . [Milly]83-milly had curled [herself]83-milly up inside [mother]1502-mother 's arm , and was thinking a great deal about [King Arthur]122-king arthur and [the fairy ship]907-the fairy ship , while [Olly]63-olly was quite taken up with watching the oars as [they]899-they dipped in and out of the water , and occasionally asking [[his]63-olly father]262-his father when [he]262-his father should be big enough to row quite by [himself]262-his father . It seemed a very little time after all before [they]899-they were stepping out of [the boat]1929-the boat at [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's boathouse]910-aunt emma 's boathouse , and the picnic and the row were both over .

" Good - bye , dear lake , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , turning with [her]83-milly hands full of water - lilies to look back before [they]899-they went up to [the house]265-the house . " Good - night , [mountains]1646-mountains ; good - night , [Birdsnest Point]28-birdsnest point . [I]83-milly shall soon come and see [you]1646-mountains again . "[83-milly]

A few minutes more , and [they]899-they were safely packed into [a carriage]1601-a carriage which drove [them]899-they back to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was saying good - bye to [them]899-they .

" Next time , [I]59-aunt emma shall come and see [you]83-milly , [Milly]83-milly , "[59-aunt emma] [she]59-aunt emma said , as [she]59-aunt emma kissed [Milly]83-milly 's little sleepy face . " Do n't forget [me]59-aunt emma till then . "[59-aunt emma]

" Then [you]913-she 'll tell [us]899-they about old [Mother Quiverquake]62-mother , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , hugging [her]913-she with [his]63-olly small arms . " [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , [I]63-olly have n't given [Johnny]78-johnny back [his]78-johnny stockings . [They]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest did tickle [me]63-olly so in [the boat]1929-the boat . "[63-olly]

" [We]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest 'll get [them]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest some time , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " Good - night , good - night . "[59-aunt emma]

It was [a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of [the carriage]390-the carriage at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest . And though [they]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest tried to tell [her]913-she something about it , [she]913-she had to wait till next morning before [she]913-she could really understand anything about [their]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest wonderful day at [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's house]1833-aunt emma 's house .

CHAPTER VI

WET DAYS AT [RAVENSNEST]19-ravensnest

For about a week after the row on [the lake]1829-the lake the weather was lovely , and [Milly]83-milly wondered more than ever what [the old gentleman who warned [them]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest of the rain in [the mountains]1534-the mountains could have been thinking about]918-the old gentleman who warned them of the rain in the mountains could have been thinking about . [She]913-she and [Olly]63-olly were out all day , and nearly every afternoon [nurse]1496-nurse lifted the tea - table through the low nursery window on to [the lawn]270-the lawn , and let [them]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest have [their]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest tea out of doors among the flowers and trees and twittering birds . [They]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest had found out a [fly - catcher]922-fly - catcher 's nest in the ivy above the front door , and every evening [the two children]180-the two children used to fetch out [[their]180-the two children father]212-their father to watch the parent birds catching flies and carrying [them]925-them to the hungry little ones , whom [they]914-a sleepy pair of children that nurse lifted out of the carriage at ravensnest could just hear chirping up above the ivy . [Olly]63-olly was wild to get [the gardener]1554-the gardener 's ladder that [he]63-olly might climb up and look into the nest , but [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton would not have it lest it should frighten away the old birds .

One delicious warm morning , too , [the children]198-the children had [their]198-the children long - promised bathe , and what fun it was . [Nurse]75-nurse woke [them]198-the children up at five o'clock in the morning -- fancy waking up as early as that!--and [they]198-the children slipped on [their]198-the children little blue bathing gowns , and [their]198-the children sand shoes that [mother]1502-mother had bought [them]198-the children in [Cromer]69-cromer the year before , and then [nurse]1496-nurse wrapped [them]198-the children up in shawls , and [she]1496-nurse and [they]198-the children and [father]1498-father went down and opened the front door while [everybody else]931-everybody else in [the house]265-the house was asleep , and slipped out . What a quiet strange world it seemed , the grass and the flowers dripping with dew , and overhead such a blue sky with white clouds sailing slowly about in it .

" Why do n't [we]198-the children always get up at five o'clock , [father]1498-father ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly , as [he]63-olly and [Milly]83-milly skipped along -- such [an odd little pair of figures]933-an odd little pair of figures -- beside [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Is n't it nice and funny ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Very , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Still , [I]89-mr. norton imagine [Olly]63-olly , if [you]63-olly had to get up every day at five o'clock , [you]63-olly might think it funny , but [I]89-mr. norton 'm sure [you]63-olly would n't always think it nice . "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh ! [I]83-milly 'm sure [we]198-the children should , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , seriously . " Why , [father]1498-father , it 's just as if everything was [ours]198-the children and [nobody else]222-nobody else 's , [the garden]219-the garden and [the river]1681-the river [I]83-milly mean . Is there _ [anybody]1612-anybody _ up yet do [you]63-olly think -- in [those houses]2209-those houses ? "[83-milly] And [Milly]83-milly pointed to [the few houses [they]935-they could see from [the Ravensnest garden]696-the ravensnest garden]934-the few houses they could see from the ravensnest garden .

" [I]83-milly ca n't tell , [Milly]83-milly . But [I]83-milly 'll tell [you]63-olly who 's sure to be up now , and that 's [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse . [I]83-milly should think [he]66-john backhouse 's just beginning to milk the cows . "[83-milly]

" Oh then , [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza'll]123-tiza'll be up too , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , dancing about . " [I]83-milly wish [we]935-they could see [them]938-them . Somehow it would be quite different seeing [them]938-them now , [father]1498-father . [I]83-milly feel so queer , as if [I]83-milly was [somebody else]341-somebody else . "[83-milly]

If [you]937-you have ever been up _ very _ early on a summer morning , [you]937-you will know what [Milly]83-milly meant , but if not [I]0-i can hardly explain it . Such a pretty quiet little walk [they]938-them had down to [the river]1681-the river . [Nobody]280-nobody on [the road]428-the road , nobody in [the fields]319-the fields , but the birds chattering and the sun shining , as if [they]938-them were having a good time all to [themselves]938-them , before [anybody]1612-anybody woke up to interrupt [them]938-them . [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton took [the children]198-the children down to the stepping - stones , and then , while [Milly]83-milly and [nurse]1496-nurse stayed on [the bank]946-the bank [he]89-mr. norton lifted [Olly]63-olly up , and carried [him]63-olly to the middle of the stepping - stones , where the water would about come up to [his]63-olly chest . [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton had already taken off [his]89-mr. norton own shoes and stockings , and when [they]938-them came to the middle stone , [he]89-mr. norton put [Olly]63-olly down on the stone , and stepped into [the water]1757-the water [himself]89-mr. norton . " Now , [Olly]63-olly , give [me]89-mr. norton [your]63-olly hands and jump in . Mind , it 'll feel very cold . "[89-mr. norton]

[Olly]63-olly shut [his]63-olly eyes , and opened [his]63-olly mouth , as [he]63-olly always did when [he]63-olly felt just a little frightened , and then in [he]63-olly went ; splash ! ugh ! it was so cold -- much colder than [the sea]1513-the sea used to feel -- but after a few splashes [Olly]63-olly began to get used to it , and to think it fine fun .

" Oh , [father]1498-father , fetch [Milly]83-milly , and then [we]2213-we 'll all dance about , "[63-olly] entreated [Olly]63-olly .

" Come , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] called [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Try whether [you]83-milly can manage the stepping - stones by [yourself]83-milly . "[89-mr. norton] So [Milly]83-milly came , holding up [her]83-milly bathing dress , and stepping from one big stone to another with a very grave face , as if [she]83-milly felt that there would be an end of [her]83-milly altogether if [she]83-milly tumbled in . And then , splash ! In [she]83-milly jumped by the side of [Olly]63-olly , and after a little shiver or two [she]83-milly also began to think that [the river]1681-the river was [a delightful bathing place]950-a delightful bathing place , almost as nice as [the sea]1513-the sea , perhaps in some ways nicer , because it was such a strange and funny one . [They]952-they danced and splashed about in the brown sparkling water till [they]952-they were tired , and at last [Olly]63-olly stopped to take breath .

" [I]63-olly should think the fishes must be frightened of [us]952-they , "[63-olly] [he]63-olly said , peering down into [the river]1681-the river . " [I]63-olly ca n't see any , [father]1498-father . "[63-olly]

" Well , [they]2215-they would n't choose to swim about just where [little children]532-little children are shouting and capering . The fishes are hidden safe away under the banks and the big stones . Besides , it 's going to be a very hot day , and [they]2215-they like [the shady bits of [the river]1681-the river]2217-the shady bits of the river . Just here there 's no shade . "[63-olly]

Suddenly there was a great commotion in [the river]1681-the river , and when [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton looked round for a second [he]89-mr. norton could see nothing of [Milly]83-milly , till up came a dripping head and a pair of hands , and there was [Milly]83-milly kneeling on the stones at [the bottom of [the river]1681-the river]955-the bottom of the river , with just [her]83-milly head above water , looking very much astonished and rather frightened .

" Why , what happened , [old woman]2008-old woman ? "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , holding out [his]89-mr. norton hand to help [her]83-milly up .

" [I]89-mr. norton -- [I]89-mr. norton -- don't quite know , [father]1498-father ; [I]89-mr. norton was standing on a big stone , and all of a sudden it tipped up , and [I]89-mr. norton tumbled right in . "[89-mr. norton]

" First of all [I]63-olly thought [you]83-milly was a big fish , and then [I]63-olly thought [you]83-milly was going to be drowned , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , cheerfully . " [I]63-olly 'm glad [you]83-milly was n't drowned . "[63-olly]
