" [Miss Milly]83-milly ! [Miss Milly]83-milly ! "[1496-nurse] shouted [nurse]1496-nurse from [the bank]946-the bank , " it 's quite time [you]83-milly came out now . If [you]83-milly stay in so long [you]83-milly 'll get cold , and [you]83-milly , too , [Master Olly]63-olly . "[1496-nurse]

[Olly]63-olly was not inclined to come . [He]63-olly would have liked to go on dabbling and splashing till breakfast - time , but [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton hurried [him]63-olly out , and [the two dripping little creatures]959-the two dripping little creatures were well wrapped up in large shawls which [nurse]1496-nurse had brought with [her]1496-nurse . Then [nurse]1496-nurse took up [Olly]63-olly in [her]1496-nurse arms , and [father]1498-father took up [Milly]83-milly , who was small and light for [her]83-milly age , and [they]963-they set off up the bit of [road]964-road to [the house]265-the house . By this time it was past six o'clock , and whom should [they]963-they meet at the Ravensnest gate but [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse , with [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza , and [his]1498-father two dogs . [He]1498-father was just bringing the milk , and both [he]1498-father and [[his]1498-father children]966-his children looked as brisk and wide awake as if [they]963-they had been up and about for hours .

[Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly were very much excited at the sight of [them]963-they , and [Olly]63-olly struggled hard to get down , but [nurse]1496-nurse held [him]63-olly tight .

" Oh , [Becky]102-becky ! [we]963-they 've had such a nice bathe , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , as [she]83-milly passed [them]963-they muffled up in [her]83-milly shawl , [her]83-milly little wet feet dangling out .

[Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza looked longingly after [them]963-they as [they]963-they disappeared into [the house]265-the house . [They]963-they wished [they]963-they could have had a bathe too , but [they]963-they knew very well that [[their]963-they hard - worked father]969-their hard - worked father and [mother]1502-mother had something else to do on a fine summer 's morning than to take [them]963-they to bathe , and in a few minutes [they]963-they had forgotten all about it , and were busy playing with the dogs , or chattering to [[their]963-they father]212-their father about the hay - making , which was soon to begin now .

That evening there were strange clouds at sunset time , and [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton shook [his]89-mr. norton head as [he]89-mr. norton heard [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton arrange to take [the children]198-the children next day to [a small mountain village near [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]973-a small mountain village near ravensnest , to call on [some old friends of [hers]70-mrs. norton]974-some old friends of hers .

" [I]89-mr. norton would n't make much of a plan for to - morrow if [I]89-mr. norton were [you]559-his wife , "[89-mr. norton] [he]89-mr. norton said to [[his]89-mr. norton wife]559-his wife , " the weather does n't look promising . "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh , [father]1498-father ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , protesting . " There are some red clouds over there -- look ! and [Nana]79-nana always says it 's going to be fine when there are red clouds . "[83-milly]

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [your]83-milly red clouds may be right and [I]89-mr. norton may be wrong . [We]977-we shall see . "[89-mr. norton]

But , alas ! [father]1498-father was quite right . When [Milly]83-milly woke up next morning there was no nice sunshine creeping on to [her]83-milly bed as it had done almost ever since [they]977-we came to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest ; but instead there was rain beating steadily against the window , coming down out of a heavy gray sky , and looking as if it meant to go on for ever .

" Oh dear ! "[83-milly] sighed [Milly]83-milly , as [she]83-milly began to dress , " [we]977-we ca n't go out , and the wild strawberries will get so wet . [I]83-milly meant to have gathered some for [mother]1502-mother to - day . There would have been such nice ones in the wood . "[83-milly]

But it was no use thinking about woods or strawberries , and when [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton came into [[the children]198-the children 's room]979-the children 's room just as [they]977-we were finishing breakfast , [she]70-mrs. norton found [a pair of dull little faces]980-a pair of dull little faces staring out at the rain , as if looking at it would make it stop .

" Nasty rain , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , climbing up on [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother 's knee . " Go to [Spain]32-spain . [I]63-olly do n't want [you]185-his mother to come and spoil [my]63-olly nicey time . "[63-olly]

" [I]63-olly am afraid scolding the rain wo n't make it go away , "[63-olly] said [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother , smiling into [his]63-olly brown face as [he]63-olly knelt on [her]185-his mother lap , with [his]63-olly arms round [her]185-his mother neck . " Now what are [we]2223-we going to do to - day ? "[63-olly]

" [I]83-milly do n't know , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , sitting down opposite [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother , and resting [her]83-milly face gravely on [her]83-milly hands . " Well , [we]2223-we brought _ some _ toys , [you]187-her mother know , [mother]1502-mother . [Olly]63-olly 's got [his]63-olly top ; [I]83-milly can help [him]63-olly spin it , and [I]83-milly can play with [Katie]82-katie a bit . "[83-milly]

" That wo n't take very long , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " Suppose [we]2223-we do some lessons first of all . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother , lessons ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , in a very doubtful voice .

" It 's holidays , [mother]1502-mother , it 's holidays , "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly . " [I]63-olly do n't like lessons -- not a bit . "[63-olly]

" Well , but , [Olly]63-olly , think a bit ; [you]63-olly ca n't spin [your]63-olly top and look at picture - books all day , and [I]83-milly 'm afraid it 's going to rain all day -- it looks very like it . If [you]63-olly come and do some reading and counting with [me]83-milly this morning , [I]83-milly can give [you]63-olly some spills to make , or some letters to tear up for [me]83-milly afterwards . That will save the toys for this afternoon ; and some time this afternoon , if it does n't stop raining , [we]2223-we 'll all have a romp . And as for [you]63-olly , [Milly]83-milly , do n't [you]63-olly think it 's quite time [Katie]82-katie had a new frock ? [I]83-milly believe [I]83-milly can find a beautiful bit of blue silk in [my]83-milly bag , and [I]83-milly 'm sure [nurse]1496-nurse will show [you]63-olly how to make it . "[83-milly]

[Milly]83-milly 's face brightened up very much at this , and [the two children]180-the two children went skipping [upstairs]435-upstairs to [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room after [[their]180-the two children mother]189-their mother , in very fair spirits again . [Olly]63-olly did some reading , while [Milly]83-milly wrote in [her]83-milly copybook , and then [Olly]63-olly had [his]63-olly counting - slate and tried to find out what 6 and 4 made , and 5 and 3 , and other little sums of the same kind . [He]63-olly yawned a good deal over [his]63-olly reading , and was quite sure several times that h - a - y spelt " ham , "[1502-mother] and s - a - w spelt " was , "[1502-mother] but still , on the whole , [he]63-olly got through very well . [Milly]83-milly wrote [her]83-milly copy , then [she]83-milly learnt some verses of a poem called " [Lucy Gray]107-lucy , "[83-milly] and last of all [mother]1502-mother found [her]83-milly a big map of [Westmoreland]25-westmoreland , [the county in which the mountains]989-the county in which the mountains are , and [they]990-they had a most delightful geography lesson . [Mother]62-mother pretended to take [Milly]83-milly a drive all about [the mountains]1534-the mountains , and made [her]83-milly find out [their]1534-the mountains names , and the names of [the towns]992-the towns and [the lakes]993-the lakes , beginning with [Lake Windermere]33-lake windermere . [Olly]63-olly was interested too , for [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton told [them]990-they a great many things about [the places]994-the places , and made quite a story out of it .

[ Illustration : " [He]63-olly was quite sure that h - a - y spelt ' ham ' and s - a - w spelt ' was . ' "[70-mrs. norton] ]

" Why , [mother]1502-mother , [I]83-milly never could go all that long way all at once--_really _ , could [I]83-milly ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , when [they]990-they had been all round [the mountains]1534-the mountains , in and out and round about .

" No , [Milly]83-milly , not quite , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , laughing , " but it 's very easy to go a long way in [a pretendy drive]2229-a pretendy drive . It would only take [us]990-they about ten minutes that way to get to [the other side of the world]2230-the other side of the world . "[70-mrs. norton]

" How long would it take really ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" About three months . "[70-mrs. norton]

" If [we]990-they could fly up , and up , ever so far , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , standing on tiptoe , and stretching out [his]63-olly little arms as high as [they]990-they would reach , " it would n't take [us]990-they long . [Mother]62-mother , do n't [you]62-mother wish [you]62-mother was a bird ? "[63-olly]

" No , [I]70-mrs. norton do n't think so , [Olly]63-olly ; why do [you]63-olly ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" Because [I]63-olly should like to go so _ krick _ . [Mother]62-mother , [the fly - catchers]2231-the fly - catchers do fly so krick ; [I]63-olly ca n't see [them]2231-the fly - catchers sometimes when [they]2231-the fly - catchers 're flying , [they]2231-the fly - catchers go so fast . Oh , [I]63-olly do wish [father]1498-father would let [me]63-olly get up a ladder to look at [them]2231-the fly - catchers . "[63-olly]

" No [Olly]63-olly , [you]63-olly 'll frighten [them]2231-the fly - catchers , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , putting on [her]83-milly wise face . " Besides , [father]1498-father says [you]63-olly 're too little , and [you]63-olly 'd tumble down . "[83-milly]

[Olly]63-olly looked as if [he]63-olly did n't believe a word of it , as [he]63-olly generally did when [Milly]83-milly talked wisely to [him]63-olly ; but just then [he]63-olly found that [mother]1502-mother had put into [his]63-olly lap a whole basketful of letters to tear up , and that interested [him]63-olly so much that [he]63-olly forgot [the fly - catchers]2231-the fly - catchers . [Nurse]75-nurse cut out a most fashionable blue dress for [Katie]82-katie , and [Milly]83-milly was quite happy all the rest of the morning in running up the seams and hemming the bottom . So the morning passed away . After dinner there were the toys to play with , and [Katie]82-katie 's frock to try on , for [nurse]1496-nurse had taken a turn at the body while [Milly]83-milly had been making the skirt . It fitted very well , and [Milly]83-milly had only the band to put on and the sleeves to make before it would be quite finished . Then [nurse]1496-nurse promised to put a little white lace round the neck , and cut out a blue sash , that [Katie]82-katie might be quite turned into [an elegant young lady]1000-an elegant young lady . Tea came very soon , and when it was cleared away [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother came into [the big kitchen]1003-the big kitchen without a fireplace , next to [[the children]198-the children 's room]979-the children 's room , and [they]198-the children all had a splendid romp . [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton made [himself]89-mr. norton into a tiger , with a tiger - skin in [the hall]788-the hall , that [Uncle Richard]64-uncle richard had brought [home]382-home from [India]34-india , and [Olly]63-olly shot [him]89-mr. norton all over with a walking - stick from the tip of [his]89-mr. norton nose to the tip of [his]89-mr. norton tail . When [they]198-the children were tired of this , [mother]1502-mother set [them]198-the children to play hide - and - seek , and [Milly]83-milly hid [herself]83-milly in such out - of - the - way cupboards , and squeezed [herself]83-milly into such small corners , that [mother]1502-mother said [she]83-milly was like a needle in a bundle of hay -- there was no finding [her]83-milly .

Seven o'clock came before [they]198-the children had time to think about it , and [the children]198-the children went chattering and skipping up to bed , though on fine evenings [they]198-the children had been staying up much later . How the rain did rattle on the window while [they]198-the children were undressing .

" Oh , [you]2234-you tiresome rain , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , standing by the window in [her]83-milly nightdress , and gazing up into the sky . " Where does it all come from , [I]83-milly wonder ? Wo n't it be wet to - morrow , [Nana]79-nana ? and oh , what is that roaring over there ? "[83-milly]

" That 's the beck , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , who was brushing [Olly]63-olly 's hair , and trying hard to make [him]63-olly stand still for two minutes .

" The beck ! why , what 's the matter with it ? "[1496-nurse]

" It 's the rain has made it so full [I]1496-nurse suppose , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse . " To - morrow , [gardener]1705-gardener says , it 'll be over [the lawn]270-the lawn if the rain goes on . "[1496-nurse]

" Oh , but it must n't go on , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " Now , rain , dear rain , good rain , do go away to - night , right away up into [the mountains]1534-the mountains . There 's plenty of room for [you]2234-you up there , and down here [we]1014-we do n't want [you]2234-you a bit . So do be polite and go away . "[83-milly]

But the rain did n't see any good reason for going away , in spite of [Milly]83-milly 's pretty speeches , and next morning there was the same patter on the window , the same gray sky and dripping garden . After breakfast there was just a hope of its clearing up . For about an hour the rain seemed to get less and the clouds a little brighter . But it soon came on again as fast as ever , and [the poor children]1013-the poor children were very much disappointed .

" [Mother]1502-mother , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , when [they]1014-we had settled down to [their]1014-we lessons again in [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room , " when [we]1014-we get back to [Willingham]5-willingham , do [you]1502-mother know what [I]83-milly shall do ? "[83-milly]

" No , [Milly]83-milly . "[83-milly]

" [I]83-milly shall ask [you]83-milly to take [me]83-milly to see [that old gentleman]2055-that old gentleman -- [you]83-milly know who [I]83-milly mean -- who told [you]83-milly about the rain . And [I]83-milly shall say to [him]2055-that old gentleman , ' please , [Mr. Old Gentleman]124-mr. old gentleman , at first [I]83-milly thought [you]2055-that old gentleman were quite wrong about the rain , but afterwards [I]83-milly thought [you]2055-that old gentleman were quite right , and it does rain dreadfully much in [the mountains]1534-the mountains . ' "[83-milly]

" Very well , [Milly]83-milly . But [you]83-milly have only just had a taste of what the rain can do in [the lakes]993-the lakes [you]83-milly know , so far . [Father]85-father and [I]83-milly have been [here]1560-here sometimes when it has rained two or three weeks without stopping . "[83-milly]

" Oh dear ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , looking extremely melancholy . " [I]83-milly like [the mountains]1534-the mountains very much , [mother]1502-mother ; but _ do _ [you]1502-mother think [we]2245-we 'd better come to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest again after this year ? "[83-milly]

" Oh [[you]83-milly ungrateful little woman]2246-you ungrateful little woman ! "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , whose love for [the place]1016-the place was so real that [Milly]83-milly 's speech gave [her]70-mrs. norton quite a pang . " Have [you]83-milly forgotten all [your]83-milly happy sunshiny days here , just because it has rained for two ? Why , when [I]70-mrs. norton was [a little girl]1658-a little girl , and used to come [here]1560-here , the rainy days never made [me]70-mrs. norton love [the place]1016-the place a bit the less . [I]70-mrs. norton always used to think the fine days made up . "[70-mrs. norton]

" But then , [mother]1502-mother , [you]83-milly were [a nice little girl]2251-a nice little girl , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , throwing [her]83-milly arms round [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother 's neck and kissing [her]187-her mother . " Now , [I]83-milly do n't feel a bit nice this morning . It makes [me]83-milly so cross not to be able to go out and get flowers and wild strawberries . And [you]1502-mother know at [home]382-home it hardly ever rains all day . "[83-milly]

" [Gardener]1705-gardener says sometimes it rains all over [the road]428-the road , "[63-olly] interrupted [Olly]63-olly , " and [people]1598-people ca n't walk along , and [they]1598-people have to go right up on [the mountains]1534-the mountains to get past [the water place]2257-the water place . And sometimes [they]1598-people have to get [a boat]1969-a boat to take [people]1598-people across . Do [you]1502-mother think [we]2260-we shall have to go in [a boat]1969-a boat to [church]2262-church on Sunday , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly]

" Well , [we]2260-we 're a long way off that yet , [Olly]63-olly . It will take a good many days ' rain to flood [the roads]2264-the roads so deep that [we]2260-we ca n't get along them , and this is only the second rainy day . Come , [I]83-milly do n't think [we]2260-we 've got much to complain of . Now suppose , instead of doing all [your]1502-mother lessons this morning , [you]1502-mother were presently to write to [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis -- [you]1502-mother write to [Jacky]66-john backhouse , [Milly]83-milly , and [Olly]63-olly to [Francis]67-francis . Do n't [you]1502-mother think that would be a good thing ? "[83-milly]

" Oh yes , yes ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , shutting up [her]83-milly copybook in a great hurry . " [They]198-the children 'll be so much astonished , [mother]1502-mother , for [we]198-the children did n't _ promise _ to write to [them]198-the children . [I]83-milly do n't believe [they]198-the children ever get any letters . "[83-milly]

[The children]198-the children had a great deal of affection and some secret pity for [these playfellows of [theirs]198-the children , who had [a sick mother]1020-a sick mother , and who did not get half the pleasures and amusements that [they]198-the children did]1019-these playfellows of theirs , who had a sick mother , and who did not get half the pleasures and amusements that they did . And , as [I]0-i have already told [you]1021-you , [they]198-the children could not bear [Miss Chesterton]125-miss chesterton , [[the little boys]1672-the little boys ' aunt]1023-the little boys ' aunt , who lived with [them]198-the children . [They]198-the children felt sure that [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis must be unhappy , only because [they]198-the children had to live with [Miss Chesterton]125-miss chesterton .

This was [Milly]83-milly 's letter when it was done . [Milly]83-milly could only write very slowly , in rather big hand , so that [her]83-milly letters were never very long :

[MY]0-i DEAR [JACKY]66-john backhouse -- Don't [you]1021-you think it very odd getting a letter from [me]0-i ? It is nearly a fortnight since [we]1024-we came [here]1560-here . At first it was _ very _ nice . [We]1024-we went up [the mountains]1534-the mountains , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma took [us]1024-we in [a boat]1969-a boat on [the lake]1829-the lake . And [we]1024-we gathered some wild strawberries , only some of them were quite white -- not red a bit . But now it has begun to rain , and [we]1024-we do n't like it at all . Perhaps [we]1024-we sha'n't be able to get [home]382-home because the rain will cover up the roads . It is _ very _ dull staying in , only [mother]1502-mother makes [us]1024-we such nice plays . Good - bye , [Jacky]66-john backhouse . [I]0-i send [my]0-i love to [Francis]67-francis . Mind [you]67-francis do n't forget [us]1024-we .

[[Your]67-francis loving little friend]1031-your loving little friend , [MILLY]83-milly .

[Olly]63-olly wrote a much longer letter , that is to say , [mother]1502-mother wrote for [him]1031-your loving little friend , and [he]1031-your loving little friend told [her]1502-mother what to say , and as this was a much easier way of writing than [Milly]83-milly 's way , [he]1031-your loving little friend got on very fast , and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton had to write as quickly as [she]70-mrs. norton could , to keep up with [him]1031-your loving little friend . And this was what [Olly]63-olly had to say :

[[MY]0-i DEAR [FRANCIS]67-francis]1033-my dear francis -- [I]0-i wonder what [you]67-francis 'll say to - morrow morning when [the postman]1034-the postman brings [you]67-francis this letter . [I]0-i hope [you]67-francis 'll write back , because it wo n't be fair if [you]67-francis do n't . It is n't such fun here now because it does rain so . [Milly]83-milly and [I]0-i are always telling the rain to go away , but it won't -- though it did at [home]382-home . Last week [we]1036-we went out in [a boat]1969-a boat , and [I]0-i rowed . [I]0-i rowed a great way , much farther than [Milly]83-milly . [We]1036-we went very slow when [Milly]83-milly rowed . It was very jolly at the picnic . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma gave [me]0-i some cake , and [mother]1502-mother gave [me]0-i some bread and jam . [Nana]79-nana wo n't let [us]1036-we have cake and jam both , when [we]1036-we have tea at [home]382-home . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma told [us]1036-we a story about [King Arthur]122-king arthur . [I]0-i do n't believe [you]1040-you ever heard it . [The water - fairies]1949-the water - fairies took [him]122-king arthur away , and [[his]122-king arthur friend]2105-his friend wanted to go too , but [the king]2079-the king said ' No ! [you]0-i must stop behind . ' [Milly]83-milly cried because [she]83-milly felt sad about [the king]2079-the king . [I]0-i did n't cry , because [I]0-i 'm [a little boy]1768-a little boy . [Mother]62-mother says [you]1040-you wo n't understand about the story , and [she]62-mother says [we]1036-we must tell it [you]1040-you when [we]1036-we get [home]382-home . So [we]1036-we will , only perhaps [we]1036-we sha'n't remember . Do [you]1040-you do lessons now ? [We]1036-we do n't do any -- only when it rains . [Milly]83-milly 's writing a letter to [Jacky]66-john backhouse -- mine 's much longer than [hers]62-mother .

[[Your]1040-you little friend]1047-your little friend , [OLLY]63-olly .

Then came the putting up the letters , addressing [them]1047-your little friend , and stamping them , all of which [the children]198-the children enjoyed very much , and by the time [they]198-the children were laid on the hall table ready to go to the post it was nearly dinner - time .

How the beck did roar that afternoon . And when [the children]198-the children looked out from the drawing - room window [they]198-the children could see a little flood on [the lawn]270-the lawn , where the water had come over the side of [the stream]1051-the stream . While [they]198-the children were having [their]198-the children tea , with [mother]1502-mother sitting by , working and chattering to [them]198-the children , [they]198-the children heard a knock at the door , and when [they]198-the children opened it there was [father]1498-father standing in [the unused kitchen]1054-the unused kitchen , with the water running off [his]1498-father waterproof coat , making little streams all over the stone floor .

" [I]1498-father have been down to look at [the river]1681-the river , "[1498-father] [he]1498-father said to [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " Keep off , [children]1510-children ! [I]1498-father 'm much too wet to touch . Such rain ! It does know how to come down here ! The water 's over [the road]428-the road just by the stepping - stones . [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse says if it goes on another twenty - four hours like this , there 'll be no getting to [Wanwick]23-wanwick by [the road]428-the road , on foot . "[1498-father]

" [Father]85-father , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , looking at [him]1498-father with a very solemn face , " would n't it be dreadful if it went on raining and raining , and if [the river]1681-the river came up and up , right up to [the drive]697-the drive and into [the hall]788-the hall , and [we]2273-us all had to sit [upstairs]435-upstairs , and [the butcher]2275-the butcher could n't bring [us]2273-us any meat , and [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse could n't bring [us]2273-us any milk , and [we]2273-us all _ died _ of hunger . "[83-milly]

" Then [they]2276-they would put [us]2273-us into some black boxes , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , cheerfully , with [his]63-olly mouth full of bread and butter , " and [they]2276-they would put the black boxes into [some boats]2277-some boats , and take [us]2273-us right away and bury [us]2273-us krick -- wouldn't [they]2276-they , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly]

" Well , but-- "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who had by this time got rid of [his]89-mr. norton wet coat , and was seated by [Milly]83-milly , helping [himself]89-mr. norton to some tea , " suppose [we]2273-us got into [the boats]2279-the boats before [we]2273-us were dead , and rowed away to [[Windermere]18-windermere station]406-windermere station ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh no ! [father]1498-father , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , who always liked [her]83-milly stories to be as gloomy as possible , " [they]2276-they would n't know anything about [us]2273-us till [we]2273-us were dead [you]1498-father know , and then [they]2276-they 'd come and find [us]2273-us , and be _ very _ sorry for [us]2273-us , and say , ' Oh dear ! oh dear ! what a pity ! ' "[83-milly]

[Olly]63-olly began to look so dismal as [Milly]83-milly 's fancies grew more and more melancholy , that [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton took to laughing at [them]1055-they all . What did [they]1055-they know about [Westmoreland]25-westmoreland rain indeed . This was nothing -- just nothing at all ; [she]83-milly _ could _ remember some floods in the wintertime , when [she]83-milly was [a little girl]1658-a little girl , and used to stay with [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [great - grandmamma]1845-great - grandmamma ; but as for this , why , it was a good summer wetting , and that was all .

[A romp]1058-a romp sent [the children]198-the children to bed in excellent spirits again . This time both [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly stood at the window together , and told the rain to be sure to go to [Spain]32-spain that night , and never come back again while [they]1055-they were at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest .

" Or [you]83-milly might go to [Willingham]5-willingham , [you]83-milly know , [dear Mr. Rain]126-dear mr. rain , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly ; " [I]83-milly daresay [mother]1502-mother 's flowers want a good watering . And there 's Spot -- [you]83-milly might give [her]1502-mother a good washing -- [she]1502-mother _ can _ wash [herself]1502-mother , but [she]1502-mother wo n't . Only [we]2283-we do n't want [you]83-milly here , [Mr. Rain]126-dear mr. rain . "[83-milly]

But what [an obstinate disagreeable Mr. Rain]1060-an obstinate disagreeable mr. rain it was ! All that night it went on pouring , till the little beck in [the garden]219-the garden was so full it was almost choked , and could only get along by sputtering and foaming as if [some wicked water - fairies]1062-some wicked water - fairies were driving it along and tormenting it . And [all the little pools on [the mountain]1561-the mountain]1063-all the little pools on the mountain , the " tarns , "[102-becky] as [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza called [them]1063-all the little pools on the mountain , filled up , and the rain made [the mountain]1561-the mountain itself so wet that it was like one big bog all over .

When [the children]198-the children woke up the flood on [the lawn]270-the lawn was growing bigger , and it seemed to [them]198-the children as if [the house]265-the house and [garden]1069-garden were all wrapped up in a wet white cloud - blanket . [They]198-the children could not see [the mountain]1561-the mountain at all from the window , it was all covered with a thick white mist , and the dark fir trees in [the garden]219-the garden looked sad and drooping , as if the weight of raindrops was too much for [them]198-the children to carry .

[The children]198-the children had made up [their]198-the children minds so completely the night before that it _ could n't _ rain more than two days running , that [they]198-the children felt as if [they]198-the children could hardly be expected to bear this third wet morning cheerfully . [Nurse]75-nurse found [them]198-the children cross and out of spirits at breakfast . Even a prospect of asking [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza to tea did not bring any smiles to [their]198-the children forlorn little faces . It would be no fun having [anybody]1612-anybody to tea . [They]198-the children could n't go out , and there was nothing amusing [indoors]1074-indoors .

After breakfast , [Olly]63-olly set to work to get into mischief , as [he]63-olly generally did when [he]63-olly felt dull . [Nurse]75-nurse discovered [him]63-olly smearing [Katie]82-katie 's cheeks with raspberry jam " to make [them]198-the children get red kricker "[63-olly] as [he]63-olly said , and alas ! some of the jam had stuck to the new silk frock , and spoilt all its smart fresh look .

When [Milly]83-milly found it out [she]83-milly began to cry , and when [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton came in [she]70-mrs. norton saw a heap on the floor , which was [Milly]83-milly , sobbing , while [Olly]63-olly sat beside [her]70-mrs. norton with [his]63-olly mouth wide open , as if [he]63-olly was a good deal astonished at the result of [his]63-olly first attempt at doctoring .

" Pick up the pieces , [old woman]2008-old woman , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , taking hold of the heap and lifting it up . " What 's the matter with [you]2285-you both ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" [Olly]63-olly 's spoilt [[my]83-milly doll]2286-my doll , "[83-milly] sobbed [Milly]83-milly , " and it _ will _ go on raining -- and [I]83-milly feel so -- so -- dull . "[83-milly]

" [I]63-olly did n't spoil [her]70-mrs. norton doll , [mother]1502-mother , "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , eagerly . " [I]63-olly only rubbed some jam on its cheeks to make them a nicey pink -- only some of it _ would _ sticky [her]70-mrs. norton dress -- [I]63-olly did n't mean to . "[63-olly]

" How would [you]63-olly like some jam rubbed on [your]63-olly cheeks , [sir]1613-sir ? "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , who could scarcely help laughing at poor [Katie]82-katie 's appearance when [nurse]1496-nurse handed the doll to [her]82-katie . " Suppose [you]63-olly leave [Milly]83-milly 's dolls alone for the future ; but cheer up , [Milly]83-milly ! [I]70-mrs. norton think [I]70-mrs. norton can make [Katie]82-katie very nearly right again . Come [upstairs]435-upstairs to [[my]70-mrs. norton room]2290-my room and [we]2291-we 'll try . "[70-mrs. norton]

After a good deal of sponging and rubbing , and careful drying by the kitchen fire , [Katie]82-katie came very nearly right again , and then [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton tried whether some lessons would drive the rain out of [the children]198-the children 's heads . But the lessons did not go well . It was all [Milly]83-milly could do to help crying every time [she]83-milly got a figure wrong in [her]83-milly sum , and [Olly]63-olly took about ten minutes to read two lines of [his]63-olly reading - book . [Olly]63-olly had just begun [his]63-olly sums , and [Milly]83-milly was standing up to say some poetry to [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother , looking [a woebegone little figure , with pale cheeks and heavy eyes]1078-a woebegone little figure , with pale cheeks and heavy eyes , when suddenly there was a noise of wheels outside , and [both the children]1079-both the children turned to look out of the window .

" [A carriage]1601-a carriage ! [a carriage]1601-a carriage ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , jumping down , and running to the window .

There , indeed , was one of the shut - up " cars , "[1081-them] as [the Westmoreland people]1080-the westmoreland people call [them]1081-them , coming up [the Ravensnest drive]1082-the ravensnest drive .

" It 's [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , starting up , " how good of [her]59-aunt emma to come over on such a day . Run , [children]1510-children , and open the front door . "[70-mrs. norton]

Down flew [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly , tumbling over [one another]1083-one another in [their]1079-both the children hurry ; but [father]1498-father had already thrown the door open , and who should [they]1079-both the children see stepping down [the carriage]390-the carriage - steps but [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma [herself]59-aunt emma , with [her]59-aunt emma soft gray hair shining under [her]59-aunt emma veil , and [her]59-aunt emma dear kind face as gentle and cheery as ever .

" [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , dancing up to [her]59-aunt emma , and throwing [his]63-olly arms round [her]59-aunt emma , " _ are _ [you]59-aunt emma come to tell [us]1079-both the children about [old Mother Quiverquake]62-mother ? "[63-olly]

" [[You]59-aunt emma gipsy]2295-you gipsy , do n't strangle [me]63-olly ! Well , [Lucy]107-lucy dear , here [I]63-olly am . Will [you]59-aunt emma have [me]63-olly to dinner ? [I]63-olly thought [we]1079-both the children 'd all be company for [each other]2296-each other this bad day . Why , [Milly]83-milly , what have [you]83-milly been doing to [your]83-milly cheeks ? "[63-olly]

" [She]62-mother 's been crying , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , in spite of [Milly]83-milly 's pulling [him]63-olly by the sleeve to be quiet , " because [I]83-milly stickened [her]62-mother doll . "[83-milly]

" Well , and quite right too . [Dolls]127-dolls were n't made to be stickied . But now , who 's going to carry [my]63-olly bag [upstairs]435-upstairs ? Take it gently , [Milly]83-milly , it 's got [my]63-olly cap inside , and if [you]83-milly crumple [my]63-olly cap [I]63-olly shall have to sit with [my]63-olly head in a bandbox at dinner . [Old ladies]2298-old ladies are _ never _ seen without [their]2298-old ladies caps [you]83-milly know . The most dreadful things would happen if [they]2298-old ladies were ! [Olly]63-olly , [you]83-milly may put [my]63-olly umbrella away . There now , [I]63-olly 'll go to [[mother]1502-mother 's room]2300-mother 's room and take off [my]63-olly things . "[63-olly]

CHAPTER VII

A STORY - TELLING GAME

When [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was safely settled , cap and all , in one of [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room arm - chairs , it seemed to [the children]198-the children as if the rain and the gray sky did not matter nearly so much as [they]198-the children had done half an hour before . In the first place , [her]59-aunt emma coming made something new and interesting to think about ; and in the second place , [they]198-the children felt quite sure that [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma had n't brought [her]59-aunt emma little black bag into [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room with [her]59-aunt emma for nothing . If only [her]59-aunt emma cap had been in it , why of course [she]59-aunt emma would have left it in [[mother]1502-mother 's bedroom]1090-mother 's bedroom . But here it was in [her]59-aunt emma lap , with [her]59-aunt emma two hands folded tight over it , as if it contained something precious ! How very puzzling and interesting !

However , for a long time it seemed as if [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma had nothing at all to say about [her]59-aunt emma bag . [She]59-aunt emma began to tell [them]198-the children about [her]59-aunt emma drive -- how in two places [the horse]1091-the horse had to go splashing through the water , and how once , when [they]198-the children were crossing [a little river that ran across [the road]428-the road]1092-a little river that ran across the road , the water came so far up the wheels that " [I]59-aunt emma put [my]59-aunt emma head out of the window , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " and said to [[my]59-aunt emma old coachman]2301-my old coachman , ' Now , [John]66-john backhouse , if it 's going to get any deeper than this , [you]66-john backhouse 'd better turn [him]66-john backhouse round and go [home]382-home , for [I]59-aunt emma 'm [an old woman]2303-an old woman , not a fish , and [I]59-aunt emma ca n't swim . Of course , if the horse can swim with [the carriage]390-the carriage behind [him]66-john backhouse it 's all right , but [I]59-aunt emma have [my]59-aunt emma doubts . ' Now [John]66-john backhouse , [[my]59-aunt emma dears]2305-my dears , has been with [me]59-aunt emma a great many years , and [he]66-john backhouse knows very well that [I]59-aunt emma 'm rather [a nervous old woman]2306-a nervous old woman . It 's very sad , but it is so . Do n't [you]2305-my dears be nervous when [you]2305-my dears 're [old people]2307-old people . So all [he]66-john backhouse said was ' All right , [ma'am]1738-ma'am . Bless [you]1738-ma'am , [he]66-john backhouse can swim like a trout . ' And crack went the whip , splash went the water ! It seemed to [me]59-aunt emma it was just going to come in under the door , when , lo and behold ! there [we]2309-we were safe and sound on [dry ground]2310-dry ground again . But whether [my]59-aunt emma old horse swam through or walked through [I]59-aunt emma ca n't tell [you]2305-my dears . [I]59-aunt emma like to believe [he]66-john backhouse swam , because [I]59-aunt emma 'm so fond of [him]66-john backhouse , and [one]518-one likes to believe the creatures [one]518-one loves can do clever things . "[59-aunt emma]

" [I]63-olly 'll ask [John]66-john backhouse when [he]66-john backhouse comes to take [you]1738-ma'am away , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly . " [I]63-olly do n't believe horses can swim when [they]2312-they 're in [a carriage]1601-a carriage . "[63-olly]

" [You]1738-ma'am 're [a matter - of - fact monkey]2314-a matter - of - fact monkey , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " Dear [me]59-aunt emma , what 's that ? "[59-aunt emma]

For a loud squeak had suddenly startled [the children]198-the children , who were now looking about [them]198-the children everywhere in vain , to find out where it came from . [Squeak]128-squeak ! again . This time the voice certainly came from near [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's chair , but there was nothing to be seen .

" What [a strange house]2315-a strange house [you]1738-ma'am live in , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , with a perfectly grave face . " [You]1738-ma'am must have caught [a magician]1914-a magician somehow . That 's [a magician]1914-a magician 's squeak . "[59-aunt emma]

Again came the noise !

" [I]63-olly know , [I]63-olly know ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly . " It 's [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's bag ! [I]63-olly 'm sure it came out of the bag . "[63-olly]

" [My]59-aunt emma bag!"--holding[59-aunt emma] it up and looking at it . " Now does it look like a bag that squeaks ? [It]2318-it 's a perfectly well - behaved bag , and never did such a thing in [its]2318-it life . "[59-aunt emma]

" [I]63-olly know , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , dancing round [her]59-aunt emma in great excitement . " [You]59-aunt emma 've got the parrot in there ! "[63-olly]

" Well now , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " This is really serious . If [you]1095-you think [I]59-aunt emma am such [a cruel old woman]2319-a cruel old woman as to shut up a poor poll - parrot in a bag , there 's no help for it , [we]2320-we must open the bag . But it 's a very curious bag -- [I]59-aunt emma would n't stand too near it if [I]59-aunt emma were [you]1095-you . "[59-aunt emma]

Click ! went the fastening of the bag , and out jumped -- what do [you]1095-you think ? Why , the very biggest frog that was ever seen , in [this part of [the world]260-the world]1096-this part of the world at any rate , a green speckled frog , that hopped on to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's knee , and then on to the floor , where [it]1098-it went hopping and squeaking along the carpet , till all of a sudden , when [it]1098-it got to the door , it turned over on [its]1098-it back , and lay there quite quiet with its legs in the air .

[The children]198-the children followed it with looks half of horror , half of amazement .

" What is it , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? Is it alive ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , jumping on to a chair as the frog came near [her]59-aunt emma , and drawing [her]59-aunt emma little skirts tight round [her]59-aunt emma legs , while [Olly]63-olly went cautiously after it , with [his]63-olly hands on [his]63-olly knees , one step at a time .

" [You]198-the children 'd better ask it , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , who had at last begun to laugh a little , as if it was impossible to keep grave any longer . " [I]59-aunt emma 'm sure it looks very peaceable just now , poor thing . "[59-aunt emma]

So [the children]198-the children crept up to it , and examined [it]1098-it closely . Yes , it was a green speckled frog , but what it was made of , and whether it was alive , and if it was not alive how [it]1098-it managed to hop and squeak -- these were the puzzles .

" Take hold of it , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who had just come up from [his]89-mr. norton work , and was standing laughing near the door . " Turn it over on [its]1098-it legs again . "[89-mr. norton]

" No , [I]63-olly 'll turn it , "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , making a dash , and turning it over in a great hurry , keeping [his]63-olly legs and feet well out of the way . Hop ! squeak ! there it was off again , right down [the room]193-the room with [the children]198-the children after [it]1098-it , till it suddenly came up against a table leg , and once more turned over on [its]1098-it back and lay quite still .

" Oh , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , is it a toy ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , who now felt brave enough to take [it]1098-it up and look at it .

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [I]83-milly believe so -- [a very lively one]2321-a very lively one . Bring it here , and [I]83-milly 'll tell [you]198-the children something about it . "[83-milly]

So [the children]198-the children brought it very cautiously , as if [they]198-the children were not quite sure what it would do next , and then [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma explained to [them]198-the children that [she]59-aunt emma had once paid a visit to [a shop in [London]35-london where Japanese toys -- toys made in [the country of]1105-the country of [Japan]36-japan]1104-a shop in london where japanese toys -- toys made in the country of japan -- far away on [the other side of the world]2230-the other side of the world -- were sold , and that [there]1539-there [she]59-aunt emma found [master froggy]1108-master froggy .

" And there never was such a toy as froggy for a wet day , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " [I]59-aunt emma have tried [him]1108-master froggy on all sorts of [boys]1500-boys and [girls]737-girls , and [he]1108-master froggy never fails . [He]1108-master froggy 's as good a cure for a cross face as a poultice is for a sore finger . But , [Milly]83-milly , listen ! [I]59-aunt emma declare there 's something else going on in [my]59-aunt emma bag . [I]59-aunt emma really think , [my]59-aunt emma dear bag , [you]83-milly might be quiet now that [you]83-milly have got rid of froggy ! What can all this chattering be about ? Sh ! sh ! "[59-aunt emma] and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma held up [her]59-aunt emma finger at [the children]198-the children , while [she]59-aunt emma held the bag up to [her]59-aunt emma ear , and listened carefully . [Olly]63-olly was almost beside [himself]63-olly with excitement , but [Milly]83-milly had got [his]63-olly little brown hands tight in [hers]59-aunt emma for fear [he]63-olly should make a jump at the bag . " Yes , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " It 's just as [I]59-aunt emma thought . The bag declares it 's not [his]63-olly fault at all , but that if [I]59-aunt emma will give [him]63-olly such noisy creatures to carry [I]59-aunt emma must take the consequences . [He]63-olly says there 's [a whole family]1662-a whole family now inside [him]63-olly , making such a noise [he]63-olly can hardly hear [himself]63-olly speak . It 's enough , [he]63-olly says , to drive a respectable bag mad , and [he]63-olly must blow up if it goes on . [Dear]1794-dear [me]59-aunt emma ! [I]59-aunt emma must look into this . [Milly]83-milly , come here ! "[59-aunt emma]

[Milly]83-milly came near , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma opened the bag solemnly .

" Now , [Milly]83-milly , [I]59-aunt emma 'll hold [it]2326-it for fear it should take it into its poor head to blow up , and [you]83-milly put [your]83-milly hand in and see what [you]83-milly can find . "[59-aunt emma]

So [Milly]83-milly put [her]83-milly hand in , feeling a good deal excited as to what might happen -- and what do [you]1110-you think [she]83-milly brought out ? A whole handful of the most delicious dolls:--cardboard dolls of all sorts and kinds , like those in [mother]1502-mother 's drawer at [home]382-home ; [paper dolls]1113-paper dolls , [mamma dolls]1114-mamma dolls , [little boy dolls]1115-little boy dolls and [little girl dolls]1116-little girl dolls , [baby dolls]1117-baby dolls and [nurse dolls]1118-nurse dolls ; dolls in suits and dolls in frocks ; [dolls in hats]1119-dolls in hats and [dolls in nightgowns]1120-dolls in nightgowns ; [a papa in trousers]1121-a papa in trousers and [a mamma in a magnificent blue dress with flounces and a train]1122-a mamma in a magnificent blue dress with flounces and a train ; [a nurse in white cap and apron]1123-a nurse in white cap and apron and the most bewitching baby doll [you]1110-you ever saw , with a frilled paper cap that slipped on and off , and a white frock with pink ribbons . And the best of these dolls was , that each of [them]1124-they had a piece of cardboard fastened on behind and a little bit of cardboard to stand on , so that when [you]1110-you spread out the piece behind [they]1124-they stood up as naturally as possible , and looked as if [they]1124-they were going to talk to [you]1110-you .

" Oh , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , [dear Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , beside [herself]83-milly with delight as [she]83-milly spread them all out in [her]83-milly lap . " They 're just like [[mother]1502-mother 's at [home]382-home]2328-mother 's at home , [mother]1502-mother 's that [you]1110-you made for [her]1502-mother when [she]1502-mother was [a little girl]1658-a little girl -- only ever so many more . "[83-milly]

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [I]83-milly made [mother]1502-mother 's for [her]1502-mother long ago , when it rained for days and days without stopping , and [she]1502-mother had grown tired of pretty nearly everything and [everybody]1611-everybody indoors ; and now [I]83-milly have been spending part of these rainy days in making a new set for [[mother]1502-mother 's little girl]2335-mother 's little girl . There , [dear little woman]2336-dear little woman , [I]83-milly think [you]2336-dear little woman must have given [me]83-milly a kiss for each of [them]2337-them by this time . Suppose [you]2336-dear little woman try and make [them]2337-them stand up . "[83-milly]

" But , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who was busy examining the mysterious bag -- how could the dolls talk ? they 're only paper . "[63-olly]

" [I]59-aunt emma know nothing about it , "[59-aunt emma] answered [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , rescuing the bag , and putting it safely under [her]59-aunt emma chair . " [You]63-olly _ might _ ask the bag -- but it would n't answer [you]63-olly . Magical bags never do talk except to [[their]2337-them masters]2338-their masters or [mistresses]2339-mistresses . "[59-aunt emma]

So [Olly]63-olly had to puzzle it out for [himself]63-olly while [he]63-olly played with the Japanese frog . That was an extraordinary frog ! [You]1125-you should have seen [nurse]1496-nurse 's start when [Olly]63-olly hid [himself]63-olly in [the passage]1127-the passage and sent the frog hopping and squeaking through the open door of [the night nursery]1128-the night nursery , where [nurse]1496-nurse was sitting sewing ; and as for [cook]1130-cook , when the creature came flopping over [her]1130-cook kitchen floor [she]1130-cook very nearly spoilt the hash [she]1130-cook was making for dinner by dropping a whole pepper - box into the middle of it ! There was no end to the fun to be got out of froggy , and [Olly]63-olly amused [himself]63-olly with it the whole of the morning , while [Milly]83-milly went through long stories with [her]83-milly dolls [upstairs]435-upstairs , helped every now and then by [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , who sat knitting and talking to [mother]1502-mother .

At dinner [the children]198-the children had to sit quiet while [Mr.]1134-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma talked . [Father]85-father and [mother]1502-mother had been almost as much cheered up by [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's coming as [the children]198-the children [themselves]198-the children , and now the dinner - table was lively with pleasant talk ; talk about books , and talk about pictures , and talk about [foreign places]1137-foreign places , and talk about [the mountains]1534-the mountains and [the people living near [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]1139-the people living near ravensnest , [many of whom [mother]1502-mother had known when [she]1502-mother was [a little girl]1658-a little girl]1140-many of whom mother had known when she was a little girl . [Milly]83-milly , who was old enough to listen , could only understand a little bit here and there ; but there was always [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's friendly gentle face to look at , and [her]59-aunt emma soft old hand in its black mitten , to slip [her]59-aunt emma own little fingers into ; while [Olly]63-olly was so taken up with the prospects of the black - currant pudding which [he]63-olly had seen cook making in the morning , and the delight of it when it came , that it seemed no trouble to [him]63-olly to sit still .

As for the rain , there was not much difference . Perhaps there were a few breaks in the clouds , and it might be beating a little less heavily on the glass conservatory outside [the dining - room]474-the dining - room , still , on the whole , the weather was much the same as it had been . It was wonderful to see how little notice [the children]198-the children had taken of it since [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma came , and when [they]198-the children escorted [her]59-aunt emma [upstairs]435-upstairs after dinner , [they]198-the children quite forgot to rush to the window and look out , as [they]198-the children had been doing the last three days at every possible opportunity .

[The children]198-the children got [her]59-aunt emma safe into a chair , and then [Olly]63-olly brought a stool to one side of [her]59-aunt emma , and [Milly]83-milly brought a stool to the other .

" _ Now , _ can [you]59-aunt emma remember about [old Mother Quiverquake]62-mother ? "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , resting [his]63-olly little sunburnt chin on [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's knee , and looking up to [her]59-aunt emma with eager eyes .

[ Illustration : " ' Suppose [we]198-the children have a story - telling game ' "[83-milly] ]

" Well , [I]83-milly daresay [I]83-milly shall begin to remember about [her]59-aunt emma presently ; but suppose , [children]1510-children , [we]198-the children have a _ story - telling game _ . [We]198-the children 'll tell stories -- [you]59-aunt emma and [Olly]63-olly , [father]1498-father , [mother]1502-mother , and [everybody]1611-everybody . That 's much fairer than that [one person]2344-one person should do all the telling . "[83-milly]

" [We]198-the children could n't , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , shaking [her]83-milly head gravely , " [we]198-the children are [only little children]2345-only little children . [Little children]532-little children ca n't make up stories . "[83-milly]

" Suppose [little children]532-little children try , "[1502-mother] said [mother]1502-mother . " [I]1502-mother think [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's is an excellent plan . Now , [father]1498-father , [you]1498-father 'll have to tell one too . "[1502-mother]

" [Father]85-father 's lazy , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , coming out from behind [his]89-mr. norton newspaper . " But , perhaps , if [you]1498-father all of [you]1498-father tell very exciting stories [you]1498-father may stir [him]85-father up . "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh , [father]1498-father ! "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , who had a vivid remembrance of [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's stories , though they only came very seldom , " tell [us]1498-father about the rat with three tails , and the dog that walked on its nose . "[63-olly]

" Oh dear , no ! "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " those wo n't do for such a grand story - telling as this . [I]89-mr. norton must think of some story which is all long words and [good children]1940-good children . "[89-mr. norton]

" _ Do n't _ [father]1498-father , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , imploringly , " it 's ever so much nicer when [they]1940-good children get into scrapes , [you]1498-father know , and tumble down , and all that . "[83-milly]

" Who 's to begin ? "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . " [I]59-aunt emma think [mother]1502-mother had better begin . Afterwards it will be [your]1498-father turn , [Olly]63-olly ; then [father]1498-father , then [Milly]83-milly , and then [me]59-aunt emma . "[59-aunt emma]

" [I]70-mrs. norton do n't believe [I]70-mrs. norton 've got a scrap of a story in [my]70-mrs. norton head , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " It 's weeks since [I]70-mrs. norton caught one last . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Then look here , [Olly]63-olly , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " [I]59-aunt emma 'll tell [you]63-olly what to do . Go up gently behind [mother]1502-mother , and kiss [her]185-his mother three times on the top of the head . That 's the way to send the stories in . [Mother]62-mother will soon begin to feel one fidgeting inside [her]62-mother head after that . "[59-aunt emma]

So [Olly]63-olly went gently up behind [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother , climbed on a stool at the back of [her]185-his mother chair , and kissed [her]185-his mother softly three times at the back of [her]185-his mother head . [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton lay still for a few moments after the kisses , with closed eyes .

" Ah ! "[70-mrs. norton] [she]70-mrs. norton said at last . " Now [I]70-mrs. norton think [I]70-mrs. norton 've caught one . But it 's a very little one , [poor little thing]2355-poor little thing . And yet , strange to say , though it 's very little , it 's very old . Now , [children]1510-children , [you]1510-children must be kind to [my]70-mrs. norton story . [I]70-mrs. norton caught [him]2357-him first a great many years ago in an old book , but [I]70-mrs. norton am afraid [you]1510-children will hardly care for [him]2357-him as much as [I]70-mrs. norton did . Well , once upon a time there was [a great king]2081-a great king . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Was it [King Arthur]122-king arthur , [mother]1502-mother ? "[63-olly] interrupted [Olly]63-olly , eagerly .

" Oh no ! [this king]2360-this king lived in [a different country]2361-a different country altogether . [He]2360-this king lived in [a beautiful hot country over [the sea]1513-the sea]2362-a beautiful hot country over the sea , called [Spain]32-spain . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother ! [a _ hot _ country]2365-a _ hot _ country ! "[83-milly] protested [Milly]83-milly , " that 's where the rain goes to . "[83-milly]

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , [I]70-mrs. norton do n't think [you]83-milly know any more about it , except that [you]83-milly _ tell _ the rain to go there . Do n't [you]83-milly know by this time that the rain never does what it 's told ? Really , very little rain goes to [Spain]32-spain , and in [some parts of [the country]2367-the country]2366-some parts of the country [the people]2084-the people would be very glad indeed if [we]2369-we could send [them]2084-the people some of the rain [we]2369-we do n't want at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest . But now , [you]83-milly must n't interrupt [me]70-mrs. norton , or [I]70-mrs. norton shall forget [my]70-mrs. norton story -- Well there was once [a king who lived in [a _ very _ hot part of [Spain]32-spain , where [they]2084-the people do n't have much rain , and where it hardly ever snows or freezes]2371-a _ very _ hot part of spain , where they do n't have much rain , and where it hardly ever snows or freezes]2370-a king who lived in a _ very _ hot part of spain , where they do n't have much rain , and where it hardly ever snows or freezes . And [this king]2360-this king had [a beautiful wife]2373-a beautiful wife , whom [he]2360-this king loved very much . But , unluckily , [this beautiful wife]2374-this beautiful wife had one great fault . [She]2374-this beautiful wife was always wishing for the most unreasonable and impossible things , and though [the king]2079-the king was always trying to get [her]2374-this beautiful wife what [she]2374-this beautiful wife wanted [she]2374-this beautiful wife was never satisfied , and every day [she]2374-this beautiful wife seemed to grow more and more discontented and exacting . At last , one day in the winter , a most extraordinary thing happened . A shower of snow fell in [Cordova]37-cordova , which was the name of [[the town]2376-the town where [the king]2079-the king and [queen]2379-queen lived]2377-the town where the king and queen lived , and it whitened [the hills]604-the hills all around [the town]2376-the town , so that they looked as if [somebody]545-somebody had been dusting white sugar over them . Now snow was hardly ever seen in [Cordova]37-cordova , and [the people in [the town]2376-the town]2383-the people in the town wondered at it , and talked about it a great deal . But after [she]2374-this beautiful wife had looked at it a little - while [the queen]2385-the queen began to cry bitterly . [None of [[her]2385-the queen ladies]2387-her ladies]2386-none of her ladies could comfort [her]2374-this beautiful wife , nor would [she]2374-this beautiful wife tell any of [them]2387-her ladies what was the matter . There [she]2374-this beautiful wife sat at [her]2374-this beautiful wife window , weeping , till [the king]2079-the king came to see [her]2374-this beautiful wife . When [he]2079-the king came [he]2079-the king could not imagine what [she]2374-this beautiful wife was crying about , and begged [her]2374-this beautiful wife to tell [him]2079-the king why . ' [I]70-mrs. norton am weeping , ' [she]70-mrs. norton said , sobbing all the time , ' because [the hills]604-the hills -- are not always -- covered with snow . See how pretty they look ! And yet -- [I]70-mrs. norton have never , till now , seen them look like that . If [you]2079-the king really loved [me]70-mrs. norton , [you]2079-the king would manage some way or other that it should snow once a year at any rate . '[70-mrs. norton]

" ' But how can [I]83-milly make it snow ? ' cried [the king]2079-the king in great trouble , because [she]2374-this beautiful wife would go on weeping and weeping , and spoiling [her]2374-this beautiful wife pretty eyes .[83-milly]

" ' [I]70-mrs. norton 'm sure [I]70-mrs. norton do n't know , ' said [the queen]2385-the queen , crossly , ' but [you]2079-the king ca n't love [me]70-mrs. norton a bit , or [you]2079-the king 'd certainly try . '[70-mrs. norton]

" Well , [the king]2079-the king thought and thought , and at last [he]2079-the king hit upon a beautiful plan . [He]2079-the king sent into [all parts of [Spain]32-spain]2393-all parts of spain to buy almond trees , and planted them on [the hills all round [the town]2376-the town]2394-the hills all round the town . Now the almond tree , as [you]2079-the king know , has a lovely pinky - white blossom , so when the next spring arrived all these thousands of almond trees came out into bloom all over [the hills round [Cordova]37-cordova]2396-the hills round cordova , so that they looked at a distance as if they were covered with white snow . And for once [the queen]2385-the queen was delighted , and could not help saying a nice ' Thank [you]2079-the king ' to [the king]2079-the king for all the trouble [he]2079-the king had taken to please [her]2385-the queen . But it was not very long before [she]2385-the queen grew discontented again , and began once more to wish for all kinds of ridiculous things . One day [she]2385-the queen was sitting at [her]2385-the queen window , and [she]2385-the queen saw [some ragged little children]2399-some ragged little children playing by [the river]1681-the river that ran round [the palace]2401-the palace . [They]2399-some ragged little children were dabbling in the mud at the side , sticking [their]2399-some ragged little children little bare feet into it , or scooping up pieces which [they]2399-some ragged little children rolled into balls and threw at [one another]1083-one another . [The queen]2385-the queen watched [them]2399-some ragged little children for some time , and at last [she]2385-the queen began to weep bitterly . [One of [[her]2385-the queen maidens]2405-her maidens]2404-one of her maidens ran and told [the king]2079-the king that [the queen]2385-the queen was weeping , and [he]2079-the king came in a great hurry to see what was the matter .[83-milly]

" ' Just look at [those children]2408-those children down there ! ' said [the queen]2385-the queen , sobbing and pointing to [them]2408-those children . ' Did [you]2079-the king ever see [anybody]1612-anybody so happy ? Why ca n't [I]70-mrs. norton have mud to dabble in too , and why ca n't [I]70-mrs. norton take off [my]70-mrs. norton shoes and stockings , and amuse [myself]70-mrs. norton like [the children]198-the children do , instead of being so dull and stuck - up all day long ? '[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Because it is n't proper for [queens]2412-queens to dabble in the mud , ' said [the poor king]2413-the poor king in great perplexity , for [he]2079-the king did n't at all like the idea of [[his]2079-the king beautiful queen]2414-his beautiful queen dabbling in the mud with [the little ragged children]2415-the little ragged children .[83-milly]

" ' That 's just like [you]2079-the king , ' said [the queen]2385-the queen , beginning to cry faster than ever , ' [you]2079-the king never do anything to please [me]70-mrs. norton . What 's the good of being proper ? What 's the good of being [a queen]2417-a queen at all ? '[70-mrs. norton]

" This made [the king]2079-the king very unhappy , and again [he]2079-the king thought and thought , till at last [he]2079-the king hit upon a plan . [He]2079-the king ordered a very large shallow bath of white marble to be made in [the palace - garden]2419-the palace - garden . Then [he]2079-the king poured into it all kinds of precious stones , and chips of sweet - smelling wood , besides a thousand cartloads of rose - leaves and a thousand cartloads of orange flowers . All these [he]2079-the king ordered to be stirred up together with a great ivory spoon , till they made a kind of wonderful mud , and then [he]2079-the king had the bath filled up with scented water .[83-milly]

" ' Now then , ' [he]2079-the king said to [the queen]2385-the queen , when [he]2079-the king had brought [her]2385-the queen down to look at it , ' [you]2385-the queen may take off [your]2385-the queen shoes and stockings and paddle about in this mud as much as [you]2385-the queen like . ' [You]2385-the queen may imagine that this was a very pleasant kind of mud to dabble in , and [the queen]2385-the queen and [[her]2385-the queen ladies]2387-her ladies amused [themselves]2387-her ladies with it immensely for some time . But nothing could keep [this tiresome queen]2423-this tiresome queen amused for long together , and in about a fortnight [she]2423-this tiresome queen had grown quite tired of [her]2423-this tiresome queen wonderful bath . It seemed as if [the king]2079-the king 's pains had been all thrown away . [She]2423-this tiresome queen grew cross and discontented again , and [[her]2423-this tiresome queen ladies]2387-her ladies began to say to [each other]2296-each other , ' What will [she]2423-this tiresome queen wish for next , [I]70-mrs. norton wonder ? [The king]2079-the king might as well try to drink up [the sea]1513-the sea as try to get [her]2423-this tiresome queen all [she]2423-this tiresome queen wants . ' At last , one day , when [she]2423-this tiresome queen and [[her]2423-this tiresome queen ladies]2387-her ladies were walking near [the palace]2401-the palace , [they]2387-her ladies met [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess driving a flock of sheep up into [the hills]604-the hills . [The shepherdess]2433-the shepherdess looked so pretty and bright in [her]2433-the shepherdess red petticoat and tall yellow cap , that [the queen]2385-the queen stopped to speak to [her]2433-the shepherdess .[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Where are [you]2433-the shepherdess going , [pretty maiden]2435-pretty maiden , with [your]2433-the shepherdess woolly white sheep ? ' [she]2385-the queen asked .[83-milly]

" ' [I]70-mrs. norton am going up to [the hills]604-the hills , ' said [the shepherdess]2433-the shepherdess . ' Now the sun has scorched up [the fields]319-the fields down below [we]2387-her ladies must take [our]2387-her ladies sheep up to [the cool hills]2439-the cool hills , where the grass is still fresh and green . Good - day , good - day , the sheep are going so fast [I]70-mrs. norton can not wait . ' So on [she]2433-the shepherdess tripped , singing and calling to [her]2433-the shepherdess sheep , who came every now and then to rub [their]2440-their soft coats against [her]2433-the shepherdess , as if [they]2440-their loved [her]2433-the shepherdess . [The queen]2385-the queen looked after [her]2433-the shepherdess , and [her]2433-the shepherdess face began to pucker up .[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Why am [I]83-milly not [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess ? ' [she]83-milly exclaimed , bursting into tears . ' [I]83-milly _ hate _ being [a queen]2417-a queen ! [I]83-milly never sang as merrily as [that little maiden]2444-that little maiden in all [my]83-milly life . [I]83-milly must and will be [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess , and drive sheep up into [the mountain]1561-the mountain , or [I]83-milly shall die ! "[83-milly]

" And all that night [the foolish queen]2447-the foolish queen sat at [her]2447-the foolish queen window crying , and when the morning came [she]2447-the foolish queen had made [herself]2447-the foolish queen look quite old and ugly . When [the king]2079-the king came to see [her]2447-the foolish queen [he]2079-the king was dreadfully troubled , and begged [her]2447-the foolish queen to tell [him]2079-the king what was the matter now .[70-mrs. norton]

" ' [I]83-milly want to be [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess , and drive sheep up into [the mountains]1534-the mountains , ' sobbed [the queen]2385-the queen . ' Why should [the little shepherdess girls]2452-the little shepherdess girls look always so happy and merry , while [I]83-milly am dying of dulness ? '[83-milly]

" [The king]2079-the king thought it was very unkind of [her]2447-the foolish queen to say [she]2447-the foolish queen was dying of dulness when [he]2079-the king had taken so much trouble to get [her]2447-the foolish queen all [she]2447-the foolish queen wanted ; but [he]2079-the king knew it was no good talking to [her]2447-the foolish queen while [she]2447-the foolish queen was in such a temper . So all [he]2079-the king said was :[70-mrs. norton]

" ' How can [I]83-milly turn [you]2447-the foolish queen into [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess ? [These shepherdesses]2455-these shepherdesses stay out all night with [their]2455-these shepherdesses sheep on [the hills]604-the hills , and live on water and a crust of bread . How would [you]2447-the foolish queen like that ? '[83-milly]

" ' Of course [I]70-mrs. norton - should like it , ' said [the queen]2385-the queen , ' anything for a change . Besides , nothing could be nicer than staying out of [doors]2458-doors these lovely nights . And as for food , [you]2079-the king know very well that [I]70-mrs. norton am never hungry [here]1560-here , and that it does n't matter in the least to [me]70-mrs. norton what [I]70-mrs. norton eat ! '[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Well , ' said [the king]2079-the king , ' [you]2447-the foolish queen shall go up to [the hills]604-the hills , if [you]2447-the foolish queen promise to take [[your]2447-the foolish queen ladies]2462-your ladies with [you]2447-the foolish queen , and if [you]2447-the foolish queen will let [me]83-milly send a tent to shelter [you]2447-the foolish queen at night , and [some servants]2463-some servants to look after [you]2447-the foolish queen . '[83-milly]

" ' As if that would give [me]70-mrs. norton any pleasure ! ' said [the queen]2385-the queen , ' to be followed about and waited upon is just what [I]70-mrs. norton detest . [I]70-mrs. norton will go alone ; just like that pretty little shepherdess , if [I]70-mrs. norton go at all . '[70-mrs. norton]

" But [the king]2079-the king declared that nothing would induce [him]2079-the king to let [her]2385-the queen go alone . So [the queen]2385-the queen set to work to cry , and [she]2385-the queen cried for two days and two nights without stopping , and at the end of that time [the poor king]2413-the poor king was ready to let [her]2385-the queen go anywhere or do anything for the sake of a little peace .[83-milly]

" So [she]2385-the queen had [her]2385-the queen own way . [They]2468-them found [her]2385-the queen a flock of the loveliest white sheep , all with blue ribbons round [their]2468-them necks , and blue rosettes on [their]2468-them little white tails ; and [the queen]2385-the queen dressed [herself]2385-the queen up in a red silk petticoat and a cap embroidered in gold and silver , and then [she]2385-the queen set out by [herself]2385-the queen .[70-mrs. norton]

" At first it was all delightful . [She]2385-the queen drove the sheep up [the soft green hillsides]2470-the soft green hillsides , and laughed with delight to see [them]2468-them nibbling the fresh grass , and running hither and thither after [her]2385-the queen , and after [each other]2296-each other . The evening sun shone brightly , and [she]2385-the queen sat [herself]2385-the queen down on a rock and sang all the tunes [she]2385-the queen knew , that [she]2385-the queen might be just like [the little shepherdess]2472-the little shepherdess . But while [she]2385-the queen was singing the sheep strayed away , and [she]2385-the queen had to run after [them]2468-them as fast as [she]2385-the queen could , to catch [them]2468-them up . This made [her]2385-the queen hot and tired , so [she]2385-the queen tried to make [them]2468-them lie down under a chestnut tree , that [she]2385-the queen might rest beside [them]2468-them . But the sheep were not a bit tired , and had no mind to rest at all . While [she]2385-the queen was calling one set of [them]2468-them together the other set ran scampering off , and [the queen]2385-the queen found out that [she]2385-the queen must just give up [her]2385-the queen way for once and follow [theirs]2468-them . On went the sheep , up hill and down [dale]2474-dale , nibbling and frisking and trotting to [their]2468-them hearts ' content , till [the queen]2385-the queen was worn out .[83-milly]

" At last , by the time the sun was setting , [the poor queen]2476-the poor queen was so tired that [she]2476-the poor queen could walk no longer . Down [she]2476-the poor queen sat , and the ungrateful sheep kicked up [their]2468-them little hind legs and trotted away out of sight as fast as [they]2468-them could trot . There [she]2476-the poor queen was left on [the hillside]2477-the hillside all alone . It began to get dark , and the sky , instead of being blue and clear as it had been , filled with black clouds .[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Oh dear ! oh dear ! ' sighed [the queen]2385-the queen , ' here is a storm coming . If [I]83-milly could only find [my]83-milly way down [the hill]2479-the hill , if [I]83-milly could only see [the town]2376-the town ! '[83-milly]

" But there were trees all about [her]2476-the poor queen , which hid the view , and soon it was so dark there was nothing to be seen , not even the stars . And presently , crash came the thunder , and after the thunder the rain -- such rain ! It soaked [the queen]2385-the queen 's golden cap till it was so heavy with water [she]2476-the poor queen was obliged to throw it away , and [her]2476-the poor queen silk petticoat was as wet as if [she]2476-the poor queen had been taking a bath in it . In vain [she]2476-the poor queen ran hither and thither , trying to find a way through the trees , while the rain blinded [her]2476-the poor queen , and the thunder deafened [her]2476-the poor queen , till at last [she]2476-the poor queen was forced to sink down on the ground , feeling more wretched and frightened and cold than [any queen]2482-any queen ever felt before . Oh , if [she]2476-the poor queen were only safe back in [[her]2476-the poor queen beautiful palace]2483-her beautiful palace ! If only [she]2476-the poor queen had [the tent [the king]2079-the king wanted to send with [her]2476-the poor queen]2484-the tent the king wanted to send with her ! But there all night [she]2476-the poor queen had to stay , and all night the storm went on , till [the queen]2385-the queen was lying in a flood , and the owls and bats , startled out of their holes , went flying past [her]2476-the poor queen in the dark , and frightening [her]2476-the poor queen out of [her]2476-the poor queen senses . When the morning came there was such [a shivering , crumpled up queen]2487-a shivering , crumpled up queen sitting on the grass , that even [[her]2476-the poor queen own ladies]2488-her own ladies would scarcely have known [her]2476-the poor queen .[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Oh , [husband]2489-husband ! [husband]2489-husband ! ' [she]2476-the poor queen cried , getting up and wringing [her]2476-the poor queen cold little hands . ' [You]2489-husband will never find [me]83-milly , and [[your]2489-husband poor wicked wife]2491-your poor wicked wife will die of cold and hunger . '[83-milly]

" Tirra - lirra ! tirra - lirra ! What was that sounding in [the forest]2492-the forest ? Surely -- surely -- it was a hunting horn . But who could be blowing it so early in the cold gray morning , when it was scarcely light ? On ran [the queen]2385-the queen toward where the sound came from . Over rocks and grass [she]2476-the poor queen ran , till , all of a sudden , stepping out from behind a tree , came [the king]2079-the king [himself]2079-the king , who had been looking for [her]2476-the poor queen for hours . And then what do [you]2489-husband think [the discontented queen]2495-the discontented queen did ? [She]2476-the poor queen folded [her]2476-the poor queen hands , and hung [her]2476-the poor queen head , and said , quite sadly and simply :[70-mrs. norton]

" ' Oh , [[my]83-milly lord king]2496-my lord king , make [me]83-milly [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess really . [I]83-milly do n't deserve to be [a queen]2417-a queen . Send [me]83-milly away , and let [me]83-milly knit and spin for [my]83-milly living . [I]83-milly have plagued [you]2079-the king long enough . '[83-milly]

" And suddenly it seemed to [the king]2079-the king as if there had been a black speck in [the queen]2385-the queen 's heart , which had been all washed away by the rain ; and [he]2079-the king took [her]2385-the queen hands , and led [her]2385-the queen home to [the palace]2401-the palace in joy and gladness . And so [they]2502-they lived happy ever afterward . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Thank [you]70-mrs. norton _ very _ much , [mother]1502-mother , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , stretching up [her]83-milly arms and drawing down [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton 's face to kiss [her]70-mrs. norton . " Do [you]70-mrs. norton really think [the queen]2385-the queen was never discontented any more ? "[83-milly]

" [I]70-mrs. norton ca n't tell [you]2079-the king any more than the story does , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " [You]2079-the king see there would always be that dreadful night to think about , if [she]2385-the queen ever felt inclined to be ; but [I]70-mrs. norton daresay [the queen]2385-the queen did n't find it very easy at first . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [I]63-olly would have made [her]2385-the queen be [a shepherdess]2431-a shepherdess , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , shaking [his]63-olly head gravely . " [She]2385-the queen was n't nice , not a bit . "[63-olly]

" [Little Mr. Severity]129-little mr. severity ! "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , pulling [his]63-olly brown curls . " It 's [your]63-olly turn next , [Olly]63-olly . "[59-aunt emma]

" Then [Milly]83-milly must kiss [me]63-olly first , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , looking rather scared , as if something [he]63-olly did n't quite understand was going to happen to [him]63-olly .

So [Milly]83-milly went through the operation of kissing [him]63-olly three times on the back of the head , and then [Olly]63-olly 's eyes , finding it did no good to stare at [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma or [mother]1502-mother , went wandering all round [the room]193-the room in search of something else to help [him]63-olly . Suddenly [they]1152-they came to the window , where a brown speck was dancing up and down , and then [Olly]63-olly 's face brightened , and [he]63-olly began in a great hurry :

" Once upon a time there was a daddy - long - legs-- "[63-olly]

" Well , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , when [they]1152-they had waited a little while , and nothing more came .

" [I]63-olly do n't know any more , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly .

" Oh , that _ is _ silly , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " why , that is n't a story at all . Shut [your]63-olly eyes tight , that 's much the best way of making a story . "[83-milly]

So [Olly]63-olly shut [his]63-olly eyes , and pressed [his]63-olly two hands tightly over them , and then [he]63-olly began again :

" Once upon a time there was [a daddy - long - legs--]2507-a daddy - long - legs-- "[63-olly]

Another stop .

" Was it a _ good _ daddy - long - legs ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , anxious to help [him]63-olly on .

" Yes , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " that 's it , [Milly]83-milly . Once upon a time there was [a good daddy - long - legs--]2508-a good daddy - long - legs-- "[63-olly]
