" Well , what did [he]2508-a good daddy - long - legs-- do ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly , impatiently .

" [He]2508-a good daddy - long - legs-- -- [he]2508-a good daddy - long - legs-- -- flewed on to [father]1498-father 's nose ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , keeping [his]63-olly hands tight over [his]63-olly eyes , while [his]63-olly little white teeth appeared below in a broad grin .

" And [father]1498-father said , ' Who 's that on [my]63-olly nose ? ' and [the daddy - long - legs]2511-the daddy - long - legs said , ' It 's [me]63-olly , do n't [you]63-olly know ? ' And [father]1498-father said , ' Get away off [my]63-olly nose , [I]63-olly do n't like [you]63-olly a bit . ' And [the daddy - long - legs]2511-the daddy - long - legs said , ' [I]63-olly sha n't go away . It 's hot on the window , the sun gets in [my]63-olly eyes . [I]63-olly like sitting up here best . ' So [father]1498-father took a big sofa - cushion and gave [his]1498-father nose _ ever _ such a bang ! And [the daddy - long - legs]2511-the daddy - long - legs tumbled down dead . And the cushion tumbled down dead . And [father]1498-father tumbled down dead . And that 's all , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly opening [his]63-olly eyes , and looking extremely proud of [himself]63-olly .

" Oh , [[you]63-olly silly boy]2517-you silly boy ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , " that is n't a bit like a real story . "[83-milly]

But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother laughed a good deal at [Olly]63-olly 's story , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma said it would do very well for [such a small boy]1155-such a small boy .

Whose turn was it next ?

" [Father]85-father 's turn ! [father]1498-father 's turn ! "[198-the children] cried [the children]198-the children , in great glee , looking round for [him]63-olly ; but while [Olly]63-olly 's story had been going on , [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who was sitting behind [them]198-the children in a big arm - chair , had been covering [himself]89-mr. norton up with sofa cushions and newspapers , till there was only the tip of one of [his]89-mr. norton boots to be seen , coming out from under the heap . [The children]198-the children were a long time dragging [him]89-mr. norton out , for [he]89-mr. norton pelted [them]198-the children with cushions , and crumpled the newspapers over [their]198-the children heads , till [they]198-the children were so tired with laughing and struggling [they]198-the children had no strength left .

" [Father]85-father , it is n't fair , [I]83-milly do n't think , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly at last , sitting a breathless heap on the floor . " Of course [little people]230-little people ca n't _ make _ [big people]2520-big people do things , so [the big people]2521-the big people ought to do them without making . "[83-milly]

" That 's not at all good reasoning , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who could not resist the temptation of throwing one more sofa cushion at [her]83-milly laughing face . " [You]89-mr. norton ca n't _ make _ [nurse]1496-nurse stand on [her]1496-nurse head , but that 's no reason why [nurse]1496-nurse should stand on [her]1496-nurse head . "[89-mr. norton]

Just then [Olly]63-olly , moving up a stool behind [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's chair , brought [his]63-olly little mouth suddenly down on [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's head , and gave [him]63-olly three kisses in a great hurry , with a shout of triumph at the end .

" Dear [me]89-mr. norton ! "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , shutting [his]89-mr. norton eyes and falling back as if something had happened to [him]89-mr. norton . " This is very serious . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , that spell of [yours]59-aunt emma is really _ too _ strong . [My]89-mr. norton poor head ! It will certainly burst if [I]89-mr. norton do n't get this story out directly ! Come , jump up , [children]1510-children -- quick ! "[89-mr. norton]

Up jumped [the children]198-the children , one on each knee , and [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton began at once .

CHAPTER VIII

THE STORY OF BEOWULF

Once upon a time there was a great-- "[89-mr. norton]

" [Father]1498-father , "[83-milly] interrupted [Milly]83-milly , " [I]83-milly shall soon be getting tired of ' Once upon a time there was [a great king]2081-a great king . ' "[83-milly]

" Do n't cry till [you]83-milly 're hurt , [Milly]83-milly ; which means , wait till [I]89-mr. norton get to the end of [my]89-mr. norton sentence . Well , once upon a time there was [a great -- hero]2527-a great -- hero . "[89-mr. norton]

" What is [a hero]2528-a hero ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" [I]83-milly know , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , eagerly , " it 's [a brave man]2529-a brave man that 's always fighting and killing giants and dragons and [cruel people]2530-cruel people . "[83-milly]

" That 'll do to begin with , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " though , when [you]83-milly grow older , [you]83-milly will find that [people]1598-people can be [heroes]2532-heroes without fighting or killing . However , [the man [I]89-mr. norton am going to tell [you]83-milly about]2533-the man i am going to tell you about was just the kind of hero [you]83-milly 're thinking of , [Milly]83-milly . [He]2533-the man i am going to tell you about loved fighting with giants and dragons and [wild people]2534-wild people , and [my]89-mr. norton story is going to be about two of [his]2533-the man i am going to tell you about fights -- the greatest [he]2533-the man i am going to tell you about ever fought . The name of [this hero]2535-this hero was [Beowulf]130-beowulf , and [he]2533-the man i am going to tell you about lived in [a country called [Sweden]38-sweden]2536-a country called sweden ( [Milly]83-milly knows all about [Sweden]38-sweden , [Olly]63-olly , and [you]83-milly must get [her]83-milly to show it [you]83-milly on the map ) , with [a number of other brave men who were [[his]2533-the man i am going to tell you about friends]2086-his friends , and helped [him]2533-the man i am going to tell you about in [his]2533-the man i am going to tell you about battles]2537-a number of other brave men who were his friends , and helped him in his battles . And one day [a messenger]2539-a messenger came over [the sea]1513-the sea from [another country close by , called [Denmark]39-denmark]2541-another country close by , called denmark , and [the messenger]2542-the messenger said , ' Which of all [[you]83-milly brave men]2543-you brave men will come over and help [[my]89-mr. norton master]2544-my master , [King Hrothgar]131-hrothgar , who is in sore trouble ? ' And [the messenger]2542-the messenger told [them]2543-you brave men how [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar , for many years past , had been plagued by a monster -- [the hateful monster [Grendel]132-grendel]2546-the hateful monster grendel -- [half a man]2547-half a man and half a beast , who lived at the bottom of [a great bog near [[the king]2079-the king 's palace]2550-the king 's palace]2548-a great bog near the king 's palace . Every night , [he]2542-the messenger said , [Grendel the monster]132-grendel came out of [the bog]684-the bog with [[his]132-grendel horrible mother]2552-his horrible mother beside [him]132-grendel -- a wolf - like creature , fearful to look upon -- and [he]132-grendel and [she]2552-his horrible mother would roam about [the country]2367-the country , killing and slaying [all whom [they]2543-you brave men met]2554-all whom they met . Sometimes [they]2543-you brave men would come stalking to [[the king]2079-the king 's palace]2550-the king 's palace , where [[his]2079-the king brave men]2557-his brave men were sleeping round the fire in [the big hall]2558-the big hall , and before [anyone]454-anyone could withstand [him]132-grendel [Grendel]132-grendel would fall upon [[the king]2079-the king 's warriors]2561-the king 's warriors , kill [them]2561-the king 's warriors by tens and twenties , and carry off [their]2561-the king 's warriors dead bodies to [[his]2079-the king bog]2562-his bog . Many [a brave man]2529-a brave man had tried to slay [the monster]2564-the monster , but [none]2565-none had been able so much as to wound [him]132-grendel .[89-mr. norton]

" When [Beowulf]130-beowulf and [[his]130-beowulf friends]2086-his friends had heard this story [they]2557-his brave men thought a while , and then [each]2567-each said to [the other]520-the other , ' Let [us]2557-his brave men go across [the sea]1513-the sea and rid [King Hrothgar]131-hrothgar of [this monster]2570-this monster . ' So [they]2557-his brave men took [ship]2571-ship and went across [the sea]1513-the sea to [[Hrothgar]131-hrothgar 's country]2573-hrothgar 's country , and [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar welcomed [them]2557-his brave men royally , and made a great feast in [their]2557-his brave men honour . And after the feast [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar said to [Beowulf]130-beowulf , ' Now , [I]89-mr. norton give over to [you]130-beowulf [the hall of [[my]89-mr. norton palace]2575-my palace]2574-the hall of my palace , that [you]130-beowulf may guard [it]2574-the hall of my palace against the monster . ' So [Beowulf]130-beowulf and [the brave men who had come over with [him]130-beowulf]2576-the brave men who had come over with him made a great fire in [the hall]788-the hall , and [they]2557-his brave men all lay down to sleep beside it . [You]2578-you may imagine that [they]2557-his brave men did not find it very easy to get to sleep , and [some of [them]2557-his brave men]2579-some of them thought as [they]2557-his brave men lay there that very likely [they]2557-his brave men should never see [[their]2557-his brave men homes in [Sweden]38-sweden]2580-their homes in sweden again . But [they]2557-his brave men were tired with journeying and feasting , and one after another [they]2557-his brave men all fell asleep . Then in the dead of the night , when all was still , [Grendel]132-grendel rose up out of [the bog]684-the bog , and came stalking over [the moor]2582-the moor to [the palace]2401-the palace . [His]132-grendel eyes flamed with a kind of horrible light in the darkness , and [his]132-grendel steps seemed to shake [the earth]2584-the earth ; but those inside [the palace]2401-the palace were sleeping so heavily that [they]2557-his brave men heard nothing , not even when [Grendel]132-grendel burst open the door of [the hall]788-the hall and came in among [them]2557-his brave men . Before [anyone]454-anyone had wakened , [the monster]2564-the monster had seized one of [the sleeping men]2589-the sleeping men and torn [him]132-grendel to pieces . Then [he]2564-the monster came to [Beowulf]130-beowulf ; but [Beowulf]130-beowulf sprang up out of [his]130-beowulf sleep and laid hold upon [him]132-grendel boldly . [He]130-beowulf used no sword to strike [him]132-grendel , for there was no sword which [men]2590-men could make was strong enough to hurt [Grendel]132-grendel ; but [he]130-beowulf seized [him]132-grendel with [his]130-beowulf strong hands , and [the two]2591-the two struggled together in [the palace]2401-the palace . And [they]2591-the two fought till the benches were torn from the walls , and everything in [the hall]788-the hall was smashed and broken . [The brave men]2594-the brave men , springing up all round , seized [their]2594-the brave men swords and would gladly have helped [[their]2594-the brave men lord]2595-their lord , but there was [no one]2596-no one but [Beowulf]130-beowulf could harm [Grendel]132-grendel .[89-mr. norton]

" So [they]2591-the two fought , till at last [Beowulf]130-beowulf tore away [Grendel]132-grendel 's hand and arm , and the monster fled away howling into the darkness . Over [the moor]2582-the moor [he]130-beowulf rushed till [he]130-beowulf came to [[his]130-beowulf bog]2562-his bog , and there [he]130-beowulf sank down into [the middle of [the bog]684-the bog]2599-the middle of the bog , wailing and shrieking like [one whose last hour was come]2601-one whose last hour was come . Then there was great rejoicing at [Heorot]41-heorot , [the palace]2401-the palace , and [King Hrothgar]131-hrothgar , when [he]131-hrothgar saw [Grendel]132-grendel 's hand which [Beowulf]130-beowulf had torn away , embraced [him]132-grendel and blessed [him]132-grendel , and [he]131-hrothgar and all [[his]131-hrothgar friends]2086-his friends were laden with splendid gifts .[89-mr. norton]

" But all was not over yet . When the next night came , and [[Hrothgar]131-hrothgar 's men]2604-hrothgar 's men and [[Beowulf]130-beowulf 's men]2605-beowulf 's men were asleep together in [the great hall]2606-the great hall , [[Grendel]132-grendel 's horrible mother]2607-grendel 's horrible mother , half [a woman and half a wolf]2608-a woman and half a wolf , came rushing to [the palace]2401-the palace and while [they]2610-they were all asleep [she]2607-grendel 's horrible mother carried off [one of [[Hrothgar]131-hrothgar 's dearest friends]2612-hrothgar 's dearest friends]2611-one of hrothgar 's dearest friends -- [a young noble whom [he]130-beowulf loved best of [all [his]130-beowulf nobles]2614-all his nobles]2613-a young noble whom he loved best of all his nobles . And [she]2607-grendel 's horrible mother killed [him]130-beowulf , and carried [his]130-beowulf body back to [the bog]684-the bog . Then the next morning there was grief and weeping in [Heorot]41-heorot ; but [Beowulf]130-beowulf said to [the king]2079-the king , ' Grieve not , [O king]2617-o king ! till [we]2610-they have found out [[Grendel]132-grendel 's mother]2618-grendel 's mother and punished [her]2618-grendel 's mother for [her]2618-grendel 's mother evil deeds . [I]89-mr. norton promise [you]2079-the king [she]2618-grendel 's mother shall give an account for this . [She]2618-grendel 's mother shall not be able to hide [herself]2618-grendel 's mother in [the water]1757-the water , nor under [the earth]2584-the earth , nor in [the forest]2492-the forest , nor at [the bottom of [the sea]1513-the sea]2622-the bottom of the sea ; let [her]2618-grendel 's mother go where [she]2618-grendel 's mother will , [I]89-mr. norton will find a way after [her]2618-grendel 's mother . '[89-mr. norton]

" So [Beowulf]130-beowulf and [[his]130-beowulf friends]2086-his friends put on [their]2086-his friends armour and mounted [their]2086-his friends horses , and set out to look for [her]2618-grendel 's mother . And when [they]2086-his friends had ridden a long and weary way over [steep lonely paths]2625-steep lonely paths and past caves where dragons and serpents lived , [they]2086-his friends came at last to [[Grendel]132-grendel 's bog]2626-grendel 's bog -- [a fearful place]2627-a fearful place indeed . There in the middle of [it]2626-grendel 's bog lay [a pool of black water]2628-a pool of black water , and over the water hung withered trees , which seemed as if they had been poisoned by the air rising from the water beneath [them]2086-his friends . No bird or beast would ever come near [[Grendel]132-grendel 's pool]2629-grendel 's pool . If the hounds were hunting [a stag]2630-a stag , and [they]2086-his friends drove [him]2630-a stag down to the edge , [he]2630-a stag would sooner let [them]2086-his friends tear [him]2630-a stag to pieces than hide [himself]2630-a stag in [the water]1757-the water . And every night the black water seemed to burn and flame , and it hissed and bubbled and groaned as if there were evil creatures tossing underneath . And now when [Beowulf]130-beowulf and [[his]130-beowulf men]2632-his men came near [it]2629-grendel 's pool , [they]2632-his men saw fierce water dragons lying near the edge or swimming about [the pool]2633-the pool . There also , beside [the water]1757-the water , [they]2632-his men found the dead body of [[Hrothgar]131-hrothgar 's friend]2635-hrothgar 's friend , who had been killed by [[Grendel]132-grendel 's mother]2618-grendel 's mother , and [they]2632-his men took it up , and mourned over [him]2635-hrothgar 's friend afresh .[89-mr. norton]

" But [Beowulf]130-beowulf took an old and splendid sword that [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar had given [him]130-beowulf , and [he]130-beowulf put on [his]130-beowulf golden helmet and [his]130-beowulf iron war shirt that no sword could cut through , and when [he]130-beowulf had bade [[his]130-beowulf friends]2086-his friends farewell [he]130-beowulf leapt straight into [the middle of [the bog]684-the bog]2599-the middle of the bog . Down [he]130-beowulf sank , deeper and deeper into [the water]1757-the water , among strange water beasts that struck at [him]130-beowulf with [their]2086-his friends tusks as [he]130-beowulf passed [them]2086-his friends , till at last [[Grendel]132-grendel 's mother]2618-grendel 's mother , the water - wolf , looked up from the bottom and saw [him]130-beowulf coming . Then [she]2618-grendel 's mother sprang upon [him]130-beowulf , and seized [him]130-beowulf , and dragged [him]130-beowulf down , and [he]130-beowulf found [himself]130-beowulf in a sort of hall under [the water]1757-the water , with a pale strange light in it . And then [he]130-beowulf turned from the horrible water - wolf and raised [his]130-beowulf sword and struck [her]2618-grendel 's mother on the head ; but [his]130-beowulf blow did [her]2618-grendel 's mother no harm . No sword made by [mortal men]2643-mortal men could harm [Grendel]132-grendel or [[his]132-grendel mother]185-his mother ; and as [he]130-beowulf struck [her]2618-grendel 's mother [Beowulf]130-beowulf stumbled and fell . Then [the water - wolf]2645-the water - wolf rushed forward and sat upon [him]130-beowulf as [he]130-beowulf lay there , and raised aloft [her]2645-the water - wolf own sharp dagger to drive it into [his]130-beowulf breast ; but [Beowulf]130-beowulf shook [her]2645-the water - wolf off , and sprang up , and there , on the wall , [he]130-beowulf saw hanging a strange old sword that had been made in the old times , long , long ago , when [the world]260-the world was full of [giants]360-giants . So [he]130-beowulf threw [his]130-beowulf own sword aside and took down the old sword , and once more [he]130-beowulf smote the water - wolf . And this time [his]130-beowulf sword did [him]130-beowulf good service , and [[Grendel]132-grendel 's fierce mother]2648-grendel 's fierce mother sank down dead upon the ground .[89-mr. norton]

" Then [Beowulf]130-beowulf looked round [him]130-beowulf , and [he]130-beowulf saw lying in a corner the body of [Grendel]132-grendel [himself]132-grendel . [He]130-beowulf cut off [the monster]2564-the monster 's head , and lo and behold ! when [he]130-beowulf had cut it off the blade of the old sword melted away , and there was nothing left in [his]130-beowulf hands but the hilt , with strange letters on it , telling how it was made in old days by [the giants]2650-the giants for [a great king]2081-a great king . So with that , and [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar 's sword and [Grendel]132-grendel 's head , [Beowulf]130-beowulf rose up again through [the bog]684-the bog , and just as [[his]130-beowulf brave men]2557-his brave men had begun to think [they]2557-his brave men should never see [[their]2557-his brave men dear lord]2654-their dear lord more [he]130-beowulf came swimming to [land]2655-land , bearing the great head with [him]130-beowulf .[1161-he]

" Then [Hrothgar]131-hrothgar and all [[his]131-hrothgar people]2656-his people rejoiced greatly , for [they]2557-his brave men knew that [the land]840-the land would never more be troubled by [these hateful monsters]2658-these hateful monsters , but that [the ploughers]2659-the ploughers might plough , and [the shepherds]2660-the shepherds might lead [their]2660-the shepherds sheep , and [brave men]2661-brave men might sleep at night , without fear any more of [Grendel]132-grendel and [[his]132-grendel mother]185-his mother . "[1161-he]

" Oh , [father]1498-father ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , breathlessly , when [he]1161-he stopped . " Is that all ? "[83-milly]

But [Olly]63-olly sat quite still , without speaking , gazing at [[his]63-olly father]262-his father with wide open brown eyes , and a face as grave and terrified as if [Grendel]132-grendel were actually beside [him]262-his father .

" That 's all for this time , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " Why , [Olly]63-olly , where are [your]63-olly little wits gone to ? Did it frighten [you]63-olly , [old man]1571-old man ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , drawing a long breath . " [I]63-olly did think [he]132-grendel would never have comed up out of [that bog]2665-that bog ! "[63-olly]

" It was splendid , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " But , [father]1498-father , [I]83-milly do n't understand about [that pool]2667-that pool . Why did n't [Beowulf]130-beowulf get drowned when [he]130-beowulf went down under [the water]1757-the water ? "[83-milly]

" The story does n't tell [us]2669-us anything about that , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " But [heroes]2532-heroes in those days , [Milly]83-milly , must have had something magical about [them]2532-heroes so that [they]2532-heroes were able to do things that [men]2590-men and [women]739-women ca n't do now . Do [you]83-milly know , [children]1510-children , that this story that [you]83-milly have been listening to is more than a thousand years old ? Can [you]83-milly fancy that ? "[89-mr. norton]

" No , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , shaking [her]83-milly head . " [I]83-milly ca n't fancy it a bit , [father]1498-father . It 's too long . It makes [me]83-milly puzzled to think of so many years . "[83-milly]

" Years and years and years and _ years _ ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly . " When [[father]1498-father 's grandfather]2676-father 's grandfather was [a little boy]1768-a little boy . "[63-olly]

[Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton laughed . " Ca n't [you]83-milly think of anything farther back than that , [Olly]63-olly ? It would take a great many [grandfathers]2678-grandfathers , and [[grandfathers]2678-grandfathers ' grandfathers]2680-grandfathers ' grandfathers , to get back to the time when the story of [Beowulf]130-beowulf was made . And here am [I]89-mr. norton telling it to [you]83-milly just in the same way as [fathers]2681-fathers used to tell it to [[their]2681-fathers children]568-their children a thousand years ago . "[89-mr. norton]

" [I]83-milly suppose [the children]198-the children liked it so , [they]198-the children would n't let [[their]198-the children fathers]2684-their fathers forget it , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " And then when [they]2681-fathers grew up [they]2681-fathers told it to [[their]2681-fathers children]568-their children . [I]83-milly shall tell it to [[my]83-milly children]2686-my children when [I]83-milly grow up . [I]83-milly think [I]83-milly shall tell it to [Katie]82-katie to - morrow . "[83-milly]

" [Father]1498-father , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " did [Beowulf]130-beowulf die -- ever ? "[63-olly]

" Yes . When [he]130-beowulf was quite [an old man]2184-an old man [he]130-beowulf had another great fight with a dragon , who was guarding [a cave full of golden treasure on [the sea - shore]2690-the sea - shore]2689-a cave full of golden treasure on the sea - shore ; and though [he]130-beowulf killed the dragon , the dragon gave [him]130-beowulf a terrible wound , so that when [[his]130-beowulf friends]2086-his friends came to look for [him]130-beowulf [they]2086-his friends found [him]130-beowulf lying all but dead in [the cave]2692-the cave . [He]130-beowulf was just able to tell [them]2086-his friends to make [a great mound of earth]2693-a great mound of earth over [him]130-beowulf when [he]130-beowulf was dead , on [a high rock close by]2694-a high rock close by , that [sailors]2695-sailors might see it from [[their]2086-his friends ships]2696-their ships and think of [him]130-beowulf when [they]2086-his friends saw it , and then [he]130-beowulf died . And when [he]130-beowulf was dead [they]2086-his friends carried [him]130-beowulf up to [the rock]2697-the rock , and there [they]2086-his friends burned [his]130-beowulf body , and then [they]2086-his friends built up a great high mound of earth , and [they]2086-his friends put [Beowulf]130-beowulf 's bones inside , and all the treasure from [the dragon 's cave]2698-the dragon 's cave . [They]2086-his friends were ten days building up the mound . Then when it was all done [they]2086-his friends rode around [it]2694-a high rock close by weeping and chanting sorrowful songs , and at last [they]2086-his friends left [him]130-beowulf [there]1539-there , saying as [they]2086-his friends went away that never should [they]2086-his friends see so good [a king]2700-a king or so true [a master]2701-a master any more . And for hundreds of years afterwards , when [the sailors out at]2702-the sailors out at [sea]2703-sea saw [the high mound]2704-the high mound rising on [[its]2704-the high mound point of rock]2705-its point of rock , [they]2086-his friends said one to another , ' There is [[Beowulf]130-beowulf 's Mount]2706-beowulf 's mount , ' and [they]2086-his friends began to tell [each other]2296-each other of [Beowulf]130-beowulf 's brave deeds -- how [he]130-beowulf lived and how [he]130-beowulf died , and how [he]130-beowulf fought with [Grendel]132-grendel and the wild sea dragons . There , now , [I]89-mr. norton have told [you]198-the children all [I]89-mr. norton know about [Beowulf]130-beowulf , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , getting up and turning [the children]198-the children off [his]89-mr. norton knee , " and if it is n't [somebody else]341-somebody else 's turn now it ought to be . "[89-mr. norton]

" [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ! "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , who was so greedy for stories that [he]63-olly could almost listen all day long without being tired .

But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma only smiled through [her]59-aunt emma spectacles and pointed to the window . [The children]198-the children ran to look out , and [they]198-the children could hardly believe [their]198-the children eyes when [they]198-the children saw that it had actually stopped raining , and that over the tree - tops was a narrow strip of blue sky , the first [they]198-the children had seen for three whole days .

" Oh [you]198-the children nice blue sky ! "[83-milly] exclaimed [Milly]83-milly , dancing up and down before the window with a beaming face . " Mind [you]198-the children stay there and get bigger . [We]198-the children 'll get on [our]198-the children hats presently and come out to look at [you]198-the children . Oh ! there 's [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse coming down [the hill]2479-the hill with the dogs . [Mother]62-mother , may [we]198-the children go up [ourselves]198-the children and ask [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza to come to tea ? "[83-milly]

" But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma must tell [us]198-the children [her]59-aunt emma story first , "[63-olly] persisted [Olly]63-olly , who hated being cheated out of a story by anything or [anybody]1612-anybody . " [She]59-aunt emma promised . "[63-olly]

" [[You]198-the children silly boy]2517-you silly boy ! "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " as if [I]59-aunt emma was going to keep [you]2517-you silly boy indoors listening to stories just now , when the sun 's shining for the first time for three whole days . [I]59-aunt emma promised [you]2517-you silly boy [my]59-aunt emma story on a wet day , and [you]2517-you silly boy shall have it -- never fear . There 'll be plenty more wet days before [you]2517-you silly boy go away from [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest , [I]59-aunt emma 'm afraid . There goes [my]59-aunt emma knitting , and [mother]1502-mother 's putting away [her]1502-mother work , and [father]1498-father 's stretching [himself]1498-father -- which means [we]180-the two children 're all going for a walk . "[59-aunt emma]

" To fetch [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza , [mother]1502-mother ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly ; and when [mother]1502-mother said " Yes , if [you]83-milly like , "[1502-mother] [the two children]180-the two children raced off down [the long passage]1168-the long passage to [the nursery]281-the nursery in the highest possible spirits .

Soon [they]180-the two children were all walking along [the dripping drive]1170-the dripping drive past [high banks of wet fern]1171-high banks of wet fern , and under trees which threw down showers of rain - drops at every puff of wind . And when [they]180-the two children got into [the road beside [the river]1681-the river]1172-the road beside the river [the children]198-the children shouted with glee to see [[their]180-the two children brown shallow little river]1175-their brown shallow little river turned into a raging flood of water , which went sweeping and hurrying through [the fields]319-the fields , and every now and then spreading itself over [them]319-the fields and making great pools among the poor drowned hay . [They]198-the children ran on to look for the stepping - stones , but to [their]198-the children amazement there was not a stone to be seen . The water was rushing over [them]198-the children with a great roar and swirl , and [Milly]83-milly shivered a little bit when [she]83-milly remembered [their]198-the children bathe there a week before .

" Well , [old woman]2008-old woman , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , coming up to [them]198-the children , " [I]89-mr. norton do n't suppose [you]2008-old woman 'd like , a bathe to - day -- quite . "[89-mr. norton]

" If [we]198-the children were in [there]1539-there now , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , watching [the river]1681-the river with great excitement , " the water would push [us]198-the children down [krick]26-krick ! and the fishes would come and etten [us]198-the children all up . "[63-olly]

" [They]1180-they 'd be a long time gobbling [you]63-olly up , [Master Fatty]133-master fatty , "[262-his father] said [[his]63-olly father]262-his father . " Come , run along ; it 's too cold to stand about . "[262-his father]

But how brilliant and beautiful it was after the rain ! Little tiny trickling rivers were running down all [the roads]2264-the roads , and sparkling in the sun ; the wet leaves and grass were glittering , and the great mountains all around stood up green and fresh against the blue sky , as if the rain had washed the dust off [them]1180-they from top to toe , and left them clean and bright . Two things only seemed the worse for the rain -- the hay and the wild strawberries . [Milly]83-milly peered into all the banks along [the road]428-the road where [she]83-milly generally found [her]83-milly favourite little red berries , but most of them were washed away , and the few miserable things that were left tasted of nothing but rain water . And as for [the hay - fields]634-the hay - fields , they looked so wet and drenched that it was hard to believe any sunshine could ever dry them .

" Poor [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse ! "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ; " [I]59-aunt emma 'm afraid [his]66-john backhouse hay is a good deal spoilt . Are n't [you]83-milly glad [father]1498-father 's not [a farmer]1786-a farmer , [Milly]83-milly ? "[59-aunt emma]

" Why , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " [I]83-milly 'm always wishing [father]1498-father _ was _ [a farmer]1786-a farmer . [I]83-milly want to be like [Becky]102-becky , and call the cows , and mind [the baby]1719-the baby all by [myself]83-milly . It must be nice feeding the chickens , and making the hay , and taking the milk around . "[83-milly]

" Yes , all that 's very nice , but how would [you]83-milly like [your]83-milly hay washed away , and [your]83-milly corn beaten down , and [your]83-milly fruit all spoilt ? Those are things that are constantly happening to [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse , [I]59-aunt emma expect , in [the rainy country]2721-the rainy country . "[59-aunt emma]

" Yes , and it wo n't always be summer , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , considering . " [I]83-milly do n't think [I]83-milly should like to stay in [that little weeny house]2722-that little weeny house all the winter . Is it very cold here in the winter , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[83-milly]

" Not very , generally . But last winter was very cold here , and the snow lay on the ground for weeks and weeks . On Christmas eve , do [you]83-milly know , [Milly]83-milly , [I]59-aunt emma wanted to have a [children]1510-children 's party in [[my]59-aunt emma kitchen]2724-my kitchen , and what do [you]83-milly think [I]59-aunt emma did ? The snow was lying deep on [the roads]2264-the roads , so [I]59-aunt emma sent out two sledges . "[59-aunt emma]

" What are sledges ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly .

" [Carriages with the wheels]2726-carriages with the wheels taken off and two long pieces of wood fastened on instead , so that they slip along smoothly over the snow . And [[my]59-aunt emma old coachman]2301-my old coachman drove [one]518-one and [[my]59-aunt emma gardener]2729-my gardener the other , and [they]2730-they went round all [the farmhouses near by]2731-the farmhouses near by , and gathered up [the children , little and big]2732-the children , little and big , into the sledges , till [the coachman]2733-the coachman had got eight in [his]2733-the coachman sledge , and [the gardener]1554-the gardener had got nine in [his]1554-the gardener , and then [they]2730-they came trotting back with the bells round the horses ' necks jingling and clattering , and [two such merry loads of rosy - faced children]2735-two such merry loads of rosy - faced children . [I]59-aunt emma wish [you]2736-you had been [there]1539-there ; [I]59-aunt emma gave [them]2732-the children , little and big tea in [the kitchen]1569-the kitchen , and afterward [we]2739-we had a Christmas tree in [the drawing - room]182-the drawing - room . "[59-aunt emma]

" Oh what fun , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " Why did n't [you]2736-you ask [us]2739-we too , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? [We]2739-we could have come quite well in [the train]1540-the train , [you]2736-you know . But how did [the children]198-the children get [home]382-home ? "[83-milly]

" [We]2739-we covered [them]198-the children up warm with rugs and blankets , and sent [them]198-the children back in the sledges . And [they]198-the children looked so happy with [their]198-the children toys and buns cuddled up in [their]198-the children arms , that it did [one]518-one 's heart good to see [them]198-the children . "[59-aunt emma]

" Mind [you]2736-you ask [us]2739-we next time , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , hanging round [her]83-milly neck coaxingly .

" Mind [you]2736-you get two pairs of wings by that time , then , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " for [mother]1502-mother 's not likely to let [you]2736-you come to [[my]59-aunt emma Christmas tree]2746-my christmas tree unless [you]2736-you promise to fly there and back . But suppose , instead of [your]2736-you coming to [me]59-aunt emma , [I]59-aunt emma come to [you]2736-you next Christmas ? "[59-aunt emma]

" Oh yes ! yes ! "[63-olly] cried [Olly]63-olly , who had just joined [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [Milly]83-milly , " come to [our]2739-we Christmas tree , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma . [We]2739-we 'll give [you]2736-you ever such nice things -- a ball and a top , and [a train]2747-a train -- perhaps -- and-- "[63-olly]

" As if [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma would care for those kind of things ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " No , [you]2736-you shall give [her]59-aunt emma some muffetees , [you]2736-you know , to keep [her]59-aunt emma hands warm , and [I]83-milly 'll make [her]59-aunt emma a needlebook . But , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , do listen ! What can be the matter ? "[83-milly]

[They]1183-they were just climbing [the little bit of steep road which led to [the farm]1556-the farm]1184-the little bit of steep road which led to the farm , and suddenly [they]1183-they heard [somebody roaring and screaming , and then an angry voice scolding , and then a great clatter , and then louder roaring than ever]1186-somebody roaring and screaming , and then an angry voice scolding , and then a great clatter , and then louder roaring than ever .

" What _ is _ the matter ? "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , running on to the farm door , which was open . But just as [she]83-milly got there , out rushed a tattered little figure with a tear - stained face , and hair flying behind .

" [Tiza]103-tiza ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , trying to stop [her]1187-her . But [Tiza]103-tiza ran past [her]1187-her as quick as lightning down [the garden path]1188-the garden path towards the cherry tree , and in another minute , in spite of the shower of wet [she]1187-her shook down on [herself]1187-her as [she]1187-her climbed up , [she]1187-her was sitting high and safe among the branches , where there was no catching [her]1187-her nor even seeing [her]1187-her .

" Ay , that 's the best place for [ye]1187-her , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , appearing at the door with an angry face , " [you]1187-her 'll not get into so much mischief there perhaps as [you]1187-her will indoors . Oh , is that [you]1187-her , [Miss Elliot]134-miss elliot ( that was [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's surname ) ? Walk in please , [ma'am]1738-ma'am , though [you]1738-ma'am 'll find [me]101-mrs. backhouse sadly untidy this afternoon . [Tiza]103-tiza 's been at [her]103-tiza tricks again ; [she]103-tiza keeps [me]101-mrs. backhouse sweeping up after [her]103-tiza all day . Just look here , if [you]1738-ma'am please , [ma'am]1738-ma'am . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma went in , and [the children]198-the children pressed in after [her]59-aunt emma , full of curiosity to see what crime [Tiza]103-tiza had been committing . [Poor Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse ! all over [[her]101-mrs. backhouse clean [kitchen]1191-kitchen floor]1190-her clean kitchen floor there were streams of water running about , with little pieces of cabbage and carrot sticking up in them here and there , while on the kitchen table lay a heap of meat and vegetables , which [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse had evidently just picked up out of the grate before [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [the children]198-the children arrived .

" Yes , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , pointing to the floor , " there 's the supper just spoilt . [Tiza]103-tiza 's never easy but when [she]103-tiza 's in mischief . [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm sure these wet days [I]101-mrs. backhouse have'nt known what to do with [her]103-tiza indoors all day . And what must [she]103-tiza do this afternoon but tie [her]103-tiza tin mug to the cat 's tail , till [the poor creature]2750-the poor creature was nearly beside [herself]103-tiza with fright , and went rushing about [upstairs]435-upstairs like [a mad thing]2752-a mad thing . And then , just when [I]101-mrs. backhouse happened to be out a minute looking after something , [she]103-tiza lets the cat in here , and [the poor thing]2753-the poor thing jumps into the saucepan [I]101-mrs. backhouse had just put on with the broth for [our]2754-our supper , and in [her]103-tiza fright and all turns it right over . And now look at [[my]101-mrs. backhouse grate]2755-my grate , and the fender , and the floor , and the meat there all messed ! [I]101-mrs. backhouse expect [[her]103-tiza father'll]2756-her father'll give [Tiza]103-tiza a good beating when [he]2756-her father'll comes in , and [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm sure [I]101-mrs. backhouse sha n't stand in the way . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

" Oh no , please , [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , running up to [her]1193-her with a grave imploring little face . " Do n't let [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse beat [her]103-tiza ; [she]103-tiza did n't mean it , [she]103-tiza was only in fun , [I]83-milly 'm sure . "[83-milly]

" Well , [missy]1743-missy , it 's very troiblesome fun [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm sure , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , patting [Milly]83-milly kindly on the shoulder , for [she]101-mrs. backhouse was [a good - natured woman]1194-a good - natured woman , and it was n't [her]101-mrs. backhouse way to be angry long . " [I]101-mrs. backhouse do n't know what [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm to give [John]66-john backhouse for [his]66-john backhouse supper , that [I]101-mrs. backhouse do n't . [I]101-mrs. backhouse had nothing in [the house]265-the house but just those little odds and ends of meat , that [I]101-mrs. backhouse thought would make a nice bit of broth for supper . And now [he]66-john backhouse 'll come in wet and hungry , and there 'll be nothing for [him]66-john backhouse . Well , [we]2759-we must do with something else , [I]101-mrs. backhouse suppose , but [I]101-mrs. backhouse expect [her]59-aunt emma father'll beat [her]59-aunt emma . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

[Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly looked rather awestruck at the idea of a beating from [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse , [that great strong brawny farmer]1195-that great strong brawny farmer ; and [Milly]83-milly , whispering something quickly to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , slipped out into [the garden]219-the garden again . By this time [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother had come up , and [Becky]102-becky appeared from [the farmyard]1199-the farmyard , wheeling [the baby]1719-the baby in a little wooden cart , and radiant with pleasure at the sight of [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , whose godchild [she]59-aunt emma was , so that [Milly]83-milly 's disappearance was not noticed .

[She]59-aunt emma ran down [the garden path]1188-the garden path to the cherry tree , and as , in the various times [they]1202-they had been together , [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza had taught [her]59-aunt emma a good deal of climbing , [she]59-aunt emma too clambered up into the wet branches , and was soon sitting close by [Tiza]103-tiza , who had turned [her]103-tiza cotton pinafore over [her]103-tiza head and would n't look at [Milly]83-milly .

" [Tiza]103-tiza , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly softly , putting [her]83-milly hand on [Tiza]103-tiza 's lap , " do [you]103-tiza feel very bad ? "[83-milly]

No answer .

" [We]1202-they came to take [you]103-tiza down to have tea with [us]1202-they , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " do [you]103-tiza think [[your]103-tiza mother]1713-your mother will let [you]103-tiza come ? "[83-milly]

" Naw , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza shortly , without moving from behind [her]103-tiza pinafore .

It certainly was n't very easy talking to [Tiza]103-tiza . [Milly]83-milly thought [she]83-milly 'd better try something else .

" [Tiza]103-tiza , "[83-milly] [she]83-milly began timidly , " do [[your]103-tiza father]2761-your father and [mother]1502-mother tell [you]103-tiza stories when it rains ? "[83-milly]

" Naw , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza , in a very astonished voice , throwing down [her]103-tiza pinafore to stare at [Milly]83-milly .

" Then what do [you]103-tiza do , [Tiza]103-tiza , when it rains ? "[83-milly]

" Nothing , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza . " [We]2763-we has [our]2763-we dinners and tea , and sometimes [Becky]102-becky minds [the baby]1719-the baby and sometimes [I]103-tiza do , and [father]1498-father mostly goes to sleep . "[103-tiza]

" [Tiza]103-tiza , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly hurriedly , " did [you]103-tiza _ mean _ pussy to jump into the saucepan ? "[83-milly]

Up went [[Tiza]103-tiza 's pinafore]1203-tiza 's pinafore again , and [Milly]83-milly was in dismay because [she]83-milly thought [she]83-milly had made [Tiza]103-tiza cry ; but to [her]83-milly great surprise [Tiza]103-tiza suddenly burst into such fits of laughter , that [she]103-tiza nearly tumbled off the cherry tree . " Oh , [she]103-tiza did jump so , and the mug made such a rattling ! And when [she]103-tiza comed out there was just a little bit of carrot sticking to [her]103-tiza nose , and [her]103-tiza tail was all over cabbage leaf . Oh , [she]103-tiza did look funny ! "[103-tiza]

[Milly]83-milly could n't help laughing too , till [she]83-milly remembered all that [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse had been saying .

" Oh , but , [Tiza]103-tiza , [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse says [[your]103-tiza father]2761-your father wo n't have anything for [his]2761-your father supper . Are n't [you]103-tiza sorry [you]103-tiza spoilt [his]2761-your father supper ? "[101-mrs. backhouse]

" [Yis]98-yis , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza , quickly . " [I]103-tiza know [father'll]136-father'll beat [me]103-tiza , [he]2761-your father said [he]2761-your father would next time [I]103-tiza vexed [mother]1502-mother . "[103-tiza]

And this time the pinafore went up in earnest , and [Tiza]103-tiza began to cry piteously .

" Do n't cry , [Tiza]103-tiza , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , [her]83-milly own little cheeks getting wet , too . " [I]83-milly 'll beg [him]2761-your father not . Ca n't [you]103-tiza make up anyway ? [Mother]1502-mother says [we]2769-we must always make up if [we]2769-we can when [we]2769-we 've done any harm . [I]83-milly wish [I]83-milly had anything to give [you]103-tiza to make up . "[83-milly]

[Tiza]103-tiza suddenly dried [her]103-tiza eyes and looked at [Milly]83-milly , with a bright expression which was very puzzling .

" [You]83-milly come with [me]103-tiza , "[103-tiza] [she]103-tiza said suddenly , swinging [herself]103-tiza down from the tree . " Come here by the hedge , do n't let [mother]1502-mother see [us]1204-they . "[103-tiza]

So [they]1204-they ran along the far side of the hedge till [they]1204-they got into [the farmyard]1199-the farmyard , and then [Tiza]103-tiza led [Milly]83-milly past [the hen - house]1206-the hen - house , up to the corner where the hayricks were . In and out of [the hayricks]1207-the hayricks [they]1204-they went , till in the very farthest corner of all , where hardly [anybody]1612-anybody ever came , and which [nobody]280-nobody could see into from [the yard]530-the yard , [Tiza]103-tiza suddenly knelt down and put [her]103-tiza hand under the hay at the bottom of the rick .

" [You]83-milly come , "[103-tiza] [she]103-tiza whispered eagerly to [Milly]83-milly , pulling [her]83-milly by the skirt , " [you]83-milly come and look here . "[103-tiza]

[Milly]83-milly stooped down , and there in a soft little place , just between the hayrick and the ground , what do [you]1211-you think [she]103-tiza saw ? Three large brownish eggs lying in a sort of rough nest in the hay , and looking so round and fresh and tempting , that [Milly]83-milly gave a little cry of delight .

" Oh , [Tiza]103-tiza , how be -- utiful ! How did [they]2771-they get [there]1539-there ? "[83-milly]

" It 's [old Sally]119-sally , [[our]2773-our white hen [you]1211-you know]2774-our white hen you know , laid them . [I]103-tiza found them just after dinner . [Mother]62-mother does n't know nothing about [them]2771-they . [I]103-tiza never told [Becky]102-becky , nor [nobody]280-nobody . Are n't they beauties ? "[103-tiza]

And [Tiza]103-tiza took one up lovingly in [her]103-tiza rough , little brown hands , and laid it against [her]103-tiza cheek , to feel how soft and satiny it was .

" Oh , and [Tiza]103-tiza , [I]83-milly know , "[83-milly] exclaimed [Milly]83-milly eagerly , " [you]103-tiza meant these would do for supper . That would be a lovely make up . There 's three . One for [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse , one for [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , and one for [Becky.--There]137-becky.--there 's none for [you]103-tiza , [Tiza]103-tiza . "[83-milly]

" Nor none for [Becky]102-becky neither , "[103-tiza] answered [Tiza]103-tiza shortly . " [Father'll]136-father'll want two . [Becky]102-becky and [me'll]2776-me'll get bread and dripping . "[103-tiza]

" Well , come along , [Tiza]103-tiza , let 's take [them]2777-them in . "[83-milly]

" No , [you]103-tiza take [them]2777-them , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza . " [Mother]1502-mother wo n't want to see [me]103-tiza no more , and [father'll]2779-father'll perhaps be coming in . "[103-tiza]

" Oh , but , [Tiza]103-tiza , [you]103-tiza 'll come to tea with [us]2780-us ? "[83-milly]

" [I]103-tiza do n't know , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza . " [You]103-tiza ask . "[103-tiza]

And off [she]103-tiza ran as quick as lightning , off to [her]103-tiza hiding - place in the cherry tree , while [Milly]83-milly was left with the three brown eggs , feeling rather puzzled and anxious . However , [she]103-tiza put them gently in the skirt of [her]103-tiza frock , and holding it up in both hands [she]103-tiza picked [her]103-tiza way through [the wet yard]1212-the wet yard back to [the house]265-the house .

When [she]103-tiza appeared at the kitchen door , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse were chatting quietly . [Mr.]1214-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , and [Olly]63-olly , had gone on for a little stroll along [the Wanwick road]1215-the wanwick road , and [Becky]102-becky was sitting on the window - sill with [the baby , who seemed very sleepy , but quite determined not to go to sleep]1216-the baby , who seemed very sleepy , but quite determined not to go to sleep in spite of all [Becky]102-becky 's rocking and patting .

" Oh , [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , "[83-milly] began [Milly]83-milly , coming in with a bright flushed face , " just look here , what [I]83-milly 've brought . [Tiza]103-tiza found them just after dinner to - day . [They]2781-they were under the hayrick right away in the corner , and [she]103-tiza wanted to make up , so [she]103-tiza showed [me]83-milly where they were , so [I]83-milly brought them in , and there 's two for [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse , and one for [you]101-mrs. backhouse , [you]101-mrs. backhouse know . And , please , wo n't [you]101-mrs. backhouse let [Tiza]103-tiza come to tea with [us]2782-us ? "[83-milly]

[Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse looked in astonishment at the three eggs lying in [Milly]83-milly 's print skirt , and at [Milly]83-milly 's pleading little face .

" Ay , that 's [Sally]119-sally , [I]101-mrs. backhouse suppose . [She]119-sally 's always hiding [her]119-sally eggs is [Sally]119-sally , where [I]101-mrs. backhouse ca n't find them . So it was [Tiza]103-tiza found them , was it , [Missy]138-missy ? Well , they will come , in very handy for supper as it happens . Thank [you]101-mrs. backhouse kindly for bringing [them]2783-them in . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

And [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse took the eggs and put them safely away in a pie - dish , while [Becky]102-becky secretly pulled [Milly]83-milly by the sleeve , and smiled up at [her]83-milly as much as to say ,

" Thank [you]101-mrs. backhouse for helping [Tiza]103-tiza out of [her]103-tiza scrape . "[102-becky]

" And [you]101-mrs. backhouse 'll let [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza come to tea ? "[83-milly] asked [Milly]83-milly again .

" Well , [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'm sure , [Miss]2784-miss , [I]101-mrs. backhouse do n't know , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , looking puzzled ; " [Becky]102-becky may come and welcome , but perhaps it would do [Tiza]103-tiza good to stay at [home]382-home . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

" Do n't [you]101-mrs. backhouse think [she]103-tiza 'd better have a little change ? "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma in [her]59-aunt emma kind voice , which made [Milly]83-milly want to hug [her]59-aunt emma . " [I]59-aunt emma daresay staying [indoors]1074-indoors so long made [her]103-tiza restless . If [you]101-mrs. backhouse will let [me]59-aunt emma carry [them]2787-them both off , [I]59-aunt emma daresay between [us]2788-us , [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , [we]2788-us can give [Tiza]103-tiza a talking to , and perhaps [she]103-tiza 'll come back in a more sensible mood . "[59-aunt emma]

" Well , [Miss Elliot]134-miss elliot , [she]103-tiza shall go if [you]101-mrs. backhouse wish it . Come [Becky]102-becky , give [me]101-mrs. backhouse [the baby]1719-the baby , and go and put [your]101-mrs. backhouse things on . "[101-mrs. backhouse] And then going to the door , [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse shouted " [Tiza]103-tiza ! "[101-mrs. backhouse] After a second or two [a little figure]1217-a little figure dropped down out of the cherry tree and came slowly up [the walk]1218-the walk . [Tiza]103-tiza had shaken [her]103-tiza hair about [her]103-tiza face so that it could hardly be seen , and [she]103-tiza never looked once at [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma and [Milly]83-milly as [she]103-tiza came up to [[her]103-tiza mother]187-her mother .

" There , go along , [Tiza]103-tiza , and get [your]103-tiza things on , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , taking [her]103-tiza by the arm . " [I]101-mrs. backhouse would n't have let [you]103-tiza go out to tea , [you]103-tiza know , if [Miss Elliot]134-miss elliot and [Missy]138-missy had n't asked particular . Mind [you]103-tiza do n't get into no more mischief . And very like those eggs'll do for [father]1498-father 's supper ; so , [I]101-mrs. backhouse daresay , [I]101-mrs. backhouse 'll not say anything to [him]1498-father this time -- just for once . Now go up . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

[Tiza]103-tiza did n't want to be told twice , and presently , just as [Mr.]1220-mr. and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton and [Olly]63-olly were coming back from [their]1221-their walk , [they]1221-their met [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma coming back from [the farm]1556-the farm holding [Becky]102-becky 's hand , while [Milly]83-milly and [Tiza]103-tiza walked in front .

" Well , [Tiza]103-tiza , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , patting [her]103-tiza curly head , [I]0-i declare [I]0-i think [you]103-tiza beat [Olly]63-olly for mischief . [Olly]63-olly never spoilt [my]0-i dinner yet , that [I]0-i remember . What should [I]0-i do to [him]63-olly do [you]103-tiza think , if [he]63-olly did ? "[103-tiza]

" Beat [him]63-olly , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza , looking up at [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton with [her]103-tiza quick birdlike eyes .

" Oh dear , no ! "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " that would n't do [my]89-mr. norton dinner any good . [I]89-mr. norton should eat [him]63-olly up instead . "[89-mr. norton]

" [I]63-olly do n't believe [little boys]1617-little boys taste good a bit , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who always believed firmly in [[his]63-olly father]262-his father 's various threats . " If [you]89-mr. norton ettened [me]63-olly , [father]1498-father , [you]89-mr. norton 'd be ill . "[63-olly]

" Oh no , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " not if [I]89-mr. norton eat [you]63-olly with plenty of bread - sauce . That 's the best way to cook [little boys]1617-little boys . Now , [Milly]83-milly , which of [[you]1224-the three little girls three girls]2794-you three girls can get to that gate first ? "[89-mr. norton]

[Off]118-off ran [the three little girls]1224-the three little girls full tilt down [the hill leading to [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]1225-the hill leading to ravensnest , with [Olly]63-olly puffing and panting after [them]1224-the three little girls . [Milly]83-milly led the way at first , for [she]83-milly was light and quick , and a very fair runner for [her]83-milly age ; but [Tiza]103-tiza soon got up to [her]83-milly and passed [her]83-milly , and it was [Tiza]103-tiza 's little stout legs that arrived first at [Ravensnest gate]43-ravensnest gate .

" Oh , [Becky]102-becky ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , putting [her]83-milly arm round [Becky]102-becky 's neck as [they]1226-we went into [the house]265-the house together , " [I]83-milly hope [you]102-becky may stay a good long time . What time do [you]102-becky go to bed ? "[83-milly]

" Oh , [I]102-becky do n't know , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky . " [We]1226-we go when fayther goes . "[102-becky]

" When fayther goes ! "[83-milly] exclaimed [Milly]83-milly . " Why , [we]1226-we go ever so long before [father]1498-father . Why do [you]102-becky stay up so late ? "[83-milly]

" Why , it is n't late , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky . " [Fayther]104-fayther goes to bed , now it 's summertime , about half - past eight ; but in winter , of course , [he]104-fayther goes earlier . And [we]1226-we all goes together , except [baby]1772-baby . [Mother]1502-mother puts [him]104-fayther out of the way before supper . "[102-becky]

" Well , but how funny , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " [I]83-milly ca n't think why [you]102-becky should be so different from [us]1226-we . "[83-milly]

And [Milly]83-milly went on puzzling over [Becky]102-becky and [her]102-becky going to bed , till [nurse]1496-nurse drove it all out of [her]1496-nurse head by fetching [them]1229-they to tea . Such a merry tea [they]1229-they had , and after tea a romp in [the big kitchen]1003-the big kitchen with [father]1498-father , which delighted [the little farm children]1232-the little farm children beyond measure . Some time in the evening , [I]0-i believe , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma managed to give [Tiza]103-tiza a little talking to , but [none of [the other children]1234-the other children]1233-none of the other children knew anything about it , except perhaps [Becky]102-becky , who generally knew what was happening to [Tiza]103-tiza .

CHAPTER IX

[MILLY]83-milly 'S BIRTHDAY

Now [we]1235-we have come to a chapter which is going to be half merry and half sad . [I]0-i have not told [you]1236-you any sad things about [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly up till now , [I]0-i think . [They]1229-they were [such happy little people]1237-such happy little people , that there was nothing sad to tell [you]1236-you . [They]1229-they cried sometimes , of course -- [you]1236-you remember [Milly]83-milly cried when [Olly]63-olly stickied [her]83-milly doll -- but generally , by the time [they]1229-they had dried up [their]1229-they tears [they]1229-they had quite forgotten what [they]1229-they were crying about ; and as for any real trouble , why [they]1229-they did n't know what it could possibly be like . But now , just as [they]1229-they were going away from [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest , came a real sad thing , and [you]1236-you 'll hear very soon how it happened .

After those three wet days it was sometimes fine and sometimes rainy at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest , but never so rainy as to keep [the Nortons]105-the nortons in all day . And every now and then there were splendid days , when [the children]198-the children and [[their]198-the children father]212-their father and [mother]1502-mother were out all day long , wandering over [the mountains]1534-the mountains , or walking over to [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's or tramping along the well - known roads to [Wanwick]23-wanwick on one side , and [the little village of Rydal]1242-the little village of rydal and [Rydal Lake]45-rydal lake on the other . [They]1229-they had another row on [Windermere]18-windermere ; and one fine evening [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton borrowed [[a friend]1243-a friend 's boat]1244-a friend 's boat , and [they]1229-they went out fishing for perch on [Rydal Lake]45-rydal lake , [the loveliest little lake in [the world]260-the world , lying softly in [a green mountain cup]1247-a green mountain cup , and dotted with islands , which seemed to [the children]198-the children when [they]198-the children landed on [them]198-the children like little bits of fairyland dropped into the blue water]1245-the loveliest little lake in the world , lying softly in a green mountain cup , and dotted with islands , which seemed to the children when they landed on them like little bits of fairyland dropped into the blue water .

[ Illustration : " Haymaking "[103-tiza] ]

And then ! crown of delights ! came the haymaking . There were long fine days , when [the six small creatures]1249-the six small creatures -- [Milly]83-milly , [Olly]63-olly , [Becky]102-becky , [Tiza]103-tiza , [Bessie]97-bessie , and [Charlie]96-charlie -- followed [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse and [[his]66-john backhouse men]2632-his men about in [the hayfields]1251-the hayfields from early morning till evening , helping to make the hay , or simply rolling about like a parcel of kittens in [the flowery fragrant heaps]1252-the flowery fragrant heaps .

[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma was often at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest , and [the children]198-the children learned to love [her]59-aunt emma better and better , so that even wild little [Olly]63-olly would remember to bring [her]59-aunt emma stool , and carry [her]59-aunt emma shawl , and change [her]59-aunt emma plate at dinner ; and [Milly]83-milly , who was always clinging to [somebody]545-somebody , was constantly puzzled to know whose pocket to sit in , [mother]1502-mother 's or [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's .

Then there was [the farmyard]1199-the farmyard , the cows , and the milking , and the chickens . Everything about [them]1257-them seemed delightful to [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly , and the top of everything was reached when one evening [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse mounted both [the children]198-the children on [[his]66-john backhouse big carthorse Dobbin]1259-his big carthorse dobbin , and [they]198-the children and [Dobbin]139-dobbin together dragged the hay [home]382-home in triumph .

And now [they]198-the children had only one week more to stay at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest . But that week was a most important week , for it was to contain no less a day than [Milly]83-milly 's birthday . [Milly]83-milly would be seven years old on the 15th of July , and for about a week before the 15th , [Milly]83-milly 's little head could think of nothing else . [Olly]63-olly too was very much excited about it , for though [Milly]83-milly of course was [the queen of the day]1261-the queen of the day , and all the presents were for [her]83-milly , not for [him]66-john backhouse , still it was good times for [everybody]1611-everybody on [Milly]83-milly 's birthday ; besides which , [he]66-john backhouse had [his]66-john backhouse own little secret with [mother]1502-mother about [his]66-john backhouse present to [Milly]83-milly , a secret which made [him]66-john backhouse very happy , but which [he]66-john backhouse was on the point of telling at least a hundred times a day .

" [Father]85-father , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , about four days before the birthday , when [they]1264-they were all wandering about after tea one evening in [the high garden]1265-the high garden which was now [a paradise of ripe red strawberries and fruit of every kind]1266-a paradise of ripe red strawberries and fruit of every kind , " does [everybody]1611-everybody have birthdays ? Do [policemen]2799-policemen have birthdays ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" [I]89-mr. norton expect so , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , laughing , " but [they]2799-policemen have n't any time to remember them . "[89-mr. norton]

" But , [father]1498-father , what 's the good of having birthdays if [you]1498-father do n't keep them , and have presents and all that ? And do cats and dogs have birthdays ? [I]70-mrs. norton should like to find out [Spot]77-spot 's birthday . [We]1264-they 'd give [her]77-spot cream instead of milk , [you]1498-father know , and [I]70-mrs. norton 'd tie a blue ribbon round [her]77-spot neck , and one round [her]77-spot tail like [the queen]2385-the queen 's sheep in [mother]1502-mother 's story . "[70-mrs. norton]

" [I]89-mr. norton do n't suppose [Spot]77-spot would thank [you]1498-father at all , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton . " The cream would make [her]77-spot ill , and the ribbon would fidget [her]77-spot dreadfully till [she]77-spot pulled it off . "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh dear ! "[83-milly] sighed [Milly]83-milly . " Well , [I]83-milly suppose [Spot]77-spot had better not have any birthday then . But , [father]1498-father , what do [you]1498-father think ? [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza do n't care about [their]2804-them birthdays a bit . [Becky]102-becky could hardly remember when [hers]102-becky was , and [they]2804-them never have any presents unless [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma gives [them]2804-them one , or [people]1598-people to tea , or anything . '[83-milly]

" Well , [you]1498-father see , [Milly]83-milly , when [people]1598-people have only just pennies and shillings enough to buy bread and meat to eat , and clothes to put on , [they]1598-people ca n't go spending money on presents ; and when [they]1598-people 're very anxious and busy all the year round [they]1598-people ca n't be remembering birthdays and taking pains about [them]2804-them like [richer people]2807-richer people can , who have less to trouble [them]2807-richer people , and whose work does not take up quite so much time . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Well , but why do n't [the rich people]2808-the rich people remember [the poor people]2809-the poor people 's birthdays for [them]2808-the rich people , [father]1498-father ? Then [they]2808-the rich people could give [them]2808-the rich people presents , and ask [them]2808-the rich people to tea and all , [you]1498-father know . "[83-milly]

" Yes , that would be a very good arrangement , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , smiling at [her]1267-her eager little face . " Only , somehow , [Milly]83-milly , things do n't come right like that in [this world]2811-this world . "[89-mr. norton]

" Well , [I]83-milly 'm going to try and remember [Becky]102-becky 's and [Tiza]103-tiza 's birthdays , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly . " [I]83-milly 'll tell [mother]1502-mother to put them down in [her]1502-mother pocket - book -- won't [you]1502-mother , [mother]1502-mother ? Oh , what fun ! [I]83-milly 'll send [them]2808-the rich people birthday cards , and [they]2808-the rich people 'll be so surprised , and wonder why ; and then [they]2808-the rich people 'll say , ' Oh , why , of course it 's [our]2814-our birthday!'--No , not _ [our]2814-our _ birthday -- but [you]1502-mother know what [I]83-milly mean , [father]1498-father . "[83-milly]

" Well , but , [Milly]83-milly , "[70-mrs. norton] asked [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " have [you]83-milly made up [your]83-milly mind what [you]83-milly want to do this birthday ? "[70-mrs. norton]

[Milly]83-milly stopped suddenly , with [her]83-milly hands behind [her]83-milly , opposite [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother , with [her]83-milly lips tightly pressed together , [her]83-milly eyes smiling , as if there was a tremendous secret hidden somewhere .

" Well , [monkey]2816-monkey , out with it . What have [you]83-milly got hidden away in [your]83-milly little head ? "[83-milly]

" Well , [mother]1502-mother , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , slowly , " [I]83-milly do n't want to _ have _ [anybody]1612-anybody to tea . [I]83-milly want to go out to tea with [somebody]545-somebody . Now can [you]1502-mother guess ? "[83-milly]

" With [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma ? "[83-milly]

" Oh no , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's coming over [here]1560-here all day . [She]59-aunt emma promised [she]59-aunt emma would . "[83-milly]

" With [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza ? "[83-milly]

[Milly]83-milly nodded , and screwed up [her]83-milly little lips tighter than ever .

" But [I]83-milly do n't expect [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse will want the trouble of having [[you]2821-you two]2822-you two to tea .[83-milly]

" Oh [mother]1502-mother , [she]101-mrs. backhouse wo n't mind a bit . [I]83-milly know [she]101-mrs. backhouse wo n't ; because [Becky]102-becky told [me]83-milly one day [[her]102-becky mother]187-her mother would like [us]2822-you two very much to come some time if [you]1502-mother 'd let [us]2822-you two . And [Nana]79-nana could come and help [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , and [we]2822-you two could all wash up the tea - things afterwards , like [we]2822-you two did at the picnic . "[83-milly]

" Then [Tiza]103-tiza must n't sit next [me]63-olly , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who had been listening in silence to all the arrangements . " [She]103-tiza takes away [my]63-olly bread and butter when [I]63-olly 'm not looking , and [I]63-olly do n't like it , not a bit . "[63-olly]

" No , [[Olly]63-olly dear]2825-olly dear , [she]103-tiza sha n't , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , taking [his]63-olly hand and fondling it , as if [she]83-milly were at least twenty years older . " [I]83-milly 'll sit on one side of [you]63-olly and [Becky]102-becky on the other , "[83-milly] a prospect with which [Olly]63-olly was apparently satisfied , for [he]63-olly made no more objections .

" Well , [you]63-olly must ask [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse [yourselves]63-olly , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton . " And if it is [her]101-mrs. backhouse washing - day , or inconvenient to [her]101-mrs. backhouse at all , [you]63-olly must n't think of going , [you]63-olly know . "[70-mrs. norton]

So early next morning , [Milly]83-milly and [Nana]79-nana and [Olly]63-olly went up to [the farm]1556-the farm , and came back with the answer that [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse would be very pleased to see [them]1270-they at tea on Thursday , the 15th , and that [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse would have cut [the hay - field]1271-the hay - field by [the river]1681-the river by then , and [they]1270-they could have a romp in the hay afterwards .

Wednesday was a deeply interesting day to [Olly]63-olly . [He]63-olly and [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother went over by [themselves]1270-they to [Wanwick]23-wanwick , and [they]1270-they bought something which [the shopwoman at [the toy - shop]1275-the toy - shop]1274-the shopwoman at the toy - shop wrapped up in a neat little parcel , and which [Olly]63-olly carried [home]382-home , looking as important as [a little king]1277-a little king .

" [Milly]83-milly , "[63-olly] [he]63-olly began at dinner , " _ would n't _ [you]83-milly like to know about [your]83-milly presents ? But of course [I]63-olly sha n't tell [you]83-milly about [mine]63-olly . Perhaps [I]63-olly 'm not going to give [you]83-milly one at all . Oh , [mother]1502-mother , "[63-olly] in a loud whisper to [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " did [you]70-mrs. norton put it away safe where [she]1502-mother ca n't see ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh , [[you]83-milly silly boy]2517-you silly boy , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " [you]83-milly 'll tell [me]83-milly if [you]83-milly do n't take care . "[83-milly]

" No , [I]70-mrs. norton sha n't . [I]70-mrs. norton would n't tell [you]83-milly if [you]83-milly were to go on asking [me]70-mrs. norton all day . It is n't very big , [you]83-milly know , [Milly]83-milly , and -- and -- it is n't pretty outside -- only-- "[70-mrs. norton]

" Be quiet , [chatterbox]2828-chatterbox , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton putting [his]89-mr. norton hand over [Olly]63-olly 's mouth , " [you]2828-chatterbox 'll tell in another minute , and then there 'll be no fun to - morrow . "[89-mr. norton]

So [Olly]63-olly with great difficulty kept quiet , and began eating up [his]63-olly pudding very fast , as if that was the only way of keeping [his]63-olly little tongue out of mischief .

" [Father]85-father , "[63-olly] [he]63-olly said after dinner , " do take [Milly]83-milly out for a walk , and [mother]1502-mother shall take [me]63-olly . Then [I]63-olly ca n't tell , [you]85-father know . "[63-olly]

So [the two]2591-the two went out different ways , and [Olly]63-olly kept away from [Milly]83-milly all day , in great fear lest somehow or other [his]63-olly secret should fly out of [him]63-olly in spite of all [his]63-olly efforts to keep it in . At night [the children]198-the children made [nurse]1496-nurse hurry [them]198-the children to bed , so that when [mother]1502-mother came to tuck [them]198-the children up , as [she]1502-mother generally did , [she]1502-mother found [the pair]1282-the pair fast asleep , and nothing left to kiss but two curly heads buried in the pillows .

" Bless [their]198-the children hearts , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse to [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , " [they]198-the children can think of nothing but to - morrow . [They]198-the children 'll be sadly disappointed if it rains . "[1496-nurse]

But the stars came out , and the new moon shone softly all night on the great fir trees and the rosebuds and the little dancing beck in [the Ravensnest garden]696-the ravensnest garden ; and when [Milly]83-milly awoke next morning the sun was shining , and [Brownholme]24-brownholme was towering up clear and high into the breezy blue sky , and the trees were throwing cool shadows on the dewy lawn around [the house]265-the house .

" Oh dear ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , jumping up , [her]83-milly face flushing with joy " it 's [my]83-milly birthday , and it 's fine . [Nana]79-nana , bring [me]83-milly [my]83-milly things , please.--But where 's [Olly]63-olly ? "[83-milly]

Where indeed was [Olly]63-olly ? There was [his]63-olly little bed , but there was a nightdress rolled up in it , and not a wisp of [his]63-olly brown curls was to be seen anywhere .

" Why , [Miss Milly]83-milly , are [you]83-milly woke up at last ? [I]1496-nurse hardly thought [you]83-milly 'd have slept so late this morning . Many happy returns of the day to [you]83-milly , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse , giving [her]83-milly a hearty hug .

" Thank [you]83-milly , [_ dear _ [nurse]1496-nurse]2830-_ dear _ nurse . Oh , it is so nice having birthdays . But where can [Olly]63-olly be ? "[1496-nurse]

" Do n't [you]83-milly trouble [your]83-milly head about [him]63-olly , "[1496-nurse] said [nurse]1496-nurse mysteriously , and not another word could [Milly]83-milly get out of [her]83-milly . [She]83-milly had just slipped on [her]83-milly white cotton frock when [mother]1502-mother opened the door .

" Well , [birthday - girl]2832-birthday - girl ! The top of the morning to [you]83-milly , and many , many happy returns of the day . "[1502-mother]

[Whereupon Milly]83-milly and [mother]1502-mother went through a great deal of kissing which need not be described , and then [mother]1502-mother helped [her]83-milly brush [her]83-milly hair , and put on [her]83-milly ribbon and tie [her]83-milly sash , so that in another minute or two [she]83-milly was quite ready to go down .

" Now , [Milly]83-milly , wait one minute till [you]83-milly hear the bell ring , and then [you]83-milly may come down as fast as [you]83-milly like . "[1502-mother]

So [Milly]83-milly waited , [her]83-milly little feet dancing with impatience , till the bell began to ring as if it had gone quite mad .

" Oh , that 's [Olly]63-olly ringing , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , rushing off . And sure enough when [she]83-milly got to [the hall]788-the hall there was [Olly]63-olly ringing as if [he]63-olly meant to bring [the house]265-the house down . [He]63-olly dropped the bell when [he]63-olly saw [Milly]83-milly , and dragged [her]83-milly breathlessly into [the dining - room]474-the dining - room .

And what did [Milly]83-milly see there [I]0-i wonder ? Why , a heap of red and white roses lying on the breakfast table , a big heap , with odd corners and points sticking up all over it , and under the roses a white napkin , and under the napkin treasures of all sorts -- a book from [father]1498-father , a little work - box from [mother]1502-mother , with a picture of [Windermere]18-windermere on the outside , and inside the most delightful cottons and needles and bits of bright - coloured stuffs ; a china doll 's dinner - service from [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , a mug from [nurse]1496-nurse , a little dish full of big red strawberries from [gardener]1705-gardener , and last , but not least , [Olly]63-olly 's present -- a black paint - box , with colours and brushes and all complete , and tied up with a little drawing - book which [mother]1502-mother had added to make it really useful . At the top of the heap , too , lay two letters addressed in very big round hand to " [Miss Milly Norton]83-milly , "[1502-mother] and one was signed [Jacky]66-john backhouse and the other signed [Francis]67-francis . Each of these presents had neat little labels fastened on to them , and they were smothered in roses -- deep red and pale pink roses , with the morning dew sprinkled over them .

" [We]2833-we got all those roses , [mother]1502-mother and [me]63-olly , this morning , when [you]83-milly was fast asleep , [Milly]83-milly , "[63-olly] shouted [Olly]63-olly , who was capering about like a mad creature . " [Mother]62-mother pulled [me]63-olly out of bed ever so early , and [I]63-olly putted on [my]63-olly goloshes , and did n't [we]2833-we get wet just ! [Milly]83-milly , _ is n't _ [my]63-olly paint - box a beauty ? "[63-olly]

But it 's no good trying to describe what [Milly]83-milly felt . [She]83-milly felt as [every happy little girl]1299-every happy little girl feels on a happy birthday , just a little bit bewitched , as if [she]83-milly had got into another kind of world altogether .

" Now , "[1498-father] said [father]1498-father , after breakfast , " [I]1498-father 'm [yours]83-milly , [Milly]83-milly , for all this morning . What are [you]83-milly going to do with [me]1498-father ? "[1498-father]

" Make [you]83-milly into a tiger , [father]1498-father , and shoot [you]83-milly , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , who would have liked [to play at hunting and shooting games all day long]1301-to play at hunting and shooting games all day long .

" [I]89-mr. norton did n't ask [you]89-mr. norton , [sir]1613-sir , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , " [I]89-mr. norton 'm not [yours]83-milly , [I]89-mr. norton 'm [Milly]83-milly 's . Now , [Milly]83-milly , what shall [we]2837-we do ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Will [you]89-mr. norton take [us]2837-we right to [the top of [Brownholme]24-brownholme]2838-the top of brownholme , [father]1498-father ? [You]1498-father know [we]2837-we have n't been to [the very top]2840-the very top yet . "[59-aunt emma]

" Very well , [we]2837-we 'll go if [your]83-milly legs will carry [you]83-milly . But [you]83-milly must ask [them]1302-their very particularly first how [they]1302-their feel , for it 'll be stiff work for [them]1302-their . "[89-mr. norton]

Not very long after breakfast , and before [they]1302-their started for [their]1302-their walk , [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's pony carriage]1303-aunt emma 's pony carriage came rattling up [the drive]697-the drive , and [she]59-aunt emma , too , brought flowers for [Milly]83-milly , above all a bunch of water - lilies all wet from [the lake]1829-the lake ; and then [she]59-aunt emma and [mother]1502-mother settled under the trees with [their]1302-their books and work while [the children]198-the children started on [their]1302-their walk .

But first [Milly]83-milly had drawn [mother]1502-mother into a corner where [no one]2596-no one could see , and there , with a couple of tears in [her]1502-mother two blue eyes , [she]1502-mother had whispered in a great hurry , so that [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton could scarcely hear , " [I]1502-mother do n't want to have everything just as _ [I]1502-mother _ like , to - day , [mother]1502-mother . Ca n't [I]1502-mother do what [somebody else]341-somebody else likes ? [I]1502-mother 'd rather . "[1502-mother]
