Which means that [Milly]83-milly was a good deal excited , and [her]83-milly heart very full , and that [she]83-milly was thinking of how , a year before , [her]83-milly birthday had been rather spoilt toward the end of it by a little bit of crossness and self - will , that [she]83-milly remembered afterward with a pang for many a long day . Since then , [Milly]83-milly had learnt a good deal more of that long , long lesson , which [we]1310-we go on learning , [big people]2520-big people and [little people]230-little people , all [our]1310-we lives -- the lesson of self - forgetting -- of how love brings joy , and to be selfish is to be sad ; and [her]83-milly birthday seemed to bring back to [her]83-milly all that [she]83-milly had been learning .

" [Dear little woman]2336-dear little woman , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , putting back [her]70-mrs. norton tangled hair from [her]70-mrs. norton anxious little face , " go and be happy . That 's what [we]1310-we all like to - day . Besides , [you]2336-dear little woman 'll find plenty of ways of doing what [other people]1989-other people like before the end of the day without [my]70-mrs. norton inventing any . Run along now , and climb away . Mind [you]2336-dear little woman do n't let [Olly]63-olly tumble into bogs , and mind [you]2336-dear little woman bring [me]70-mrs. norton a bunch of ferns for the dinner - table -- and there 'll be two things done at any rate . "[70-mrs. norton]

So away ran [Milly]83-milly ; and all the morning [she]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly and [father]1498-father scrambled and climbed , and raced and chatted , on [the green back of [old Brownholme]24-brownholme]1314-the green back of old brownholme . [They]1315-they went to say good - morning to [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse 's cows in the " intake , "[66-john backhouse] as [he]66-john backhouse called [[his]66-john backhouse top field]1316-his top field , and [they]1315-they just peeped over the wall at the fierce young bull [he]66-john backhouse had bought at [Penrith]47-penrith fair a few days before , and which looked as if , birthdays or no birthdays , [he]66-john backhouse could have eaten [Milly]83-milly at two mouthfuls , and swallowed [Olly]63-olly down afterwards without knowing it .

Then [they]1315-they climbed and climbed after [father]1498-father , till , just as [Olly]63-olly was beginning to feel [his]63-olly legs to make sure [they]1315-they were n't falling off , [they]1315-they were so tired and shaky -- there [they]1315-they were standing on the great pile of stones which marks [the top of [the mountain]1561-the mountain]1812-the top of the mountain -- the very tip - top of all [its]1561-the mountain green points and rocks and grassy stretches . By this time [the children]198-the children knew the names of [most of [the mountains around]1322-the mountains around]1321-most of the mountains around , and of all [the lakes]993-the lakes . [They]198-the children went through [them]1324-them now like a lesson with [[their]198-the children father]212-their father ; and even [Olly]63-olly remembered a great many , and could chatter about [Helvellyn]48-helvellyn , and [Fairfield]3-fairfield , and [Langdale Pikes]49-langdale pikes , as if [he]63-olly had trudged to [the top of [them]1324-them all [himself]63-olly]1326-the top of them all himself .

Then came the getting down again . [Father]85-father and [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly hand - in - hand , racing over the short fine grass , startling the little black - faced sheep , and racing down [the steep bits]1327-the steep bits , where [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly generally tumbled over in some sort of a heap at the bottom . As for the flowers [they]198-the children gathered , there were so many [I]0-i have no time to tell [you]1328-you about them -- wood - flowers and bog - flowers and grass - flowers , and ferns of all sizes to mix with them , from [the great Osmunda , which grew along [the Ravensnest Beck]50-the ravensnest beck]1329-the great osmunda , which grew along the ravensnest beck , down to the tiny little parsley fern . It was all delightful -- the sights and the sounds , and the fresh mountain wind that blew them about on the top so that long afterward [Milly]83-milly used to look back to that walk on [Brownholme]24-brownholme when [she]83-milly was seven years old as one of the merriest times [she]83-milly ever spent .

Dinner was very welcome after all this scrambling ; and after dinner came a quiet time in [the garden]219-the garden , when [father]1498-father read aloud to [mother]1502-mother and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , and [the children]198-the children kept still and listened to as much as [they]198-the children could understand , at least until [they]198-the children went to sleep , which [they]198-the children both did lying on a rug at [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's feet . [Milly]83-milly could n't understand how this had happened at all , when [she]83-milly found [herself]83-milly waking up and rubbing [her]83-milly eyes , but [I]0-i think it was natural enough after [their]198-the children long walk in the sun and wind .

At four o'clock nurse came for [them]198-the children , and when [they]198-the children had been put into clean frocks and pinafores , [she]1334-she took [them]198-the children up to [the farm]1556-the farm . [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly felt that this was a very solemn occasion , and [they]198-the children walked up to [the farmhouse]583-the farmhouse door hand - in - hand , feeling as shy as if [they]198-the children had never been [there]1539-there before . But at the door were [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza waiting for [them]198-the children , as smart as new pins , with shining hair , and red ribbons under [their]198-the children little white collars ; and [the children]198-the children no sooner caught sight of [one another]1083-one another than all [their]198-the children shyness flew away , and [they]198-the children began to chatter as usual .

In [the farmhouse kitchen]1340-the farmhouse kitchen were [Bessie]97-bessie and [Charlie]96-charlie , and such a comfortable tea spread out on a long table , covered with a red and black woollen table - cloth instead of a white one . [Becky]102-becky and [Tiza]103-tiza had filled two tumblers with meadow - sweet and blue campanula , which stood up grandly in the middle , and there were two home - made cakes at each end , and some of [Sally]119-sally 's brown eggs , and piles of tempting bread and butter .

[Each of [the children]198-the children]1667-each of the children had [their]1667-each of the children gift for [Milly]83-milly too : [Becky]102-becky had plaited [her]102-becky a basket of rushes , a thing [she]102-becky had often tried to teach [Milly]83-milly how to make for [herself]102-becky , and [Tiza]103-tiza pushed a bunch of wild raspberries into [her]103-tiza hand , and ran away before [Milly]83-milly could say thank [you]1343-you ; [Bessie]97-bessie shyly produced a Christmas card that [somebody]545-somebody had once sent to [her]97-bessie ; and even [Charlie]96-charlie had managed to provide [himself]96-charlie with a bunch of the wild yellow poppies which grew on the wall of [the Ravensnest garden]696-the ravensnest garden , and were a joy to [all beholders]1346-all beholders .

Then [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse put [Milly]83-milly at one end of the table , while [she]101-mrs. backhouse began to pour out tea at the other , and the feast began . Certainly , [Milly]83-milly thought , it was much more exciting going out to tea at [a farmhouse]1347-a farmhouse than having [children]1510-children to tea with [you]1343-you at [home]382-home , just as [you]1343-you might anywhere , on any day in the year . There were the big hens coming up to the door and poking in [their]1350-their long necks to take a look at [them]1350-their ; there were the pigeons circling round and round in [the yard]530-the yard ; there was the sound of milking going on in [the shed]1352-the shed close by , and many other sights and sounds which were new and strange and delightful .

As for [Olly]63-olly , [he]63-olly was very much taken up for a time with the red and black table - cloth , and could not be kept from peering underneath it from time to time , as if [he]63-olly suspected that the white table - cloth [he]63-olly was generally accustomed to had been hidden away underneath for a joke . But when the time for cake came , [Olly]63-olly forgot the table - cloth altogether . [He]63-olly had never seen a cake quite like the bun - loaf , which kind [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse had made [herself]101-mrs. backhouse for the occasion , and of which [she]101-mrs. backhouse had given [him]63-olly a hunch , so in [his]63-olly usual inquisitive way [he]63-olly began to turn it over and over , as if by looking at it long enough [he]63-olly could find out how it was made and all about it . Presently , when [the others]1353-the others were all quietly enjoying [their]1353-the others bun - loaf , [Olly]63-olly 's shrill little voice was heard saying -- while [he]63-olly put two separate fingers on two out of the few currants in [his]63-olly piece :

" _ This _ currant says to _ that _ currant , ' [I]63-olly 'm [here]1560-here , where are [you]63-olly ? [You]63-olly 're so far off [I]63-olly ca n't see [you]63-olly nowhere . ' "[63-olly]

" [Olly]63-olly , be quiet , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly .

" Well , but , [Milly]83-milly , [I]63-olly ca n't help it ; it 's so funny . There 's only three currants in [my]63-olly bit , and cookie puts such a lot in at [home]382-home . [I]63-olly 'm pretending [they]1353-the others 're [little children]532-little children wanting to play , only [they]1353-the others ca n't , [they]1353-the others 're so far off . There , [I]63-olly 've etten one up . Now there 's only two . That 's [you]83-milly and [me]63-olly , [Milly]83-milly . [I]63-olly 'll eat [you]83-milly up first -- krick ! "[63-olly]

" Never mind about the currants , [little master]1877-little master , "[101-mrs. backhouse] said [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , laughing at [him]1354-him . " It 's nice and sweet any way , and [you]83-milly can eat as much of it as [you]83-milly like , which is more than [you]83-milly can of rich cakes . "[101-mrs. backhouse]

[Olly]63-olly thought there was something in this , and by the time [he]63-olly had got through [his]63-olly second bit of bun - loaf [he]63-olly had quite made up [his]63-olly mind that [he]63-olly would get [Susan]86-susan to make bun - loaves at [home]382-home too .

[They]1356-they were just finishing tea when there was a great clatter outside , and by came the hay - cart with [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse leading the horse , and [two men]1357-two men walking beside it .

" [We]1356-they 're going to carry all the hay in [yon lower field]2849-yon lower field presently , "[63-olly] [he]63-olly shouted to [[his]63-olly wife]559-his wife as [he]63-olly passed . " Send [the young ' uns]2850-the young ' uns down to see . "[63-olly]

Up [they]1356-they all started , and presently [the whole party]607-the whole party were racing down [the hill]2479-the hill to [the riverfield]1361-the riverfield , with [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse and [[her]101-mrs. backhouse baby]1362-her baby walking soberly with [nurse]1496-nurse behind [them]1356-they . Yes , there lay the hay piled up in large cocks on the fresh clean - swept carpet of bright green grass , and in the middle of [the field]1364-the field stood [the hay - cart]1365-the hay - cart with two horses harnessed , [one man]1366-one man standing in it to press down and settle the hay as [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse and [two other men]1367-two other men handed it up to [him]63-olly on pitchforks . [Olly]63-olly went head over heels into the middle of one of the cocks , followed by [Charlie]96-charlie , and would have liked to go head over heels into all the rest , but [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , who had come into [the field]1364-the field with [mother]1502-mother and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , told [him]89-mr. norton [he]89-mr. norton must be content to play with two cocks in [one of the far corners of [the field]1364-the field]1370-one of the far corners of the field without disturbing the others , which were all ready for carrying , and that if [he]89-mr. norton and [Charlie]96-charlie strewed the hay about [they]1356-they must tidy it up before [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse wanted to put it on [the cart]1372-the cart . So [Olly]63-olly and [Charlie]96-charlie went off to [[their]1356-they corner]1373-their corner , and for a little while [all the other children]1374-all the other children played there too . [Milly]83-milly had invented a game called the " Babes in [the Wood]655-the wood , "[83-milly] in which [two children]1375-two children were [the babes]1376-the babes and pretended to die on the grass , and [all the rest]1377-all the rest were [the robins]1378-the robins , and covered [them]1377-all the rest up with hay instead of leaves . [She]83-milly and [Tiza]103-tiza made [beautiful babes]1379-beautiful babes : [they]1379-beautiful babes put [their]1379-beautiful babes handkerchiefs over [their]1379-beautiful babes faces and lay as still as mice , till [Olly]63-olly had piled so much hay on the top of [them]1379-beautiful babes that there was not a bit of [them]1379-beautiful babes to be seen anywhere , while [Bessie]97-bessie began to cry out as if [she]97-bessie was suffocated before [they]1380-they had put two good armfuls over [her]97-bessie .

Presently , however , [Milly]83-milly got tired ; and [she]83-milly and [Tiza]103-tiza walked off by [themselves]1380-they and sat down by [the river]1681-the river to get cool . The water in [the river]1681-the river was quite low again now , and [the children]198-the children could watch the tiny minnows darting and flashing about by [the bank]946-the bank , and even amuse [themselves]198-the children by fancying every now and then that [they]198-the children saw a trout shooting across the clear brown water . [Tiza]103-tiza had quite left off being shy now with [Milly]83-milly , and [the two]2591-the two chattered away , [Milly]83-milly telling [Tiza]103-tiza all about [[her]103-tiza school]1386-her school , and [Jacky]66-john backhouse and [Francis]67-francis , and [Spot]77-spot and [the garden]219-the garden at [home]382-home ; and [Tiza]103-tiza telling [Milly]83-milly about [[her]103-tiza father]245-her father 's new bull , how frightened [she]103-tiza and [Becky]102-becky were of [him]245-her father , and how [father]1498-father meant to make the fence stronger for fear [he]1498-father should get out and toss [people]1598-people .

" What a happy little party , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma to [mother]1502-mother looking round [the field]1364-the field ; " there 's nothing like hay for [children]1510-children . "[59-aunt emma]

By this time [the hay - cart]1365-the hay - cart was quite full , and crack went [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse 's whip , as [he]66-john backhouse took hold of the first horse 's head and gave [him]66-john backhouse a pull forward to start [the cart]1372-the cart on its way to [the farm]1556-the farm .

" Gee - up , "[66-john backhouse] shouted [John]66-john backhouse in [his]66-john backhouse loud cheery voice , and the horse made a step forward , while [the children]198-the children round cried " Hurrah ! "[66-john backhouse] and waved [their]198-the children hands . But suddenly there was a loud piteous cry which made [John]66-john backhouse give the horse a sudden push back and drop [his]66-john backhouse whip , and then , from where [they]198-the children sat , [Milly]83-milly and [Tiza]103-tiza heard a sound of crying and screaming , while [everybody in [the field]1364-the field]1398-everybody in the field ran toward [the hay - cart]1365-the hay - cart . [They]198-the children ran too ; what could have happened ?

Just as [they]198-the children came up to [the crowd of [people round the cart]1402-people round the cart]1401-the crowd of people round the cart , [Milly]83-milly saw [[her]83-milly father]245-her father with something in [his]245-her father arms . And this something was [Becky]102-becky -- poor little [Becky]102-becky , with a great mark on [her]102-becky temple , and [her]102-becky eyes quite shut , and such a white face !

" Oh , [mother]1502-mother ! [mother]1502-mother ! "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , rushing up to [her]1404-her , " tell [me]83-milly , [mother]1502-mother , what is the matter with [Becky]102-becky ? "[83-milly]

But [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton had no time to attend to [her]83-milly . [She]70-mrs. norton was running to meet [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , who had come hurrying up from another part of [the field]1364-the field with [the baby]1719-the baby in [her]101-mrs. backhouse arms .

" [She]102-becky was under the cart when it moved on , "[70-mrs. norton] said [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton , taking [the baby]1719-the baby from [her]70-mrs. norton . " [We]2856-we none of [us]2856-we know how it happened . [She]102-becky must have been trying to hand up some hay at the last moment and tumbled under . [I]70-mrs. norton do n't think [her]102-becky head is much hurt . "[70-mrs. norton]

On ran [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse , and [Milly]83-milly and [[her]83-milly mother]187-her mother followed .

" Better let [me]89-mr. norton carry [her]102-becky up now without moving [her]102-becky , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , as [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse tried to take the little bundle from [him]89-mr. norton . " [She]102-becky has fainted , [I]101-mrs. backhouse think . [We]2857-we must get some water at [the stream]1051-the stream . "[101-mrs. backhouse] So on [he]89-mr. norton went , with [the pale frightened mother]1409-the pale frightened mother , while [the others]1353-the others followed . [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma had got [Tiza]103-tiza and [Milly]83-milly by the hand , and was trying to comfort [them]1353-the others .

" [We]2857-we hope [she]102-becky is not much hurt , [darlings]2859-darlings ; the wheel did not go over [her]102-becky , thank [God]142-god . It was just upon [her]102-becky when [[her]102-becky father]245-her father backed the horse . But it must have crushed [her]102-becky [I]59-aunt emma 'm afraid , and there was something hanging under the cart which gave [her]102-becky that knock on the temple . Look , there is [one of [the men]2862-the men starting off for [the doctor]2863-the doctor]2861-one of the men starting off for the doctor . "[59-aunt emma]

[Whereupon Tiza]103-tiza , who had kept quiet till then , burst into a loud fit of crying , and threw [herself]103-tiza down on the grass .

" [Nurse]1496-nurse , "[59-aunt emma] called [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , " stay here with [these two poor little ones]2865-these two poor little ones while [I]59-aunt emma go and see if [I]59-aunt emma can be of any use . "[59-aunt emma]

So [nurse]1496-nurse came and sat beside [them]1412-them , and [Milly]83-milly crept up to [her]1496-nurse for comfort . But poor [little Tiza]103-tiza lay with [her]103-tiza face buried in the grass and nothing [they]1412-them could say to [her]103-tiza seemed to reach [her]103-tiza little deaf ears .

Meanwhile , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma hurried after [the others]1353-the others , and presently caught [them]1353-the others up at [a stream where [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton had stopped to bathe [Becky]102-becky 's head and face]1414-a stream where mr. norton had stopped to bathe becky 's head and face . The cold water had just revived [her]103-tiza when [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma came up , and for one moment [she]59-aunt emma opened [her]59-aunt emma heavy blue eyes and looked at [[her]59-aunt emma mother]187-her mother , who was bending over [her]59-aunt emma , and then they shut again . But [her]59-aunt emma little hand went feebly searching for [[her]59-aunt emma mother]187-her mother , who caught it up and kissed it .

" Oh , [Miss Emma]143-miss emma , [Miss Emma]143-miss emma , "[187-her mother] [she]187-her mother said , pointing to [the child]1417-the child , " [I]187-her mother 'm afeard but [she]1417-the child 's badly hurt . "[187-her mother]

" [I]59-aunt emma hope not , with all [my]59-aunt emma heart , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , gently taking [her]103-tiza arm . " But [the doctor]2863-the doctor will soon be [here]1560-here ; [we]1418-they must get [her]1417-the child [home]382-home before [he]2863-the doctor comes . "[59-aunt emma]

So on [they]1418-they went again , [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton still carrying [Becky]102-becky , and [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse helping [[his]135-mr. backhouse wife]559-his wife along . [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton had got [the baby]1719-the baby safe in [her]70-mrs. norton motherly arms , and so [they]1418-they all toiled up [the hill]2479-the hill to [the farmhouse]583-the farmhouse . What a difference from the merry party that ran down [the hill]2479-the hill only an hour before !

[They]1418-they laid [Becky]102-becky down on [[her]102-becky mother]187-her mother 's bed , and then [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , finding that [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton wished to stay till [the doctor]2863-the doctor came , went back to [the children]198-the children . [She]59-aunt emma found [a sad little group]1427-a sad little group sitting in [the hay - field]1271-the hay - field ; [Milly]83-milly in [nurse]1496-nurse 's lap crying quietly every now and then ; [Tiza]103-tiza still sobbing on the grass , and [Olly]63-olly who had just crept down from [the farmhouse]583-the farmhouse , where [he]63-olly and [Charlie]96-charlie had seen [Becky]102-becky carried in , talking to [nurse]1496-nurse in eager whispers , as if [he]63-olly dare n't talk out loud .

" Oh , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly , when [she]83-milly opened the gate , " is [she]102-becky better ? "[83-milly]

" A little , [I]1496-nurse think , [Milly]83-milly , but [the doctor]2863-the doctor will soon be [here]1560-here , and then [we]2871-we shall know all about it . [Tiza]103-tiza , [[you]103-tiza poor little woman]2872-you poor little woman , [Mrs. Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler says [you]103-tiza must sleep with [them]2873-them to - night . [[Your]103-tiza mother]1713-your mother will want [the house]265-the house very quiet , and to - morrow , [you]103-tiza know , [you]103-tiza can go and see [Becky]102-becky if [the doctor]2863-the doctor says [you]103-tiza may . "[1496-nurse]

At this [Tiza]103-tiza began to cry again more piteously than ever . It seemed so dreary and terrible to [her]103-tiza to be shut out from [home]382-home without [Becky]102-becky . But [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma sat down on the grass beside [her]103-tiza , and lifted [her]103-tiza up and talked to [her]103-tiza ; with [anybody else]2063-anybody else [Tiza]103-tiza would have kicked and struggled , for [she]103-tiza was [a curious , passionate child]1434-a curious , passionate child , and [her]103-tiza grief was always wild and angry , but [nobody]280-nobody could struggle with [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , and at last [she]103-tiza let [herself]103-tiza be comforted a little by the tender voice and soft caressing hand . [She]103-tiza stopped crying , and then [they]1436-we all took [her]103-tiza up to [[the Wheelers]144-the wheelers 's cottage]1437-the wheelers 's cottage , where [Mrs. Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler , [a kind motherly body]1438-a kind motherly body , took [her]103-tiza in , and promised that [she]103-tiza should know everything there was to be known about [Becky]102-becky .

" [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , presently , when [they]1436-we were all sitting in [the conservatory which ran round [the house]265-the house]1439-the conservatory which ran round the house , waiting for [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton to bring [them]1436-we news from [the farm]1556-the farm , " how did [Becky]102-becky tumble under the cart ? "[89-mr. norton]

" [She]102-becky was lifting up some hay , [I]83-milly think , which had fallen off , and [one of [the men]2862-the men]2877-one of the men was stooping down to take it on [his]2877-one of the men fork , and then [she]102-becky must have slipped and fallen right under the cart , just as [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse told the horse to go on . "[83-milly]

" Oh , if the wheel _ had _ gone over ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , shuddering . " Is n't it a sad birthday , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , and [we]1436-we were so happy a little while ago ? And then [I]83-milly ca n't understand . [I]83-milly do n't know why it happens like this . "[83-milly]

" Like what , [Milly]83-milly ? "[83-milly]

" Why , [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , always in stories , [you]59-aunt emma know , it 's [the bad people]2879-the bad people get hurt and die . And now it 's poor little [Becky]102-becky that 's hurt . And [she]102-becky 's such [a dear little girl]2880-a dear little girl , and helps [[her]102-becky mother]187-her mother so . [I]83-milly do n't think [she]102-becky ought to have been hurt . "[83-milly]

" [We]1436-we do n't know anything about ' oughts , ' [Milly]83-milly , [darling]1623-darling , [you]83-milly and [I.]83-milly God knows , [we]1436-we trust , and that helps [many people who love [God]142-god to be patient when [they]2883-many people who love god to be patient when they are in trouble or pain are in trouble or pain]2883-many people who love god to be patient when they are in trouble or pain . But think if it had been [poor mischievous little Tiza]103-tiza who had been hurt , how [she]103-tiza would have fretted . And now very likely [Becky]102-becky will bear it beautifully , and so , without knowing it , [she]102-becky will be teaching [Tiza]103-tiza to be patient , and it will do [Tiza]103-tiza good to have to help [Becky]102-becky and take care of [her]102-becky for a bit , instead of letting [Becky]102-becky always look after [her]102-becky and get [her]102-becky out of scrapes . "[83-milly]

" Oh , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , ca n't [we]1436-we all take care of [Becky]102-becky ? What can [Olly]63-olly and [I]83-milly do ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , imploringly .

" [I]63-olly can go and sing all [my]63-olly songs to [Becky]102-becky , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , looking up brightly .

" By - and - by , perhaps , "[59-aunt emma] said [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , smiling and patting [his]63-olly head . " But hark ! is n't [that father]2884-that father 's step ? "[59-aunt emma]

It had grown so dark that [they]1442-we could hardly see who it was opening the gate .

" Oh yes , it is , "[83-milly] cried [Milly]83-milly . " It 's [father]1498-father and [mother]1502-mother . "[83-milly] Away [they]1442-we ran to meet [them]1442-we , and [Mrs. Norton]70-mrs. norton took [Milly]83-milly 's little pale face in both [her]70-mrs. norton hands and kissed it .

" [She]102-becky 's not _ very _ badly hurt , [darling]1623-darling . [The doctor]2863-the doctor says [she]102-becky must lie quite quiet for two or three weeks , and then [he]2863-the doctor hopes [she]102-becky 'll be all right . The wheel gave [her]102-becky a squeeze , which jarred [her]102-becky poor little back and head very much , but it did n't break anything , and if [she]102-becky lies very quite [the doctor]2863-the doctor thinks [she]102-becky 'll get quite well again . "[70-mrs. norton] " Oh [mother]1502-mother ! and does [Tiza]103-tiza know ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" Yes , [we]1442-we have just been to tell [her]103-tiza . [Mrs. Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler had put [her]103-tiza to bed , but [she]95-mrs. wheeler went up to give [her]103-tiza [our]1442-we message , and [she]95-mrs. wheeler said [poor little Tiza]103-tiza began to cry again , and wanted [us]1442-we to tell [[her]103-tiza mother]187-her mother [she]103-tiza would be _ so _ quiet if only [they]1442-we would let [her]103-tiza come back to [Becky]102-becky . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Will [they]1442-we , [mother]1502-mother ? "[70-mrs. norton]

" In a few days , perhaps . But [she]103-tiza is not to see [anybody]1612-anybody but [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse for a little while . "[70-mrs. norton]

" Oh dear ! "[83-milly] sighed [Milly]83-milly , while the tears came into [her]83-milly eyes again . " [We]1442-we shall be going away so soon , and [we]1442-we ca n't say good - bye . Is n't it sad , [mother]1502-mother , just happening last thing ? and [we]1442-we 've been so happy all the time . "[83-milly]

" Yes , [Milly]83-milly , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , lifting [her]83-milly on to [his]89-mr. norton knee . " This is the first really sad thing that ever happened to [you]83-milly in [your]83-milly little life [I]89-mr. norton think . [Mother]62-mother , and [I]89-mr. norton , and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma , tell [you]83-milly stories about sad things , but that 's very different , is n't it ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Yes , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , thinking . " [Father]85-father , are there as many sad things really as there are in [stories?--you]2895-stories?--you know what [I]83-milly mean . "[83-milly]

" There are a great many sad things and [sad people in [the world]260-the world]2896-sad people in the world , [Milly]83-milly . [We]1442-we do n't have monsters plaguing [us]1442-we like [King Hrothgar]131-hrothgar , but every day there is trouble and grief going on somewhere , and [[we]1442-we happy and [strong people]2899-strong people]2898-we happy and strong people must care for [the sad ones]2900-the sad ones if [we]1442-we want to do [our]1442-we duty and help to straighten [the world]260-the world a little . "[89-mr. norton]

" [Father]85-father , "[83-milly] whispered [Milly]83-milly , softly , " will [you]85-father tell [us]1442-we how -- [Olly]63-olly and [me]83-milly ? [We]1442-we would if [we]1442-we knew how . "[83-milly]

" Well , [Milly]83-milly , suppose [you]83-milly begin with [Becky]102-becky , and poor [Tiza]103-tiza too , indeed . [I]89-mr. norton wonder whether [a pair of little people]2902-a pair of little people could make a scrap - book for [Becky]102-becky to look at when [she]102-becky is getting better ? "[89-mr. norton]

" Oh yes , yes ! "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , joyfully , " [I]83-milly 've got ever so many pictures in [mother]1502-mother 's writing - book , [she]1502-mother let [me]83-milly cut out of [her]1502-mother ' Graphics , ' and [Olly]63-olly can help paste ; ca n't [you]63-olly , [Olly]63-olly ? "[83-milly]

" [Olly]63-olly generally pastes [his]63-olly face more than anything else , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , giving a sly pull at [his]89-mr. norton brown curls . " If [I]89-mr. norton 'm not very much mistaken , there is a little fairy pasting up [your]63-olly eyes , [old man]1571-old man . "[89-mr. norton]

" [I]63-olly 'm not sleepy , not a bit , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , sitting bolt upright and blinking very fast .

" [I]89-mr. norton think [you]63-olly 're not sleepy , but just asleep , "[89-mr. norton] said [Mr. Norton]89-mr. norton , catching [him]63-olly up in [his]89-mr. norton arms , and carrying [him]63-olly to [[his]63-olly mother]185-his mother to say good - night .

[Milly]83-milly went very soberly and quietly up to bed , and for some little time [she]83-milly lay awake , [her]83-milly little heart feeling very sore and heavy about the " sad things "[102-becky] in [the world]260-the world . Then with [her]83-milly thoughts full of [Becky]102-becky [she]83-milly fell asleep .

So ended [Milly]83-milly 's birthday , a happy day and a sorrowful day , all in one . When [Milly]83-milly grew older there was no birthday just before or after it [she]83-milly remembered half so clearly as that on which [she]83-milly was seven years old .

CHAPTER X

LAST DAYS AT [RAVENSNEST]19-ravensnest

On Friday morning [the children]198-the children and [[their]198-the children father]212-their father trudged up very early to [the farm]1556-the farm to get news of [Becky]102-becky . [She]102-becky had had a bad night [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse said , but [she]102-becky had taken some milk and beef - tea ; [she]102-becky knew [[her]102-becky father]245-her father and [mother]1502-mother quite well , and [she]102-becky had asked twice for [Tiza]103-tiza . [The doctor]2863-the doctor said [they]1451-they must just be [patient]1452-patient . Quiet and rest would make [her]102-becky well again , and nothing else , and [Tiza]103-tiza was not to go [home]382-home for a day or two .

As for [poor Tiza]103-tiza , a long sleep had cheered [her]102-becky up greatly , and when [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly went to take [her]102-becky out with [them]1451-they after breakfast , [they]1451-they found [her]102-becky almost as merry and chatty as usual . But [she]102-becky did n't like being kept at [[the Wheelers]144-the wheelers 's]1454-the wheelers 's , though [they]1454-the wheelers 's were very kind to [her]102-becky ; and it was all [Mrs. Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler could do to prevent [her]102-becky from slipping up to [the farm]1556-the farm unknown to [anybody]1612-anybody .

" [They]1454-the wheelers 's do n't have porridge for breakfast , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza , tossing [her]103-tiza head , when [she]103-tiza and [Milly]83-milly were out together . " [Mother]62-mother always gives [us]198-the children porridge . And [I]103-tiza wo n't sit next [Charlie]96-charlie . [He]96-charlie 's always dirtying hisself . [He]96-charlie stickied hisself just all over this morning with treacle . [Mother]1502-mother would have given [him]96-charlie a clout . "[103-tiza]

However , on the whole , [she]102-becky was as good as such a wild creature could be , and [the children]198-the children and [she]102-becky had some capital times together . [Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler [the gardener]1554-the gardener let [them]198-the children gather strawberries and currants for making jam , a delightful piece of work , which helped to keep [Tiza]103-tiza out of mischief and make [her]103-tiza contented with staying away from [home]382-home more than anything else . At last , after three days , [the doctor]2863-the doctor said [she]103-tiza might come [home]382-home if [she]103-tiza would promise to be quiet in [the house]265-the house . So one bright evening [Tiza]103-tiza slipped into [the farmhouse]583-the farmhouse and squeezed in after [[her]103-tiza mother]187-her mother to [the little room where [Becky]102-becky was lying]1465-the little room where becky was lying , a white - faced feverish little creature , low down among the pillows .

" [Becky]102-becky , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza , sitting down beside [[her]103-tiza sister]598-her sister , as if nothing had happened , " here 's some strawberries . [Wheeler]95-mrs. wheeler gave [me]103-tiza some . [You]102-becky can have some if [you]102-becky want . "[103-tiza]

" Just one , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , in [her]102-becky weak shaky voice , smiling at [her]187-her mother ; and [Tiza]103-tiza knelt on the bed and stuffed one softly into [her]103-tiza mouth .

" [You]103-tiza 'll have to nurse [baby]1772-baby now , [Tiza]103-tiza , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky presently ; " [he]1772-baby 's been under [mother]1502-mother 's feet terrible . Mind [you]103-tiza do n't let [him]1772-baby eat nasty things . [He]1772-baby 'll get at the coals if [you]103-tiza do n't mind [him]1772-baby . "[102-becky]

" [I]103-tiza 'll not let [him]1772-baby , "[103-tiza] said [Tiza]103-tiza shortly , setting to work on [her]103-tiza own strawberries .

All this did n't sound very affectionate ; but [I]0-i think all the same [Tiza]103-tiza did love [Becky]102-becky , and [I]0-i believe [she]103-tiza tried to do [her]103-tiza best in [her]103-tiza own funny way while [Becky]102-becky was ill . [Baby]145-baby screamed a good deal certainly when [she]103-tiza nursed [him]1467-him , and it was quite impossible of course for [Tiza]103-tiza to keep out of mischief altogether for two or three weeks . Still , on the whole , [she]102-becky was [a help to [[her]102-becky mother]187-her mother]1468-a help to her mother ; while as for [Becky]102-becky [she]102-becky was never quite happy when [Tiza]103-tiza was out of [the house]265-the house . [Becky]102-becky , like [Milly]83-milly , had a way of loving [everybody]1611-everybody about [her]102-becky , and next to [[her]102-becky mother]187-her mother [she]102-becky loved [Tiza]103-tiza best of [anybody]1612-anybody .

After all , [the children]198-the children were able to say good - bye to [Becky]102-becky . Just the day before [they]198-the children were to go away [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse came down to say that [Becky]102-becky would like to see [them]198-the children very much if [they]198-the children could come , and [the doctor]2863-the doctor said [they]198-the children might .

So up [they]198-the children went ; [Milly]83-milly a good deal excited , and Olly very curious to see what [Becky]102-becky would look like . [Mr. Backhouse]135-mr. backhouse took [them]198-the children in , and [they]198-the children found [Becky]102-becky lying comfortably on a little bed , with a patchwork counterpane , and [her]102-becky shoulders and arms covered up in a red flannel dressing - gown that [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma had sent [her]102-becky .

[ Illustration : " ' Have n't [you]102-becky got a bump ? ' asked [Olly]63-olly "[83-milly] ]

[Milly]83-milly kissed [her]102-becky , and [Olly]63-olly shook [her]102-becky hand , and [they]198-the children did n't all quite know what to say .

" Is [your]102-becky back better ? "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly at last . " [I]83-milly 'm so glad [the doctor]2863-the doctor let [us]198-the children come . "[83-milly]

" Have n't [you]102-becky got a bump ? "[63-olly] asked [Olly]63-olly , looking at [her]102-becky with all [his]63-olly eyes . " [We]198-the children thought [you]102-becky 'd have a great black bump on [your]102-becky fore - head , [you]102-becky know -- ever so big . "[63-olly]

" No , it 's a cut , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky ; " there now , [you]63-olly can see how it 's plastered up . "[102-becky]

" Did it hurt ? "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " did [you]102-becky kick ? [I]63-olly should have kicked . And does [the doctor]2863-the doctor give [you]102-becky nasty medicine ? "[63-olly]

" No , "[102-becky] said [Becky]102-becky , " [I]102-becky do n't have any now . And it was n't nasty at all what [I]102-becky had first . And now [I]102-becky may have strawberries and raspberries , and [Mr. Wheeler]146-mr. wheeler sends [mother]1502-mother a plate everyday . "[102-becky]

" [I]63-olly do n't think it 's fair that [little boys]1617-little boys should n't never be ill , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , with [his]63-olly eyes fastened on [Becky]102-becky 's plate of strawberries , which was on the chest of drawers .

" Oh , [[you]102-becky funny boy]2912-you funny boy , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , " why , [mother]1502-mother gives [you]102-becky some every day though [you]102-becky are n't ill ; and [I]83-milly 'm sure [you]102-becky would n't like staying in bed . "[83-milly]

" Yes , [I]63-olly should , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , just for the sake of contradicting . " Do [you]102-becky know , [Becky]102-becky , [we]2914-we 've got a secret , and [we]2914-we 're not to tell it [you]102-becky , only [Milly]83-milly and [I]63-olly are going to-- "[63-olly]

" It's -- it's -- a picture - book ! "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , in a loud whisper , putting [his]63-olly head down to [Becky]102-becky . " [You]102-becky wo n't tell , will [you]102-becky ? "[63-olly]

But [Becky]102-becky looked very pleased , and said [she]102-becky would like a picture - book [she]102-becky thought very much , for it was dull sometimes when [mother]1502-mother was busy and [Tiza]103-tiza was nursing [baby]1772-baby . " [I]83-milly 'm going to write to [you]102-becky , [Becky]102-becky , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , when the time came to go away , " and at Christmas [I]83-milly 'll send [you]102-becky a Christmas card , and perhaps some day [we]2917-we 'll come here again [you]102-becky know . "[83-milly]

" And then [we]2917-we 'll milk the cows , "[63-olly] said [Olly]63-olly , " wo n't [we]2917-we , [Becky]102-becky ? And [I]63-olly 'll ride on [your]102-becky big horse . "[63-olly]

And then [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly kissed [Becky]102-becky 's pale little face and went away , while poor little [Becky]102-becky looked after [them]1479-them as if [she]102-becky was _ very _ sorry to see the last of [them]1479-them ; and outside there were [Tiza]103-tiza and [baby]1772-baby and [Mrs. Backhouse]101-mrs. backhouse and even [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse [himself]66-john backhouse , waiting to say good - bye to [them]1479-them . It made [Milly]83-milly cry a little bit , and [she]83-milly ran away fast down [the hill]2479-the hill , while [Tiza]103-tiza and [Olly]63-olly were still trying which could squeeze hands hardest .

" Oh , [you]1479-them dear mountains , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , as [she]83-milly and [nurse]1496-nurse walked along together . " Look [Nana]79-nana , are n't they lovely ? "[83-milly]

[They]1479-them did look beautiful this last evening . The sun was shining on [them]1479-them so brightly that everything on [them]1479-them , up to the very top , was clear and plain , and high up , ever so far away , were little white dots moving , which [Milly]83-milly knew were cows feeding .

" Good - bye [river]2918-river , good - bye stepping - stones , [good - bye doves]2919-good - bye doves , [good - bye fly - catchers]2920-good - bye fly - catchers ! Mind [you]1483-you do n't any of [you]1483-you go away till [we]2921-we come back again . "[83-milly]

But [I]0-i should find it very hard to tell [you]1483-you all the good - byes that [Milly]83-milly and [Olly]63-olly said to [the places and people at [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest]1484-the places and people at ravensnest , to [the woods]593-the woods and [the hay - fields]634-the hay - fields , and the beck , to [[Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma 's parrot]1487-aunt emma 's parrot , [John Backhouse]66-john backhouse 's cows , to [Windermere Lake]52-windermere lake and [Rydal Lake]45-rydal lake , above all to [dear [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma [herself]59-aunt emma]1488-dear aunt emma herself .

" Mind [you]2922-you come at Christmas , "[198-the children] shouted both [the children]198-the children , as [the train]1540-the train moved away from [[Windermere]18-windermere station]406-windermere station and left [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma standing on [the platform]385-the platform ; and [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma nodded and smiled and waved [her]59-aunt emma handkerchief to [them]198-the children till [they]198-the children were quite out of sight .

" [Mother]1502-mother , "[83-milly] said [Milly]83-milly , when [they]198-the children could not see [Aunt Emma]59-aunt emma any more , and the last bit of [Brownholme]24-brownholme was slipping away , away , quite out of sight , " [I]24-brownholme think [Ravensnest]19-ravensnest is [the nicest place [we]198-the children ever stopped at]2924-the nicest place we ever stopped at . And [I]24-brownholme do n't think the rain matters either . [I]24-brownholme 'm going to tell [[your]1502-mother old gentleman]2925-your old gentleman so . [He]2925-your old gentleman said it rained in [the mountains]1534-the mountains , and it does , [mother]1502-mother -- doesn't it ? but [he]2925-your old gentleman said the rain spoilt everything , and it doesn't -- not a bit . "[24-brownholme]

" Why , there 's [that curious old fairy]2928-that curious old fairy been sprinkling dust in [your]1502-mother eyes too , [Milly]83-milly ! "[59-aunt emma]

But something or other had been sprinkling tears in [mother]1502-mother 's . For to [the old people]1494-the old people there is nothing sweeter than to see [the young ones]1495-the young ones opening [their]1495-the young ones hearts to all that [they]1495-the young ones [themselves]1495-the young ones have loved and rejoiced over . So the chain of life goes on , and joy gives birth to joy and love to love .
